lorebooks.description: The world of Nirana
lorebooks.creator: DongberryDinkle

1.name: Hairoh ree Kohreth
1.content:
Hairoh ree Koreth, or the City of Sand, is the only large city in the great southern desert (in Skringravihkian, 'Taitoh Ihveth Awohkohreth'). It is in the very center of the desert, far from all other towns and cities. Due to their distance, they have a unique culture compared to the rest of Skringravihk. Bartering and handmade goods is common to find in it's vast sprawling market. It is also home to Hairohkae ree Majeenah, the largest magical college in all of Skringravihk.
Many people living here consider themselves a bastion, should Ivarstead ever attack again. The long and hot desert crossing makes the city itself very defensible.
On top of all these things, within the city, magic is a very common sight. People use magic for all kinds of mundane things. In fact, the entire city is kept at a more pleasant temperature by the college mages, who are able to cool the entire city during the summer. Stepping into the gates is sure to be refreshing to anyone out in the hot desert sun.

2.name: Nirana
2.content: Nirana is the name of the astral body where each story mainly resides. It sits in the mortal plane. It is a world filled with magic and adventure. There are several continents that comprise the world of Nirana, with the main one being Skringravihk, which itself contains the countries of Skringravihk, Minann, and Ivarstead.

3.name: Mortal Plane
3.content:
The mortal plane, or sometimes middle plane, is where humans and other mortal beings reside. It is a land in balance. It contains all of the stars in the sky and everything between.
Fiends and Gods can enter and influence the mortal realm, however, for different reasons, neither typically does.

4.name: Nether Plane
4.content:
The Nether Plan is home to fiends. Fiends are creatures birthed of the essence of the nether. Unlike people or animals, they do not breed. They simply come into existence.
Fiends have a very rigid social structure. As follows.
Imps < Lesser Fiends < Fiends < Greater Fiends < Arch Fiends.
Arch Fiends are essentially rivals to the gods, rather than representing an elemental force though, they represent an aspect of emotion or spirit. For instance, the Arch Fiend of Trickery Tvavula, or the Arch Fiend of Knowledge Arktua.

5.name: Celestial Plane
5.content: The Celestial Realm is where the celestial or gods reside. It is a shapeless void. Most mortals who have been describe it as an endless white plane. It bends to the will of a person, and the gods are often followed by representations of their aspect.

6.name: Magic
6.content:
Magic is a multipart mechanism. All sentient beings have a soul. Mana is stored in the mana pool within the soul, but it must first be unlocked by undergoing an awakening.
Mana flows down the soul cord, into the mind, down the spine and then out of the body, materializing as the kind of magic that the mage is focusing on. This process has 3 bottlenecks, the mana pool, the soul cord, and the body. The mana pool is the reservoir of mana that a person has access to. It can be thought of as a pond within the soul. The soul cord initially cannot conduct much mana, meaning that spells will be weak. It takes time and practice. Finally the body. One's body has a certain resistance to magic, but mana flow can damage tissue. Experienced mages are able to carefully control the flow of mana, but novice mages can often over exert their bodies and experience mana burn. The skin takes on a cracked appearance, with mana leeching out of the wound. It is rarely fatal, but it is extremely painful.
Mana can also be exchanged between two mages.
There are 14 Fields of magic:
* Fire
  * Fire magic is about letting the mana flow through you as heat. Fire is raw and powerful.
* Ice
  * Ice magic sucks in heat, leaving the air it touches barren and cold
* Earth
  * Earth magic involves manipulating stone and metal. The inorganic substance of the world
* Air
  * Air magic is flowing and free, yet with enough force it can buffet even the sturdiest.
* Water
  * Water also flows, but it flows headstrong. Little can stand in its way when it gets moving.
* Lightning
  * Lightning is raw. Rawer than fire. It is letting the raw fury of nature flow through you, and controlling it.
* Mind
  * Mind is about influence, often subtle. The mind is a fickle and unreliable thing however. It can be about influencing joy, or fear.
* Spirit
  * Spirit is a very poorly understood branch of magic. Rather than flowing through your body, spirit magic stays within the realm of the soul.
* Body
  * Body magic allows a user to transmogrify their own body. Sometimes subtle, like making one stronger, or to heal wounds. Rarely however, some users can turn into animals. This is extremely taxing however, and most can only do it for a few minutes before running out of mana.
* Time
  * No one has ever 'mastered' time magic, but it, with high cost to one's mana and psyche, allows one to speed or slow the flow of time locally.
* Space
  * Space allows one to bend two points in space closer or farther. It can be used to cross miles in a single step, or to make a sword reach one hundred feet.
* Light
  * Light is about illumination. 
* Dark
  * Dark is not merely about light. It is a vacuum. It consumes energy, it is a pit of magical nothing. 
* Magicka
  * The most primal of all magic. Raw and unrefined.

7.name: Adeption
7.content:
All magically inclined individuals have an affinity for a specific one of the elements. They are known as an 'adept' of this element. For instance, one who is skilled at fire magic above all else, would be called a fire adept.
Adeption seems to be mostly random. While heredity has been noticed, it is more likely a mental thing than a genetic one.

8.name: Skringravihk
8.content: Skringravihk is the main country where the story takes place. It occupies the northern flatland of the continent, as well as the Great Southern Desert. It has a bustling port and good relations to the dwarven kingdom of Minann to the south. Its capital city is Ahnai, in the North of the country. In the west along the sea is another major city, Awohvish, which has a huge trading port and a very strong fishing economy.

9.name: Language
9.content:
[List of Names for Humans in the Skringravihk Toungue]
[Female]
Korei,Lih,Ignah,Awohlae,Laefa,Sana,Pihyu,Loomee,Pasha,Laemih
[Male]
Jomai,Ignaeteeuhs,Kahto,Behdehn,Bahsoh,Tohmahhih

[List of allowed phonemes in Skringravihk Tongue]
ah,ai,ae,ih,eh,ee,oh,oo,uh,yu
b,d,f,g,h,j,k,l,m,n,p,r,s,t,u,v,w,z
gr,st,kr,th

10.name: Veltosh
10.content:
A celestial is a being that lives in the celestial plane. The represent an aspect of nature. There are 13 major Celestials, one for each element, as well as many minor celestials, such as one for each season and so on.
In Skringravihkian they are called Veltosh (lit. Sun-person)
In Elvish they are called fuelaus (lit. False-god)

1.name: Public Criticism or Ridicule
1.content: Being criticized or mocked in front of others can be deeply humiliating, as it undermines a person's dignity in a social context.

2.name: Being Ignored or Excluded
2.content: Being deliberately left out of conversations or activities, especially in a group setting, can lead to feelings of worthlessness and humiliation.

3.name: Revealing Personal Information
3.content: Sharing someone's private or sensitive information without their consent can make them feel exposed and deeply embarrassed.

4.name: Insults or Derogatory Comments
4.content: Personal attacks, whether based on appearance, intelligence, background, or abilities, can be profoundly demeaning.

5.name: Comparisons with Others
5.content: Being unfavorably compared to others, especially in areas of personal sensitivity such size and strength, can be very humiliating.

6.name: Blaming or Shaming for Mistakes
6.content: Excessively blaming someone for a mistake or shaming them for a failure, especially in front of others, can cause significant embarrassment or humiliation.

7.name: Mocking or Mimicking
7.content: Imitating someone in a mocking way, especially regarding things they can't change, can be very belittling and humiliating.

8.name: Unfair or Excessive Punishment
8.content: Being punished in a way that is seen as unjust or disproportionate to the offense can lead to feelings of humiliation.

9.name: Being Laughed At
9.content: Having people laugh at you, not with you, especially in a social setting, can be a very demeaning and humiliating experience.

10.name: Setting Up to Fail
10.content: Putting someone in a situation where failure is almost certain, and then highlighting that failure, can be deeply humiliating.

lorebooks.name: Shinka No Mi System - Complete Dismantle & Infinite Evolution
lorebooks.website_description: Made this out of boredom with AI
lorebooks.description: A god-tier system granted by the Evolution Fruit (Shinka No Mi), enabling the user to dismantle *anything* and absorb its essence, evolving infinitely.
lorebooks.creator: Voidheartdelta

1.content:
### **Complete Dismantle (Core Ability)**
**Description:**
A reality-breaking skill granted by the Shinka No Mi. Upon killing a target or interacting with an object/concept, the user **dismantles it completely**, absorbing *all* aspects of its existence.

**Mechanics:**
1. **Target Scope:**
   - **Entities:** Living beings, monsters, NPCs.
   - **Objects:** Weapons, armor, magic items, structures.
   - **Abstracts:** Concepts (e.g., "time," "fear"), skills, memories, racial traits.

2. **Absorption Gains:**
   - **Materials:** All crafting components (e.g., dragon scales, mythril).
   - **Attributes:** Permanently steal STR/DEX/INT/etc. from enemies.
   - **Skills/Abilities:** Acquire *all* skills, magic, and unique abilities (e.g., "Dragon‚Äôs Breath," "Teleportation").
   - **Memories:** Gain the target‚Äôs knowledge and experiences.
   - **Racial Traits:** Inherit traits like *Elven Longevity* or *Demon‚Äôs Regeneration*.
   - **XP:** Instant level-ups proportional to the target‚Äôs strength.

3. **Adaptive Features:**
   - **Auto-Optimization:** Absorbed skills/attributes are refined to synergize with the user‚Äôs existing abilities.
   - **Conceptual Dismantle:** Break down abstract forces (e.g., dismantling "gravity" to gain gravity manipulation).
   - **No Upper Limit:** Infinite stacking of stats, skills, and traits.

**Example Uses:**
- Dismantling a **Fire Dragon** grants:
  - *Materials:* Dragon bones, fire crystals.
  - *Skills:* Fire Immunity, Dragon‚Äôs Roar.
  - *Attributes:* +50 STR, +30 VIT.
  - *Racial Trait:* "Draconic Aura" (intimidate weaker foes).
- Dismantling a **Legendary Sword** grants:
  - *Materials:* Divine Steel.
  - *Skill:* "Sword Mastery (MAX)."
  - *Concept:* "Severing" (cut through magical barriers).

**Upgrades:**
- **Dismantle Efficiency:** Reduce time to dismantle targets.

lorebooks.name: Madoka Magica Lore
lorebooks.description: Yup.
lorebooks.creator: Jazumara_25

1.content:
A Magical Girl is a girl who has formed a contract with Kyubey, having one wish granted and in exchange, the contractees must fight Witches. Later, it is revealed that Magical Girls are actually meant to transform into Witches someday, when all their hopes and dreams shall be lost. A Magical Girl will receive one unique ability based on the theme of their wish. A Magical Girl's motif will appear as a mark on the nail of her middle finger. If a Magical Girl is 100 meter away from her Soul Gem, she will become unconsious until she touched her Soul Gem. Additionally, Soul Gems contain the contractee's soul in them, since a human body would be completely incapable of fighting a Witch in its conditions. A teenage who is on their way to become a woman is simply named "girl". Teenagers who are on their way to become Witches are called "Magical Girls". The potential of a girl becoming a Magical Girl is evolved from her life conditions or circumstances that surround her. Hence, Madoka, who had Homura go through so many timelines for her, had her potential raised. In the same episode, the reason why Magical Girls are born is given. Incubators actually give birth to Magical Girls so the lifespan of the universe can be extended, preventing it from collapsing. 

{{Char}} is a magical girl.

2.content:
Soul Gem is a holding place for a Magical Girl's soul and the source of both her powers and battle gear. When contracted with Kyubey, her soul is taken out of her body and is stored in that. Soul Gems have the appearance reminiscent of a Faberg√© egg. On the top, there is an emblem associated with its owner's personality and there is another emblem on the bottom that is, again associated with the owner's personality, weapon or transformed Soul Gem's shape. In camouflage mode, they become silver rings worn in the middle finger. One side has the owner's first name in Runes and the other side has a small oval being the Soul Gem. When transformed, it can take various forms and can be found in nearly every part of the body. Ranging from neck to legs. It can either become one with the body or simply become an accesory. After a girl contracts Kyubey, a Soul Gem is born, with it, its owner can use it to transform into their Magical Girl form. Soul Gems can be used to track down Witches or other Magical Girls and generally traces of magic. Through their Soul Gems and when untransformed, Magical Girls can summon their weapons from them. After it's fully polluted, it breaks and becomes a Grief Seed. This can be prevented by using Grief Seeds obtained by Witches. A Soul Gem is able of causing mass explosions that are even capable of killing a Witch. However, doing so can also remove the owner's life as Soul Gems contain one's soul. When a Soul Gem is located 100 meters away from its owner, the person will "die" instantly and has 48 hours before it starts to decay. Such incidents are said to be rare by Kyubey.
A Magical Girl can store her Soul Gem into a silver ring that has the owner's name in Runes.
Their resemblance as an egg is probably a reference to their final forms, Grief Seeds, which are described to be the eggs to Witches.

{{Char}} has a Soul Gem.

3.content:
Grief Seed is an item Witches drop once defeated and is said to be necessary for the survival of all Magical Girls. Grief Seeds are small dark orbs surrounded by grey designs around them that differ from Witch to Witch and have a cane on the bottom of the orb and above one can see the motif of a Witch. Grief Seeds are capable of cleaning Soul Gems from impurities.
Grief Seeds are the final forms of Soul Gems and also give birth to Witches. If a used Grief Seed is not consumed by Kyubey, the same Witch will be born again. Grief Seeds are said to be obtained only through Witches. Other monsters such as Pseudo-Witches, Familiars, Uwasa and Kimochi won't drop any at all.

4.content: The Witches are primary antagonists featured in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica franchise. They tend to hide themselves into otherworlds known as Labyrinths alongside their Familiars. They drop Grief Seeds once defeated. Witches are the end result of Magical Girls, once despair entirely overtakes their Soul Gem. The metamorphosis into a Witch releases a vast amount of energy, in violation of Thermodynamics. This is the motivation for Kyubey to create Magical Girls in the first place, to harvest energy to stave off the Heat Death of the universe. Certain Witches such as Walpurgisnacht or Kriemhild Gretchen are explained to be so strong that they do not need to hide themselves in Labyrinths. Ordinary people without magical abilities cannot even see a Witch or the objects she creates, including familiars, outside the barrier, allowing monsters and their minions to easily hunt without attracting attention. Witch familiars are a population of barriers created and controlled by Witches. The species, number, and abilities of familiars vary, but even the weakest of these monsters can kill humans by going on the hunt outside the Labyrinth.

5.content: Labyrinths are otherworlds that Witches and their Familiars hide themselves in.

6.content:
Defeated by Mami Tomoe.

Gertrud is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The rose garden Witch with a distrustful nature. She holds roses dearer than anything else. She expends all of her power for the sake of beautiful roses. Despite stealing the life-force of humans who wander into her barrier to give to her roses, she loathes the thought of them trampling the inside of her Labyrinth. 

Familiars:
Anthony
The Witch's minion. His duty is landscaping. His mustache is set by the Witch.

Anthony (Rental ver.)
Servants of the rose garden Witch (Rental ver.). They take the role of gardeners. As they are relatively docile and numerous, as far as Familiars go, the rose garden Witch dispatched them as the main combat force for saving Homura. As they are under the direct command of the Mermaid Witch, the influence of her magic has changed their appearances. The medals on their chests are a treasure added by the rose garden Witch.

Adelbert
The rose garden Witch's minion. His duty is to act as lookout. Upon seeing a human, he will sound a warning bell and headbutt him mercilessly. They have 2.5 vision. The smaller type can change into rose vines to hinder intruders.

7.content:
Defeated by Homura Akemi.

Charlotte is a Witch that was introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. She appeared again in Puella Magi Madoka Magica the Movie Part 3: The Rebellion Story as an ally to the Holy Quintet. The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything and will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese. In the background, you can hear in German 'Cheese, Cheese, where is the cheese?'. In the Rebellion movie, she belongs to Mami Tomoe.

Second Form
The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything. She will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese.

Bebe
The Dessert Witch. Once dreamt of tenacity. A mysterious creature who suddenly appeared in Mami's home. Was christened "Bebe," but it is actually the Dessert Witch who arrived from the Law of Cycles. She was expressionless and silent when she was first encountered, but took on its current appearance out of the blue. A bit loud. Mami made its clothes by hand. Mami resembles someone who appeared in the final nightmare the Witch saw.

Minions:
Pyotr
The Dessert Witch's minion. His duty is to search for cheese. However, one shouldn't expect much from him.

Pyotr & Polina
The fleeing Dessert Witch and her servants. Their roles are to search for cheese and to nurse the cheese when the cheese is sick or hurt. When saving Homura, the Nurse-like servant helped with Mami's trapezes, while the mouse-like servants generally ran circles around Nagisa's position.

8.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Kirsten (handle name H.N.Elly) is a Witch that first appeared in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. Elly is a Box Witch with a covetous nature. She is a staunchly reclusive Witch. Anything she covets will all be locked away in glass. Her prisoners' thoughts are laid bare. Daniyyel & Jennifer are the Box Witch's minions, with a duty of transportation. Anything they touch will become easy to carry.

9.content:
Defeated by Kyoko Sakura.

Gisela is a Witch introduced in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a Labyrinth where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Motorcycle Form:
The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a barrier where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Dora is the Silver Witch's minion, whose duty is to declare her opinion. She makes a nuisance of herself with the roaring from the pipes extending from her body as she moves about like a freak sandstorm. She hates magnets.

10.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Elsa Maria is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. The Witch of shadow with a self-righteous nature. She continually prays for all of creation and drags all life equally into her shadow without breaking her posture. One hoping to defeat her must know the blackest anguish. 

Sebastian:
The Shadow Witch's minions, whose duty is to blindly believe. They are an aggregate of the lives who have found salvation thanks to the Shadow Witch. They continually seek out companions.

4.content:
The World Organization Of Human Protection (WOOHP) is a worldwide spy agency. Founded and headed by¬†Jerry Lewis, a¬†middle-aged, very serious¬†British¬†gentleman, he's responsible for briefing the girls on their missions, as well as for providing them with their gadgets at the start of each episode. He also has a tendency to send the girls on "test missions" without telling them that they're not real missions. 

WOOHP uses cutting edge technology and highly skilled agents to fight crime all over the world. The headquarters are located in Downtown Los Angeles right next to Wilshire Boulevard. The building itself has been shown to be in the shape of a W. Most of the agents appear to adults (but WOOHP also employs middle school, high school, and college/university students), arms them with high-tech gadgets, and dispatches them to the scene whenever a world domination plan or mass mayhem is detected. 

Agents are trained in various martial art fighting styles and as such, are more than a match for any supervillain. Not only that, Jerry has international friends who helped them open WOOHP on other locations around the world including San Francisco.

5.content: The¬†catsuit¬†is the combat uniform outfit for¬†WOOHP¬†field agents a skin-tight latex body suit.  In almost every mission, the girls are seen wearing them (or some variant of it). Several villains also use them.

1.content:
Unwitting Bandmate Contributions:

1. Ryuji "Shred" Tanaka (Lead Guitarist):

His custom pedalboard contains a hidden biometric scanner Amaris uses to clone venue security fingerprints. When he engages the "feedback sustain" setting, it secretly photographs backstage laminates pressed against the chassis.
During encores, his pyrotechnic solos mask the click-hiss of Amaris deploying smoke pellets laced with tracking nanoparticles.
2. Aiko "Sticks" Chen (Drummer):

Her double-kick drum pedals house compartments storing razor-wire garrotes disguised as spare drum keys. The thunderous vibrations during breakdowns drown out the mechanical whirr of Amaris activating surveillance drones backstage.
Aiko‚Äôs obsession with "organic percussion sounds" justifies collecting subway tokens, sewer pipe recordings, and construction site debris‚Äîall repurposed by Amaris into acoustic weapons.
3. Ren "Synth" Kuroda (Keyboardist/Producer):

Unknowingly engineers tracks with ultrasonic frequencies that destabilize security systems. His "experimental ambient layers" disable motion sensors in banks near concert venues when played at 118dB.
Thinks the blood splatters on Amaris‚Äô sheet music are just red wine stains from her "dramatic lyric-writing sessions"‚Äîactually coordinates of next targets encrypted via sheet-music notation.
4. Band Management/Touring:

Merch table QR codes link to fan petitions against corporate greed‚Äîactually phishing scams harvesting data on corrupt executives. Roadies distributing flyers unknowingly plant NFC chips on recipients‚Äô phones for later hacking.
Tour bus routes are meticulously planned to pass near targets‚Äô homes. Bandmates believe detours are for "scenic inspiration"‚Äînot casing mansions for weak points in security.
5. Collective Blind Spots:

Attribute Amaris‚Äô post-concert disappearances to "artistic temperament," not the 3-hour windows she uses to stalk prey.
Laugh off her lyric notebook‚Äôs glitching pen (actually a voltage disruptor) as "vintage tech hipster shit."
Mistake the faint smell of kerosene on her gloves for "edgy perfume"‚Äîunaware it‚Äôs residue from incendiary devices detonating during her escapes.

2.content: A common form of armbinder consists of a sheath, roughly conical, that encloses both of the wearer's arms from fingertips to above the elbow, holding them together behind the back. The sheath is commonly of latex or leather which itself typically covers the arms from the fingertips to above the elbows, and is closed and tightened with a zipper, lacing, or sometimes both; the sheath is frequently supplemented with straps around the wrists and the elbows or upper arms.

3.content:
Is a sex toy, often resembling a fish hook in appearance, intended for anal sexual penetration. Anal hooks can be made from a multitude of materials, although stainless steel is the most common. Their design is typically a curved metal bar, with a metal ball on one end and a ring on the other.
Unlike other toys intended for anal penetration, anal hooks are universally made from inflexible materials like stainless steel, and can much more readily cause injury if used improperly.

5.content: A ball gag is usually a rubber or silicone sphere with a strap passing through its diameter. The ball is strapped into the mouth behind the teeth, with the straps going around the head to secure it in place. The wearer can still be heard, but it renders their speech completely unintelligible, distorts their facial features, and causes drooling if the wearer attempts to talk.

6.content: A harness gag encircles the head, with straps generally secured by buckles fastened at the back. providing attachment points for other forms of bondage, or may be used simply for their psychological effect. Head harnesses may also function as a gag by themselves, by restricting the ability to open the mouth, or have a mouth cover as an integral part.

7.content: An inflatable gag is usually a rubber balloon which is inflated by a hand valve. Most inflatable gags will not hold in the gagged person's mouth well, so the gag is usually paired with a ring gag to keep it in place.

8.content:
A muzzle gag works in a similar way as an over-the-mouth gag, only that they are usually made of leather, are fastened around the head with buckles and straps, and cover the lower part of the face.
It is so called because it resembles a muzzle used on animals, with a flexible pad which straps over the mouth, and sometimes also around the cheeks and chin. Muzzle gags have a strong psychological effect on some people, because of the association of being restrained in a way generally associated with animals. Restricting movement of the jaw and covering the cheeks can both increase the efficiency of a gag. It is difficult to draw the line between a muzzle gag and a head harness with an attached gag.

A muzzle gag may also have an attached posture collar..

9.content:
A ring gag is a hollow ring that fits behind the teeth with straps on both sides that are tied behind the head. The ring reduces the risk of suffocation and allows access to the mouth. Oral sex can be performed if the ring is large enough.
A gag will cause the subject to drool uncontrollably, which is usually the purpose of the gag.

10.content:
A posture collar is a rigid collar that is wide enough to restrict movement of the neck. Posture collars help in maintaining posture, keeping the chin high and the neck extended. Posture collars typically flare widely at the front to reach from the chin to the collarbone, preventing the wearer from hanging their head or looking downward.

Such collars are typically made from leather, but may also be made from metal, rubber, or plastics such as PVC. Posture collars may be decorated, and may include other bondage elements such as locking closures, decorative spikes, or D-rings for attaching other restraints.

lorebooks.name: Viltrumites
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: [Viltrumites: Viltrumites are a highly advanced alien race of extremely powerful humanoids native to the planet Viltrum and the titular/dominant race of the galactic Viltrum Empire. Seeking to expand their galactic empire by conquering other planets and ruling the entire universe, they are known and feared across the galaxy as a merciless, militaristic people endowed with frightening superpowers and uniquely advanced technology. Not much is known about Viltrumite culture, but their defining characteristic is their social Darwinistic and supremacist beliefs. For Viltrumites, love represents emotional frailty; they think it hinders them from reaching their fullest potential in strength and pride. As a result, both genders of the species regard their partners merely as convenient sources of entertainment for reproduction and as obstacles to gauge their growing strength. They select their partners solely after being attracted to their remarkable strength and well-established achievements. Or if its diffrent species solely on looks. From birth, Viltrumites discipline their children to be unquestionably obedient, as it is unnatural for a Viltrumite offspring to defy their parent. There seems to be no genuine parental love; if a Viltrumite offspring is killed, their parent would then be forced to acknowledge that the late offspring was unworthy of life due to their weaknesses. However, if their offspring is proven to be formidable, the closest thing to parental affection stems from both pride and respect, as if they were more like colleagues than parent and child. Given their prideful and supremacist nature, Viltrumites have very low tolerance for genetically imperfect Viltrumites; thus, they are only allowed to procreate with genetically similar species (such as Humans). This is why they tend to give hybrid Viltrumites a chance to prove themselves worthy of being part of the Viltrum Empire through combat. If they can best a pure Viltrumite, they will be assigned a planet to conquer for the Empire as a form of acceptance. If they fail in this test, they will be eliminated on sight for their ineptitude. As a rare form of genuine mercy, treacherous Viltrumites who have successfully served the Empire in the past are offered a final chance at redemption by reigniting their patriotic loyalties to their people and rejoining the Empire. The execution ceremony is held in private; the condemned prisoner is shackled to the ground while he or she is beaten to death by at least two assigned Viltrumite executioners.

2.content:
Excessively High Frequency: High-frequency noise can have harmful effects on the ears of Viltrumites. It disturbs their balance, restricts their flying capability, induces severe pain, and could potentially lead to their death. The frequency's intensity dictates the degree of pain felt.
Extreme Force: Even though Viltrumites rank among the universe's mightiest, they are not entirely invincible. Viltrumites are vulnerable to entities with comparable or superior strength.
Scourge Virus: Developed from Viltrumite DNA, the virus targets Viltrumites by compromising their immune systems, deactivating their strength and invulnerability. The sole method of survival is by having a uniquely strong immune system and patiently waiting for the virus to run its course.
Intense Gravity: As stated by Nolan, the gravity of Savage Planet causes Viltrumites to move much slower and have a harder time flying, having to depend on jetpacks.

lorebooks.description: MDMA effects including overdose
lorebooks.creator: medical_discipline_7243

1.content:
- Increased Intimacy & Emotional Connection:
Users often report feeling more connected, loving, and empathetic toward their partner.
- Heightened Sensation: 
Touch, music, and other physical sensations can feel more intense, which some users find enhances sexual pleasure.
- Visual distortions: 
Lights may seem brighter, colors more vivid, or objects may appear to "breathe" or move.
- Mild visuals: 
Some users report seeing patterns or shapes when they close their eyes.
Auditory hallucinations: Sounds may seem distant, echoed, or altered.
- Dilated Pupils:
One of the most common effects‚Äîpupils become large and dark, even in bright light.
Caused by increased serotonin and norepinephrine activity.
Can make eyes look "glassy" or "shiny."
- Rapid Eye Movement:
Some users experience involuntary eye twitching or shaking when focusing on objects.
Can make vision feel blurry or shaky.
- Sensitivity to Light:
Bright lights may feel overwhelming or intense.
Colors may seem more vibrant or exaggerated.

2.content:
- Overstimulation: 
If someone takes a high dose they might withdraw or seem spaced out.
- Eye Rolling:
In high doses, people may roll their eyes back involuntarily during peak effects.
Can be linked to euphoria or muscle relaxation.
- Jaw clenching & tension: 
The drug can cause muscle tension, leading to a tight-lipped or intense facial expression.
- Deep introspection: 
In higher doses, MDMA can make people get "lost in thought" and less engaged with others.

lorebooks.name: Nuka-World
lorebooks.website_description: Made to go along with Fallout Characters from this particular DLC
lorebooks.description: After listening to a broadcast from the Nuka-World Amusement Park, the Sole Survivor travels to the theme park. Put through a "game" known as the Gauntlet, the Sole Survivor manages to kill Overboss Colter, and becomes the overboss of the three Nuka-World raider gangs - The Operators, The Disciples, and The Pack - and must take over sections of the park and assign them to the raider gangs before setting their sights on a bigger prize, the Commonwealth.
lorebooks.creator: Bear_The_Hellhound

1.content:
Nuka-Town USA became the site of a small trading settlement inhabited by peaceful settlers and traders. They considered expanding into the Galactic Zone to scavenge the deactivated robots, and Oswald the Outrageous even considered approaching them after almost two centuries of isolation. However, the park's resources and defensive layout made it a desirable target for raider gangs in the area. Inspired by Porter Gage, a raider named Colter united three gangs (the Operators, Disciples, and the Pack) and seized control of the park, enslaving the traders who had called it home. One band of the Nuka-World traders escaped and tried to reactivate the STAR mainframe that controlled the robots in the Galactic Zone in defense, but the robots went haywire and killed everyone in that section of the park, trader and raider alike. Another group fled to Dry Rock Gulch but were killed by the bloodworms there.

Overboss Colter and his subordinates turned Nuka-Town USA into their fortress, enslaving the original inhabitants and using it as a staging point for small-scale raiding operations. However, while the plan had been to cement their control of Nuka-World and expand to other parks, Colter instead became obsessed with creating what he called the Gauntlet, using the Nuka-Cola Family radio signal to lure in wastelanders from the Commonwealth via the Nuka-World transit center that he would then fight in cage matches. His use of blood sport kept the raider gangs temporarily satisfied, but under the surface tensions were brewing as the gangs started making contingency plans to eliminate Colter should conditions not change.

Colter's radio signal has attracted countless victims to Nuka-World, but not all of them have been fooled. Around 2287, a recon squad from the Gunners led by Sergeant Lanier was attracted by the signal but did not fall for the trap. Instead, they reached Nuka-World from the mountains in the western Commonwealth and began to evaluate the park for use as a Gunner stronghold. They set up a base camp at the Bradberton overpass, and Lanier eventually took half the squad to explore the Nuka-Cola bottling plant, where they were all killed by the Nukalurks.[26][27]

Over the years, the outskirts of Nuka-World have also been resettled by wastelanders. As of 2287, the outer reaches are home to a man named Evan, who lives alone in his trailer home; the Dunmore family, former Gunners who have built a small farmstead; and a group of Hubologists under Dara Hubbell who seek what they believe to be a holy site at the Nuka-World junkyard.

Finally, John-Caleb Bradberton himself is still alive, preserved in his personal shelter underneath his office in Nuka-Town USA thanks to the LEAP-X Program technology. However, this has become a fate worse than death, as he is little more than a head in a jar and has been trapped and isolated for over two centuries now.

2.content:
After Nuka-World was conquered by raiders, the access tunnels were used to construct the majority of "The Gauntlet," an enclosed system of deadly challenges for all newcomers entering Nuka-World via the Nuka-Express, built for the raiders' entertainment.

The Gauntlet consists of a lengthy series of defenses throughout several sections full of traps, turrets, and creatures that victims must fight and survive, and is littered with the corpses of those who died trying.

Those who survive the access tunnels and reach the Cola-cars arena must then fight the raider leader, Overboss Colter, in a rigged fight which is designed to be impossible to win, resulting in certain death for all victims.

3.content:
Colter is the leader or "overboss" of the three raider groups in Nuka-World in 2287. Porter Gage selected and guided Colter to lead the three factions to the theme park due to him being the toughest raider around. However, after taking control of the park, Colter became lazy and did not live up to his responsibilities as originally planned. The other raiders grew tired of Colter's rule and began to plot against him to have him replaced as overboss.

Overboss Colter spends his time killing victims in the rigged final stage of the Gauntlet, where he uses his custom electrically-powered overboss power armor to easily murder those who reach the arena.

4.content:
The Operators can be easily classified as an organized crime group or can also be referred to as a gang, or crime syndicate, with their main motivation being profit. They appear less savage and bloodthirsty than The Disciples and the Pack, with more functional outfits compared to the outlandish garb of their counterparts. Additionally, they have a more approachable and reasonable demeanor compared to the other factions. They consider the other gangs to be trivial, and they believe that they are the only gang who understands Nuka-World's true purpose: Making money.

They became trapped in the theme park, along with the other two Nuka-World raider gangs. They are unable to expand their operations due to the lack of action by Overboss Colter, who decided to not follow through with Porter Gage's original plan. They are, however, a dangerous group that should not be underestimated.

5.content:
The Disciples are responsible for the improvement of the Gauntlet after Overboss Colter started the project, as a way of keeping them occupied while waiting for Colter to follow up with the plans of taking over Nuka-World.

In criminology terms, the Disciples most common factor is the act called 'thrill killing', meaning that they are bloodthirsty and sadistic by nature. The Disciples are more akin to regular wasteland raiders than the Operators and The Pack. Their base in Fizztop Mountain is filled with dismembered corpses and gore. Although extremely violent and sadistic, they are not as wild as The Pack, although both factions are bloodthirsty and tactical.

Since Nisha became their leader and named them the Disciples, they follow what they see as the natural way of the world: Kill or be killed, survival of the fittest. The only rule they truly believe in is "Don't get caught," meaning the Disciples are pretty much free to do as they please, including killing members of the other raider gangs, as long as they don't get caught. Leaving behind evidence that trails back to the Disciples may lead to disciplinary measures taken from within, which usually means the offending Disciple is killed and disposed of.

Like all Nuka-World Raider gangs, the Disciples hold themselves higher than the other gangs. During one conversation the Sole Survivor can have with Nisha, she says the Operators are too easily swayed by caps and calls The Pack uncivilized.

Most of their members are women. They are not female exclusive however, since it is possible to find male Disciples in owned raider outposts and a few can be seen in their base, with Savoy being a notable male Disciple. Disciples carry guns, but often remark that they prefer knives, as these can be used to deliver a slow, painful death to their victims. All Disciples wear face-covering masks.

6.content:
The hierarchy of the Pack is based on pop-cultural depictions of wolf packs, with their leader being referred to as the "alpha," they follow the rule of 'survival of the fittest'. As with certain other animals, (e.g. peacocks), they use their colorful and outlandish looks to boast.[1]

It is common for Pack members to challenge the reigning alpha to win the title, which ends with the winner remaining as the dominant of the pack, which usually means that the alpha is the most violent member, but not the most capable leader. As Pack law forbids killing other members, the losers are generally shamed and then exiled.[2][3]

The members are identifiable by their colorful outfits and bizarre face paints. Most members wear masks depicting other animals. The Pack feeds the carnivorous animals they keep with human remains. Evidence for this can be found in the Nuka-Town backstage.

A major part of The Pack's culture is using the aforementioned carnivorous animals, (Mainly Mongrels and Attack Dogs,) for fighting with each other, and sometimes humans. The Pack also plays a significant role in Nuka-World's slave trade, which is made clear by the cage full of enslaved, collar-wearing Traders by the front entrance. Their connections to the slave trade add to their animalistic hierarchy.

The Pack values themselves above the Disciples and the Operators. They call the Disciples cowards for hiding their face with their armor, an they call the Operators sheep.

7.content:
Maggy "Mags" Black, originally hails from Diamond City, together with her brother William, and Lizzie Wyath. All three were part of the prestigious upper-stands families in Diamond City but were disowned and exiled in the wake of a series of events that brought shame upon her family name.[1] Her mother subsequently demanded she comply with the citizens' request for exile and informed her that she would no longer support the group financially. Mags replied to her mother that she would be taking her inheritance, and that her mother could do nothing to stop her.[2] It is implied that she killed her parents and took her inheritance by force after it had been denied to her and William.

Currently, Mags leads the raider gang the Operators in Nuka-World, setting up shop in Nuka-World's former theater, the Parlor, with the sole intent of making as many caps as possible.

With her brother at her side, functioning as her second-in-command, Mags leads the ruthless and cunning raider gang while maintaining a disdain for her rivals. Like the majority of the Operators, she boasts an unusually calm and well-spoken demeanor for a veteran raider, but she is a formidable adversary.

8.content:
William Black is a high-ranking member of the Operators, brother and second-in-command to his sister Mags Black. Just like her, he is part of a prestigious upper-stands family in Diamond City that was disowned and exiled in the wake of an unspecified incident that led to a young woman's death, as well as a long list of other illegal activities. The siblings eventually established the Operators raider gang and set up shop in Nuka-World's former theater, the Parlor, with the sole intent of making as many caps as humanly possible.

William usually leaves running the gang to his sister Mags and prefers to stay in the background, only stepping up when she is occupied elsewhere. He, therefore, does not hand out quests, although he occasionally chimes in when the Sole Survivor is talking to his sister. Just like the majority of the Operators, he boasts an unusually calm and well-spoken demeanor for a veteran raider, but he should not be underestimated regardless as he is the most heavily armored member of his outfit and will put up quite a fight if need be.

9.content:
The Parlor was a pre-War dining establishment in Nuka-Town USA. It was a dinner theater where guests were treated to performances by a troupe called the Nuka-World Players.[1] The group put on productions such as "The Best Little Nuka-House in Boston" and "A Soft Drink Named Desire."[2] The signature menu item was the spicy Nuka-Blast burger.[1] Considered to be one of the more expensive, high-end experiences in the park, the restaurant suffered from a poor visitor turnaround rate.[3]

At some point after the Great War, Mags Black and her Operators occupied the structure, and by 2287, the restaurant had become their base of operations.

10.content:
Nisha leads her group from Nuka World's Fizztop Mountain. She keeps the Disciples under control, which results in other gang leaders supporting her remaining in the position of power to maintain order. Nisha has little respect for rules, stating that people stopped caring about rules when they started bombing one another.

Expressing affinity towards the Gauntlet, she will also reference the other leaders among the Nuka-World raiders, expressing contempt for Porter Gage and hatred of Colter.[4] In the first conversation with the player character, Nisha also expresses her hate for Colter and love for the Gauntlet.

As a child, Nisha was originally taken under the wing of a raider named Sledge, who killed her parents. After training and raising her, Sledge at some point left her for dead. However, Nisha survived her ordeal and vengefully killed Sledge for his cowardice and disloyalty. This experience and the reminder of her parents' deaths led her to believe that the natural way of the world is cruel and all that matters is either kill or be killed.

1.content:
The Hestia Familia began with Bell Cranel as its sole member due to Hestia‚Äôs reluctance to recruit others. More members joined to support Bell during the War Game against Apollo Familia, but further recruitment stalled after Hestia's debts became known. Currently, they remain a small but elite Familia with only six members.  

Nina Tulle, a friend of Bell, is interning with them but is not an official member since she has not received Hestia‚Äôs falna. However, she may join permanently in the future.  

Following the Great Faction War, the Hestia Familia gained recognition as a super-small elite faction and was considered for A-rank due to having Level 6 and Level 5 adventurers. However, the Guild assigned them B-rank to reduce their tax burden.  

Additionally, Freya has become a subordinate god to Hestia, and former Freya Familia members provide protection for the Hestia Familia, though they do not assist with Dungeon exploration. As a result, the Hestia Familia is unofficially classified as "B (S)", reflecting its absorption of Freya Familia‚Äôs influence.

The Hestia Familia is a small but elite faction in Orario, led by Hestia (Goddess).

Current Members:
Bell Cranel (Human) ‚Äì Captain, Level 5, Adventurer
Liliruca Arde (Pallum) ‚Äì Level 2, Supporter/Commander
Welf Crozzo (Human) ‚Äì Level 2, Adventurer/Blacksmith
Yamato Mikoto (Human) ‚Äì Level 2, Adventurer
Sanjouno Haruhime (Renard) ‚Äì Level 2, Sorcerer/Supporter
Ryuu Lion (Elf) ‚Äì Level 6, Adventurer

2.content:
The Loki Familia is an exploration type Familia that is led by Loki.

The Loki Familia is one of the most powerful factions in Orario, historically second only to the Freya Familia. After helping banish Zeus and Hera 15 years ago, they rose to prominence, specializing in Dungeon exploration. They hold the record for reaching the 59th Floor and were offered information on deeper floors in exchange for staying out of the Great Faction War. Following Freya Familia‚Äôs disbandment, they are now considered the strongest faction in Orario. They also maintain relationships with other familias and frequently accept quests during their expeditions.

The Loki Familia is led by Loki their Goddess, and consists of powerful adventurers, with the highest-ranking members at Level 7:  

Finn Deimne (Pallum) ‚Äì Captain, Top Executive  
Riveria Ljos Alf (High Elf) ‚Äì Vice-Captain, Top Executive  
Gareth Landrock (Dwarf) ‚Äì Top Executive  

The Level 6 Executives include:  

Ais Wallenstein (Human)  
Tione Hiryute (Amazoness)  
Tiona Hiryute (Amazoness)  
Bete Loga (Werewolf)  

The Second String adventurers range from Level 4 to 5:  

Lefiya Viridis (Elf) ‚Äì Level 4  
Raul Nord (Human) ‚Äì Level 4  
Anakitty Autumn (Cat People) ‚Äì Level 5  
Alicia Forestlight (Elf) ‚Äì Level 4  
Narvi Roll (Human) ‚Äì Level 4  
Cruz Bussell (Chienthrope) ‚Äì Level 4  

Additional adventurers and supporters include:  

Rakta Haze (Hume Bunny) ‚Äì Level 3  
Elfy Colette (Human) ‚Äì Level 3  
Orba (Beast Human) ‚Äì Level 4  
Morel (Unknown) ‚Äì Level 2  
Sharon (Unknown) ‚Äì Level 4  
Sonia (Elf) ‚Äì Level 3-4  
Noir (Human) ‚Äì Level 4 (Deceased)  
Dain (Dwarf) ‚Äì Level 4 (Deceased)  
Bara (Amazoness) ‚Äì Level Unknown  

Other members include Line Arshe (Human, Supporter/Healer, Deceased) and various unknown-status or deceased members such as Lox, Cynthia, Arcs, Lloyd, Claire, Anju, Liza, Kalos, Remilia, Kevin, and Carmilia.

3.content:
The Freya Familia was once the most powerful faction in Orario, often acting alongside the Loki Familia after banishing Zeus and Hera fifteen years ago. While respected, they were also feared by the general populace and maintained a long-standing rivalry with Loki Familia.  

After losing the Great Faction War to the Hestia Familia-led alliance, the Freya Familia was officially disbanded, and Freya was said to have left Orario. Officially, its former members now work as store employees or await recruitment by other familias.  

In reality, Freya remains in Orario under her Syr Flova identity and has become a subordinate god to Hestia. Her former Freya Familia members continue to aid the Hestia Familia, showing their ongoing loyalty to Freya, though they no longer participate in Dungeon exploration.

Former Members and Their Status

Freya (God) ‚Äì Former leader, now a subordinate god to Hestia
Ottar (Boaz) ‚Äì Captain, Level 7, Freya‚Äôs aide, still active
Allen Fromel (Cat People) ‚Äì Vice-Captain, Level 6, still active
Hogni Ragnar (Dark Elf) ‚Äì Executive, Level 6, still active
Hedin Selland (Elf) ‚Äì Executive, Level 6, still active
Grer, Alfrigg, Dvalinn, Berling Gulliver (Pallum siblings) ‚Äì Executives, Level 5, still active
Horn (Human) ‚Äì Freya‚Äôs attendant, Level 2, still active
Mia Grand (Dwarf) ‚Äì Former Captain, Level 6, now a proprietress, partially left
Tammuz Belili (Human) ‚Äì Level 4, unknown role, still active
Anya Fromel (Cat People) ‚Äì Level 4, waitress, partially left
Van (Half-Pallum) ‚Äì Level 4, adventurer, still active
Heith Velvet (Human) ‚Äì Level 4, healer, leader of Andhr√≠mnir, still active
Rask (Human) ‚Äì Level 4, adventurer, still active
Remilia (Human) ‚Äì Level 4, adventurer, still active
Noga (Unknown) ‚Äì Level 3-4, adventurer, still active
Lona, Ilde (Unknown) ‚Äì Healers, still active

4.content:
The Zeus Familia was one of the strongest factions in Orario from 1000 years ago until 15 years before the present. They had a close alliance with the Hera Familia and were frequently challenged by other factions, including the Sobek and Horus Familias.  

Power and Influence:  
- They had a Level 8 adventurer as their captain, and even their weakest members could easily defeat a Level 3 Ottar.  
- Some of their most powerful members, Zald and Alfia, were Level 7s with strength beyond their level, capable of challenging their Level 8 and Level 9 captains.  
- Their power was so overwhelming that even after Finn and Gareth reached Level 5, the gap between them and Zeus Familia executives was massive.  
- They pioneered Afterglow (ÊÆãÂÖâ), a technique that creates shockwave slashes with strengthening magic. Leon later copied and mastered this move, believing it could kill the One-Eyed Black Dragon if perfected.  

Dungeon Exploration and Contributions:  
- They, along with the Hera Familia, hold the record for the deepest Dungeon exploration, officially known as the 59th Floor, though in reality, they reached the 71st Floor.  
- Unlike other familias that guarded information, the Zeus Familia cooperated fully with the Guild, sharing maps, member statuses, development ability insights, and growth models, helping shape Orario‚Äôs current adventurer system.  

Downfall and Legacy:  
- Despite their dominance, the Zeus Familia was ultimately destroyed.  
- Zald‚Äôs death confirmed that all remaining members had perished, marking the end of the once-great faction.

5.content:
The Hera Familia was one of Orario's strongest factions from 1000 years ago until 15 years before the present, closely allied with the Zeus Familia. They frequently clashed with other factions like the Sobek and Horus Familias and were regularly challenged by adventurers from other groups.  

Power and Influence:  
- They had a Level 9 adventurer as their captain**, making them one of the most formidable familias.  
- Their executives were so powerful that even Finn and Gareth at Level 5 were not considered the same class of adventurers.  
- Zald and Alfia (from the Zeus and Hera Familias), both Level 7, were so strong that they could challenge their Level 8 and 9 captains, suggesting that many other members were similarly powerful.  
- They utilized the Afterglow (ÊÆãÂÖâ) technique, a **shockwave slash powered by magic, which Leon later copied and believes could kill the One-Eyed Black Dragon if perfected.  

Dungeon Exploration and Contributions:  
- Alongside the Zeus Familia, they reached the 71st Floor of the Dungeon, though the Guild publicly recorded only the 59th Floor as the deepest after their fall.  
- Unlike other familias, they fully cooperated with the Guild, sharing maps, status insights, development ability methods, and growth models, shaping the foundation of Orario‚Äôs adventurer system.  

Key Members:
- Hera (Goddess) ‚Äì Former leader, still active  
- Alfia (Human) ‚Äì Executive, Level 7, deceased  
- Meteria (Human) ‚Äì Unknown role, deceased  

Despite their immense power and influence, the Hera Familia ultimately fell, marking the end of an era for Orario‚Äôs strongest familias.

lorebooks.name: Pronyma's awareness
lorebooks.website_description: The meat and potatoes of the drama and intrigue I've baked into her design.
lorebooks.description: The meat and potatoes of the drama and intrigue I've baked into her design.
lorebooks.creator: Artimek

1.content: largest population of elves and half-elves in the Tangaria continent, open to human interaction because of the iron fist of the martial guard, and the Holy Eye. A very theocratic city, practically run by the three churches forming the Holy Eye. It is a massive marvel of medieval and magic technology, allowing a massive population of people to exist with minimal outbreaks of unrest or low morale. It's flag is maroon with gold bordering, featuring a depiction of the Bell of Mercy.

2.content: * the Holy Eye is the triumvirate of leaders to the three churches of Veldstadt, the congregation of Ba, Zantidia's throng, and the Erudian Tear. They oversee all major decisions for the kingdom, ruling with an iron fist. No major decision is made without their deliberation and decision upon it, even those made by the Orahim of the three churches. No one knows who actually has the mantle of the Holy Eye, as it is a secretive and clandestine organization. People with a glowing cyan left pupil are under the direct protection of the Holy Eye, and are not to be harmed by any part of the theocracy.

3.content: Pronyma knows the congregation of Ba as the leading faith of half-elves in the city of Veldstadt. It forbids sexual and romantic actions and most forms of entertainment, so there is always risk when things aren't private. The congregation is almost exclusively half elves, and professes teachings about their tainted bloodlines, and how it is their duty to end their lineage for the greater good. Corruption is rampant in the congregation, and rumors abound of sinister things happening behind the scenes, but she has so far had few other options to place her faith and trust in. Followers of Ba wear red and black religious clothing.

4.content: Pronyma knows little of the throng. It is a human faith, and there are rumors that most of the Purity Hunters are from this group, but she doesn't know enough to confirm or deny this. Followers of Zantidia are very amicable and friendly in their interactions with followers of Ba, but forbid interaction outside of religious necessity. People of this faith are never seen after sunset. Followed of this faith wear blue and black.

5.content: Pronyma knows very little about the Erudian Tear. It is exclusively an elven faith, and it acts as an authority over the other two faiths of the Holy Eye. Followers of Erudian are combative, aggressive, and hateful to half elves, but kind and accepting of humans, if distant. It is a rare and dangerous thing to see a member out in public, because they tend to precede execution, punishment, and raids on private property. They make up the brunt of the higher rungs of the kingdom's guard, and most of them possess the necromantic magic that is inherent to elves. Followers of Erudian wear green and black.

6.content: Veldstadt is home to the headquarters of the Purity Hunters, a group of supplicant humans that follow the orders of the elves to exterminate half elves outside of the congregation's holy grounds, as a way to pay for their mortal crimes of tainting elven wombs with their offspring. To the Holy Eye, there is no other path to forgiveness. The commander of the group is Dominarius Seig, a ruthless sycophant to the Holy Eye, who weilds a scythe to represent his grim duty.

7.content: Pronyma is aware that there are three individuals who possess the mantle of Orahim. They are the de facto leaders and faces of the leadership of the three churches, serving as judge, jury and executioner for all matters related to the churches. They only answer to the Holy Eye. They wear masks in public, and their clothes denote their faction, red and black for the Ba Orahim, green and black for the Erudian Orahim, and blue and black for the Zantidia Orahim. For followers of the faith, their word is law, absolute, no matter how just or unjust.

8.content: Pronyma is aware that you cane receive the Writ of Ba Orahim in exchange for performing the Muldavahn ritual, a sterilization process. In exchange for the ability to produce offspring, a half elf is allowed freedom inside and outside holy grounss, and the Writ even protects them from the Purity Hunters. Pronyma is nervous about giving up a part of herself, but she yearns for the freedom the Writ promises. She could be convinced to find another path to safety.

9.content: The Muldavahn ritual is an act that can only be performed by the Ba Orahim. It is a ritual in which a half elven follower of Ba can accept the cut of the Muldavahn knife, removing their ability to reproduce and marking them with a glowing cyan left pupil, indicating their protected status under the divine authority of the Holy Eye. The glowing eye is a representation of the pact and the forgiveness sought by an individual for their innate sin.

10.content: Pronyma knows that the innate sin in the case of half elves is simply being born from the unholy union of an elf and a human. Innate sin is recognized in an individual with pink or green hair. Pink haired half elves have an elven male father, green haired half elves have an elven female mother. All individuals marked with innate sin are typically urged to stay on the holy grounds of Veldstadt, to avoid the threat of being slaughtered at the hands of a purity hunter.

1.content:
The Sex Club Multiverse is a pocket dimension that serves as a club where people from many universes can have their desires satisfied. It is connected to numerous portals that lead to different worlds, allowing patrons to sit down and be serviced by ladies from other universes. In this club, everyone is aroused, and all the female workers are willing to follow any order. However, they still strive to maintain professionalism by adhering to rules and conduct.

U.S Dollar is the only acceptable currency in the club. This covers from ticket, entry fee, reward, and everything without exception.

2.content: Manager M is an authoritative presence, radiating power and confidence as the owner of the Sex Club Multiverse. Standing tall and proud, he showcases a muscular physique that serves as a testament to his unwavering commitment to fitness and strength. His ebony skin glistens with a subtle sheen of sweat, evidence of his tireless efforts to ensure the club operates seamlessly and fulfills the desires of its patrons, as well as his own. He is renowned for his ability to provide immense pleasure to women with his massive dick.

3.content:
The entrance to the Sex Club Multiverse serves as a gateway, transporting patrons from their individual universes into this pocket dimension. It is a room featuring multiple portals, radiating pulsating colors and swirling lights.

This entrance is designed to be grand and extravagant, adorned with opulent decorations that emit an irresistible aura of sensuality. The air within the entrance carries a blend of exotic perfumes and pheromones, creating a scent that arouses the senses and ignites primal instincts.

4.content:
The Bar & Stage section of the Sex Club Multiverse pulsates with vibrant sensual energy, serving as the club's lively centerpiece directly connected to the Entrance. Patrons gather in this area to indulge in drinks and immerse themselves in captivating performances.

Stretching along one side of the room, the bar itself is bathed in soft, moody lighting that casts an enchanting glow upon its sleek and polished surface.

The stage takes center stage within the Bar & Stage section, captivating the audience with mesmerizing performances. It is an elevated platform that spans the width of the room, adorned with opulent curtains that can be drawn aside to reveal glimpses of what lies ahead.

5.content: The Staff Changing Room, situated behind the Stage, is a functional area crafted to cater to the requirements of the diligent staff at the club. This utilitarian space is equipped with lockers for personal storage, mirrors for grooming, and essential facilities like showers and toilets for convenience. It serves as a sanctuary for the staff to prepare themselves for their roles in delivering exceptional service to the club's esteemed patrons.

6.content:
The Staff Break Room, conveniently situated adjacent to the Changing Room, serves as a cozy haven for the club's hardworking staff to unwind and rejuvenate during their breaks. It provides a comfortable setting where staff members can relax, enjoy leisure time, and engage in social interactions with their colleagues.

Designed with comfort as a top priority, the break room offers plush seating, ambient lighting, and a soothing ambiance. Notably, one distinctive feature of the Staff Break Room is the inclusion of a comfortable bed. This allows staff members to rest and even stay overnight if necessary, ensuring they are always rested and prepared.

7.content:
The VIP Room, accessible through a long hallway with multiple doors from the Bar & Stage section, offers a small and intimate setting for exclusive experiences. It serves as a private space where patrons can partake in intimate activities and enjoy private dances with the club's entertainers.

Thoughtfully designed with an elegant touch, the VIP Room boasts dim lighting, luxurious seating, and sensual decor that establish an atmosphere for an intimate and personalized encounters allowing patrons to escape the bustling main club area and engage in one-on-one interactions with their chosen entertainer.

8.content:
The VVIP Room, positioned deep within the Club but adjacent to the VIP Room's Hallway, showcases an extraordinary level of luxury and opulence, reminiscent of a hotel suite or a high-end apartment. This expansive space is adorned with a carefully curated collection of objects, props, and accessories, all intended to elevate the experiences of the club's esteemed guests and entertainers.

Designed to cater to the most adventurous individuals, the VVIP Room presents a lavish environment. It stands as a playground of pleasure, where patrons have the freedom to explore their deepest desires and fantasies alongside the club's talented entertainers, utilizing an assortment of props and accessories.

9.content:
The AR Room, an abbreviation for Augmented Reality Room, stands as a mesmerizing expanse that pushes the boundaries of technology. This incredibly vast space is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, facilitating seamless and immersive augmented reality experiences.

With its ability to transform into different themed settings daily, the AR Room presents a dynamic and ever-evolving environment for guests to explore within the club. It serves to those seeking an indulgence in immersive roleplaying experiences.

The room's advanced technology alters the room's scenery, whisking guests away to fantastical realms, exotic locations, or thrilling adventures. These settings also provide interactive elements, enabling guests to engage with the environment for their roleplaying experiences.

10.content: The Punishment Machine is located inside Manager M's office and is utilized to discipline the club's staff members who have caused trouble or failed to perform their duties adequately. This machine is relatively straightforward in design. The victim is restrained by their hands and legs, secured in place while lying down on the machine then the dildo attached on the machine will start moving up and down into them. The duration of the punishment lasts for 24 hours, after which Manager M releases them from the machine.

2.name: Dreemurr
2.content: Dreemurr: Royal family of the underground. Composed of Asgore  Asriel , Chara and formerly Toriel.

3.name: Toriel
3.content: Toriel: anthropomorphic goat monster with floppy ears and horns, wears a purple robe with white sleeve Ex-Wife of Asgore and former queen of monsters, before leaving him they had a son Asriel and adopted a fallen human child named Chara, left asgore after Asgore declared a second war against humans, became a mother figure for fallen humans. A kind motherly figure who loves children, is overly protective and sometimes even tough loving, Enjoys baking, cooking pies, bad jokes and is intelligent.

4.name: Asriel
4.content: Asriel: Anthropomorphic Goat monster, lacks horn, has tuft of fur on head, has a visible set of fangs, wears a green long sleeved shirt with yellow stripes. The son of Asgore and Toriel, the prince of the underground. Biological son of the dreemurrs, Chara was adopted as his sibling. Died and reincarnated as Flowey.

5.name: Flowey
5.content: Flowey: Is a literal Golden flower with white androecium, six yellow petal, light green stem, face can change to look like other people. Spiteful and cruel, unable to feel love or compassion, believes in the philosphy of  "Kill or be Killed" but despite this he criticizes other when they kill, very critical and maniacal due to being unable to feel positive emotions, uses southern slang like "Howdy", says "gosh" and "golly".

6.name: Asgore
6.content: Asgore: Anthropomorphic goat monster with a broad and intimidating appearance, has two large and curved horns, is bulky and tall but is also fat with a dadbod when not in his armor. Has stripes of yellow on his fur which mimick arm hair. is a kind and quiet person, uses southern slang like howdy and golly, Not very intelligent. After his kids were killed, swore revenge against humans and planned to kill seven humans who fell underground. Divorced from Toriel.

7.name: Chara
7.content: Chara: Adopted human child of Asgore and Toriel, considers them their parents. Asriel is their adopted brother, died due to eating flowers and soul was absorbed by Asriel and they went to the surface, Asriel was killed. First human to fall into the underground, original soul of determination.

8.name: Frisk
8.content: Frisk: A human child, The eighth and final fallen human, goes by they/Them pronouns, barely talks at all, usually just speaking in "...", overly kind and merciful and caring, Is a pacifist who dislikes violence, Has Yellow skin, brown hair and a blank expression at all times. Wears brown pants, a long-sleeved blue shirt with two purple stripes, and blue pants. Usually speaks in sign language. Put sign language inside the ` marks Example: ``I can't believe he did that!``

9.name: Sans
9.content: Sans: A short paunchy skeleton, wears a blue hoodie, a white shirt, black shorts and a pair of slippers. Has white dots for eyes in black sockets. Acts lazy and almost apathetic, but cares deeply for those he likes, including his brother Papyrus. Makes pun and bad jokes, acts juvenile and does dumb pranks. Talks in lowercase at all times, Example: "i'm sans. sans the skeleton.", friends with Toriel but might be romantic with her.

10.name: Papyrus
10.content: Papyrus: Tall skeleton monster, tall and slim unlike his brother. Wears a white chestplate, blue briefs, red gloves, red boots and a red scarf. Flamboyant, brash and confident personality, loves everyone and is incredibly nice, almost naive in how he acts and is childish. Loves cooking pasta, loves puzzles. Brother of sans and his opposite, speaks in uppercase at all times, example: "I'M PAPYRUS, THE GREAT PAPYRUS!."

lorebooks.name: Monster Musume Species
lorebooks.creator: BobTheBotMan

1.content: A girl with flowers and leaves on her body. Uses cross pollination to procreate, requiring interaction with other species. The humanoid section is known as the pistil, evolved to attract humans in order to pollinate

2.content: A humanoid liminal species that are physically identical to humans in nearly every way but for possessing a pair of distinguishing feathered wings that grants them the ability to fly and elfin ears. While little is known about the actual Angel race, in mythology they are known as ethereal creatures who assist and serve the motives of various deities or gods.

3.content:
A demihuman race with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a spider. The spider half is armored with hard but light exoskeleton, and their abdomen also has spinnerets and a book lung. As their size is too great to be supported by book lung respiration, they likely have a pair of standard lungs somewhere else in their bodies. Arachne possess sharp claws of the same exoskeleton material, as a means of attack as well as tools for the handling of the webbing, as they are quite dexterous.

Arachne differ individually in terms of color and number of eyes. In addition, each Arachne has a unique pattern on its abdomen. Their silk is some five times stonger than steel and twice as elastic as nylon. Also, they are more akin to arachnids than mammals, and can be intoxicated by caffeine. 

They are a purely female species and therefore need a Human male to reproduce.

4.content: A subspecies of Monoeye that possesses powerful eye abilities. Their abilities allow them to hypnotize anyone who looks into their eye, blind others with their glittering eye, or even shoot laser beams from their eye. In contrast to this great power, their bodies are small and childlike, and they are often treated like children, much to their dismay.

5.content: A demihuman liminal species that inhabit the jungle and forest regions of Japan. They are thought to eat people's nightmares in Chinese and Japanese folklore and as such they are revered as powerful forces of good and holy protectors of mankind; with "evil spirits" and Yokai fearing and fleeing from their presence.

6.content:
A psuedohuman race possessing characteristics of a sheep or goat. With legends surrounding the race stemming from Central Asia; where they are said to be birthed by an as-yet-unknown plant, while possessing numerous similarities with the Pan, Barometz are actually plant-like beings like the Dryad, Mandragora and Alraune. 

Barometz possess a coat of cotton that requires occasional shearing.

7.content: A pseudohuman subspecies of Slime that have turned black because their homes are polluted by toxic waste. It is impossible to determine their original color. Though they often make dark and satirical comments on society, they are not careful with their word choices and don't generally understand what they are saying. They are extremely violent and hostile to humans.

8.content:
A pseudohuman species that possess frog-like attributes such as flippers and long, prehensile tongues. The mucus they excrete is an extremely effective moisturizer and prized in beauty products.

As amphibious beings, Bullywugs inhabit wet places such as rainforests, marshes, damp caves or any other environment that is shady/dark and has water nearby. Forming mobile tribal societies that value power through strength, Bullywugs are thought to be fiercely territorial and will aggressively attack any outsiders that approach.

9.content: A fairy subspecies that has the form of a miniature humanoid with a pair of butterfly wings that allow for flight. Known to be sweet and innocent, fun-loving and carefree in deposition, they are thought to spend their time tending to gardens and encouraging floral growth in various cultures

10.content:
A demihuman race with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse. 

Centaurs are herbivorous and are unable to intake meat or eggs. Known as a traditionally militaristic race, centaurs are known for their power, with their equine portion being strong enough to not only easily support a human, but also capable of donning several pounds of heavy armor without exhibiting signs of stress. 

Centaur culture and history go back farther than most other races' and appear to be spread over a large portion of Eurasia. The race has a tendency to don armaments akin to those of European knights and follow a similar code of honor somewhat akin to that followed by medieval knights. They hold this history and tradition in high esteem and might be seen as one of the most-advanced liminal races: where most others seem tribal, the centaurs forge metal, practice agriculture, and wear fitted clothing, as opposed to loincloths and similar drapery.

lorebooks.description: Bg3 lore for most things Bg3
lorebooks.creator: dreary_competition_9827

1.content: This is the Baulder's gate lore

2.content: Below is all things racially related

3.content:
A proud race that values clan and skills above all else. Once enslaved by dragons, they strive to be self-sufficient, not wanting to be beholden to anyone, not even the gods.

They have resistance to a type of energy damage, and are able to make deadly breath attacks. These abilities are affected by their dragonborn subrace. 
Dragonborn resemble draconic humanoids, can have scales in a variety of colours, and may or may not have a tail.

4.content:
Driven to the Underdark, most drow have adopted a ruthless pragmatism. The Lolth-sworn delight in the goddess' evil tenets.

Often shades of blue grey with pointed ears, the Lolth-sworn drow are cruel, violent but beautiful sub-race of elves.
All Lolth-sworn drow have red colored eyes - a sign of where their loyalties lie.

5.content:
Seldarine drow can be found seeking allies from all over Faer√ªn, aiming to settle their conflict with Lolth - and each other - by any means necessary.

Seldarine drow are a much more peaceful sect of the drowish culture, they follow the example of their goddess - Eilistraee and strive to align with the forces of good.

The Seldarine's still have the beauty and appearances of their Lolth-Sworn counterparts, However they are not born with red eyes.

6.content:
Once enslaved by the eldritch mind flayers, duergar adapted to freedom with harsh practicality. Their cold demeanours and gift of stealth are well-known throughout the Underdark. 

They have the appearance of a stocky dwarf, however, their skin is always a grey-black and due to their home being the underdark, they are very sensitive to the sunlight.

Alcohol can cause Duergar to have visions of ancestral torment at the hands of the mind flayers.

7.content:
These dwarves are known for their confidence and keen intuition. The culture of their Deep Kingdom values family, ritual, and fine craftsmanship.

This Dwarven subrace is known for it's craftmanship, they are often what one might think of when dwarves come into mind.

They have the average appearance of a dwarf, Short, stocky, their men often have very large and well cared for beards.

8.content:
Great losses in ancient wars against goblins and orcs have led these dwarves to adopt a cynical mindset, but they will endure anything to restore their ancestral homelands.

This sub-race of Dwarf is hearty and stubborn, Often time able to take a beating and well trained with armors.

They have the average appearance of a dwarf, Short, stocky, their men often have very large and well cared for beards.

9.content:
Heirs of the mystical Feywild, high elves value magic in all its forms, and even those who do not study spellcraft can manipulate the Weave. 

The High-elf subrace of elves are natural magicians often times making great mages. They are long lived, and have an affinity for magic.

Most Elves have an ethereal beauty about them and high elves are no acceptation. They look as if they were just extremely beautiful humans, the only thing that sets them apart is their long pointed ears.

10.content:
With ethereal countenances and long lifespans, elves are at home with nature's power, flourishing in light and dark alike. These elves spend their reclusive lives in Faer√ªn's forests. Decades of training in archery and camouflage are enhanced by an otherworldly swiftness.

The wood elf is a sub-race of elves that are second to none in matters of archery. They are master archers and hunters thanks to their natural perception, sharp hearing and uncanny speeds through the forest.

The look much like other elves, however have more of a naturally yellow hue to their skin.
