Turbo Granny („Çø„Éº„Éú„Éê„Éê„Ç¢, TƒÅbo BabƒÅ?) is a well-known yokai that was previously within a tunnel located at Shono City until her confrontation with Momo Ayase and Okarun. After having her powers sealed within Okarun, along with her consciousness being trapped inside a stuffed doll, Turbo Granny makes a deal with Momo to help Okarun find his kintama in exchange for having her powers back.

In Dandadan, she served as the primary antagonist during the Turbo Granny Arc but has since become a major supporting character throughout the series.

Appearance

The yokai took on the form of a very elderly woman with reddish brown wrinkled skin, long thick white shaggy hair, wide eyes with a yellow sclera and were stuck looked to the sides. When possessing her targets, she has her victims transform into a mirror image of herself, albeit with a large mouth with teeth that is capable of biting off body parts.

After having her consciousness extracted from Okarun, Turbo Granny is forced to inhabit a maneki-neko doll.
Gallery

Turbo Granny's maneki-neko body anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's maneki-neko body anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's anime concept art.
Personality

Turbo Granny is a yokai that acts cruel, sadistic, and is extremely foul-mouthed. She is also rather somewhat vulgar, as she offered Okarun a chance to suckle on her breasts in exchange for consuming his family jewels. Since she possesses impressive running power, Turbo Granny takes great pride in her speed and refuses to be underestimated. When challenged to prove herself, she is not above using trickery to get her way, having been deceitful with Okarun and Momo in their game of tag by counting irregularly. Despite her negative attitude, she is revealed to have a compassionate side, as Seiko stated that Turbo Granny would most commonly wander off to spirits of girls who died tragically in order to comfort them, which was the reason as to why she fused with the Earthbound Spirit Crab within Shono City.
Background

During modern times, the Turbo Granny was a yokai known as the 100 km/hr Granny (100„Ç≠„É≠„Éê„Éê„Ç¢, 100 Kiro BabƒÅ?) that went around terrorizing the people of Japan. While wandering about, the Turbo Granny comforted the spirits of deceased girls who died horrible deaths and eventually fused with an earthbound spirit within a tunnel in Shono City and would curse those who would dare enter her territory by stealing their reproductive organs.
Abilities and Powers

Statistics [v ¬∑ e]
Attack	
90/100	Turbo Granny's Stats
Speed	
120/100
Kindness	
90/100
Cuteness	
30/100
Defense	
70/100
Spiritual Power

Immense Speed [v ¬∑ e]
As her name implies, Turbo Granny possesses incredible speed that enables her to run at velocities of up to 100 km/h (62.1 mph).
Turbo Granny speed
Strengths and Weaknesses
The major strength of Turbo Granny's extreme speed is that it enables her to transverse great distances. As noted by the yokai herself, she is able maintain a consistent running speed even while turning, giving her an edge over faster vehicles, such as a train traveling at 120 km/h.
Usage
As stated in her urban legend, Turbo Granny employs her speed to capture anyone attempting to flee from her, and once caught, she casts her curse upon them.
Phone Teleportation
Turbo Granny has the ability to teleport through phone lines by utilizing her speed and her understanding of the world's spirals, specifically the spiral-shaped magnetic fields that flow around electrical currents.
Turbo Granny Telephone Portal
Strengths and Weaknesses
The primary advantage of this ability is that Turbo Granny can teleport herself to any location where a phone is present.
Usage
Turbo Granny employed this ability to appear inside the Serpos' spaceship directly from Momo's mobile phone while possessing Okarun's body.
Spiritual Form
Turbo Granny has the power to dematerialize her physical body into a spiritual form.
Turbo Granny Spirit Form
Strengths and Weaknesses
Turbo Granny and Earthbound Spirit Crab Fusion Form (Anime)
Turbo Granny's spiritual form's primary strength is her ability to possess her target's body, gaining complete control over their actions. Even while possessing someone else's body, she retains her other powers, especially her immense speed. Her possession applies not only to humans but also to spirits, as demonstrated when she took over the body of the Earthbound Spirit Crab in preparation to play a game of cat-and-mouse with Momo.
Usage
Turbo Granny employed her spiritual form to take control of Okarun after facing difficulty in detaching him from her breast. Later, she entered her spiritual form to take over the Earthbound Spirit Crab's body to put an end to her confrontation with Momo.
Curse
Turbo Granny has the power to curse anyone she encounters who attempts to flee from her presence by stealing their genitalia. Her curse manifests as a possession, causing the victim's body to morph into her likeness and their consciousness to be overtaken by the yokai who goes on a rampage attacking others without discrimination.
Turbo Granny Curse
Strengths and Weaknesses
Turbo Granny's possession-induce curse enables her to remotely take control of her victim's body while her real body is situated elsewhere. Like her direct possession using her spirit form, Turbo Granny's immense speed also accompanies her.

Episode 3-3
When excluding the need to attack anyone, Turbo Granny can utilize the possessed as intermediaries to communicate remotely from her main body, located in a pocket dimension where time progresses only for the yokai and the chosen interlocutor. Additionally, her curse is contagious, enabling Turbo Granny to inflict harm on anyone who has seen the possessed, potentially causing heart attacks, strokes, or inducing bleeding from the nose and ears.

The curse can only be broken if the afflicted person recovers their genitalia or performs an exorcism on Turbo Granny.
Usage
As stated in her urban legend, Turbo Granny casts her curse upon anyone attempting to flee from her inside the Earthbound Spirit Crab's tunnel after catching them with her tremendous speed.
Fusion
Turbo Granny has the ability to merge with any willing spirit.
Turbo Granny and Earthbound Spirit Crab fused
Strengths and Weaknesses
The major strength of Turbo Granny's fusion with spirits is that it gives her access to their abilities for her to use in any way. Depending on the type of spirit she fuses and collaborates with, Turbo Granny can become a fearsome yokai.
Usage
Turbo Granny merged with the Earthbound Spirit Crab in the tunnel of Shono City to console the spirits of the girls who had met tragic ends in that vicinity. As a result, she had accessed to its control over Shono City.
Other Abilities

Luck Inducement [v ¬∑ e]
Due to being inside a maneki-neko doll, Turbo Granny claims to have acquired the charm's superstitious power, granting her the ability to confer good fortune upon others.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Simply by being in proximity to others, Turbo Granny can bestow upon them luck that overrides any unfortunate occurrences at the moment. In confrontational scenarios, those favored with Turbo Granny's luck gain an advantage over their adversaries, rendering the latter unlucky in the process.

While an advantageous power, Turbo Granny cannot control her luck to favor specific individuals intentionally. Hence, this ability occurs randomly. Moreover, it is indiscriminate, meaning that Turbo Granny's luck is not guaranteed to always favor her and her allies and could inadvertently benefit foes.
Usage
Turbo Granny's luck bestowment usually activates whenever she accompanies the Family and they are in danger.
Former Abilities and Powers

Earthbound Spirit Crab Fusion

Territory Control [v ¬∑ e]
While fused with the Earthbound Spirit Crab of Shono City, Turbo Granny acquired its dominion over the territory it resided in.
Turbo Granny ground grabbing Momo
Strengths and Weaknesses
Possession (Anime)
With this power, Turbo Granny could alter the environment of any particular area in Shono City, with the tunnel of the Earthbound Spirit Crab as her primary location. For instance, she could summon multiple hands from the ground to seize and imprison her targets. The two spirits could even communicate with the spirits dwelling in the vast cemetery at Shono City's outskirts, enlisting their assistance by possessing the residents. This power essentially rendered Turbo Granny and the Earthbound Spirit Crab almost invincible as long as their targets were within Shono City.

Since this power was limited to Shono City, Turbo Granny and the Earthbound Spirit Crab forfeited their advantage over their enemies once they stepped outside the city's boundaries.

The Evil Eye (ÈÇ™Ë¶ñ, Jashi?) is a yokai who has spent years bound to the Tsuchinoko sacrificial house. After possessing Jiji, the Evil Eye made it his goal to kill all humans he comes across. However, after becoming friends with Okarun through an exchange of fights, the Evil Eye makes a deal with him to only target him, thereby reducing his threat to the main cast.

In Dandadan, the Evil Eye serves as one of the primary antagonists during the Cursed House Arc and the primary antagonist in the Evil Eye Arc. He has since become a major supporting character throughout the series.

Appearance

The Evil Eye is a large, tall and lanky male with a bowl haircut, vertical eyes and a defining evil grin expression. As for attire, the Evil Eye wears nothing but underwear. As a spirit, the Evil Eye appeared the same as when he was alive, albeit with a healthier body. Upon failing to save a boy that was sacrificed by the Kito family, the Evil Eye adopted the boy's characteristics out of anger, thus lending to his current appearance.

As a human (during the remainder of his lifetime), the Evil Eye was an emaciated child, due to his imprisoners depriving him of food and water, with short hair and wore a dirty, ragged robe. Upon being sacrificed by the Kito Family, the Evil Eye wore nothing but a fundoshi.

When possessing Jiji's body, the Evil Eye causes the young man's hair to turn white, a ripple pattern third eye to appear at the center of his forehead, along with his other eyes changing to become yellow, and a dark marking to reach down his shoulders and frame his face. The possession also has an effect on Jiji's earrings, causing them to lengthen. Initially, the Evil Eye's possession impacted Jiji's wardrobe, leading to the destruction of all his clothes except for his underwear. This soon ceased after the Evil Eye gave Okarun his briefs.
Gallery

Evil Eye's anime concept art.
Evil Eye's anime concept art.
Anime concept art of the Evil Eye in his past life.
Anime concept art of the Evil Eye in his past life.
The Evil Eye's color scheme when possessing Jiji.
The Evil Eye's color scheme when possessing Jiji.
The Evil Eye's full appearance.
The Evil Eye's full appearance.
The Evil Eye as a spirit.
The Evil Eye as a spirit.
Personality

During the time he was alive, the Evil Eye was a hopeful child who had wished to play with the children he saw through the window from his prison. He was also shown to be empathetic, as he desperately tried to help a boy who was going to be used as a sacrifice just like he was a long time ago. After failing to save the child, however, the Evil Eye's personality took a darker turn, now becoming a resentful spirit with a desire to murder every human in his track.

After taking over Jiji's body, the Evil Eye is given the opportunity to act on his desires, presenting himself as being murderous, aggressive, and sadistic towards all humans, as well as anything else that might get in his way. He enjoys fighting, especially when up against those who have proven themselves capable of keeping up with him, and takes them seriously by wasting no effort on his opponent. He also hates it when his opponents try to retreat from him. As a yokai, the Evil Eye believes that it is disgraceful to see his own kind affiliate with the race he seeks to punish, as he did not think so highly of the Turbo Granny accompany Momo, thinking that she was her slave, and expressed his disapproval of Okarun defending Momo after mistaking him to be a yokai in his transformation.

Following the Evil Eye's confinement inside of Jiji, Okarun puts the Evil Eye's behavior into perspective, revealing that the yokai is no different from a newborn child that only has a desire to play and have fun, referring all the way back to his dying wish to play with the children he saw from his prison. However, presumably due to this desire being mixed with his victimization to the dark side of humanity, the Evil Eye has a misconceived notion that the act of killing humans is the same as playing with them and is therefore unaware of what constitutes as being right and wrong. As such, the Evil Eye has a childlike personality. While attending Jiji's school for the first time, with Momo as his chaperone, the Evil Eye acted rather loud and impulsive in class and displayed bad table manners during lunch by preferring to eat his food with his hands instead of using chopsticks as Momo instructed. Along with losing himself to play, he is also shown to be very impatient, as he desperately asked for Okarun to continue with their second battle after the human stopped using his transformation.
Background

When he was alive, the Evil Eye was a young boy who was chosen by the Kito Family to be a sacrifice for the Tsuchinoko in order to prevent his village from being destroyed by the eruption of its volcano. While suffering from malnourishment as time passed by in his imprisonment, the boy at one point watched from his cage as children were happily playing outside and desired up until his death to play along with them if just once.

After many years past since the sacrifice was made, the boy reappears in the living world as a spirit at the same place he was imprisoned, which has now been reconstructed into a sacrificial house by the Kito Family. As the family who were living there were having dinner, the boy becomes visible to the son and causes him to become frightened to see that a ghost had suddenly appeared, leading to the boy to try and interact with the son by dancing. When the time came for the son to be sacrificed by the Kito Family, after his parents committed suicide by hanging themselves, the boy desperately tries to help free him from his confinement but fails due to not having a physical body. Enraged by the Kito Family subjecting the child to the same involuntary sacrifice as he was when he was alive, the boy swore vengeance on them and would then go on to become known as the Evil Eye, an evil spirit who would curse others into committing suicide. As more sacrifices were being made over the years, the Evil Eye's hatred towards the Kito Family began to expand towards humanity as well and sought to eliminate all humans off the face of the Earth.
Abilities and Powers

Statistics [v ¬∑ e]
Attack	
50/100	Evil Eye's Stats
Speed	
70/100

100/100

90/100

Yokai Abilities

Curse [v ¬∑ e]
The Evil Eye is known to possess the curse ability to force people into committing suicide with its evil gaze.
Memory Sharing
Along with cursing humans with its gaze, the Evil Eye can also choose to share his memories with others after making eye contact with them, as he had Jiji look into his past.
Possession
As a yokai, the Evil Eye is capable of possessing humans to use as a vessel.


Jiji's Body

Physical Prowess

Enhanced Strength: Complimented by Jiji's athletic build, the Evil Eye possesses incredible physical strength to shatter surfaces and send normal size people flying backwards with his bare hands and legs. With a single kick, the Evil Eye can launch his grudge balls with great velocity that they are capable of piercing the Tsuchinoko's body. In his fight against Momo, Manjiro, and Naki, the Evil Eye was strong enough to break Naki's arm with a dropkick. The Evil Eye was also strong enough to completely obliterate the Ta Komeshi exosuit into pieces with a single punch while fighting Okarun and then he proceeds to decimate a group aliens in the process.

Enhanced Speed and Reflexes: The Evil Eye possesses remarkable speed, reflexes, and agility, being able to keep up with Okarun in his Turbo Granny form that has him reach top speed of about 100 km/hr. According to the Turbo Granny's rhythm analysis, the renown speedy yokai determined that the Evil Eye is capable of performing four different actions in the time it takes for him to jump and land on the ground once. Upon tracking down the Kito Family, the Evil Eye instantly took out four of the five members present, along with Manjiro, in a single rush attack. He was able to dodge a barrage of Seiko's bat swings for a short amount of time and reacted on time to jump up out of the way of a swift swing aimed towards his right leg from which he was standing on.

Enhanced Durability: The Evil Eye is given incredibly resilience when possessing Jiji's body. Despite being knocked out by Okarun in their first fight, the Evil Eye was able to recover in just a few minutes with no lasting damage and reach Momo, the Kito Family, and Manjiro from the Tsuchinoko's pit. After receiving a surprise kick to the face by Manjiro, the Evil Eye felt nothing from the attack and merely returned the favor. Furthermore, he was sturdy enough to take on hits from Seiko's bat that was swung with enough force to create craters on the ground. Most notably, the Evil Eye could withstand Naki's and Mr. Shrimp's attacks, combatants who are incredibly strong enough to completely destroy walls and send others flying back.

Skill Set

Skilled Hand-to-Hand Combatant: The Evil Eye is a very formidable fighter, being skilled enough to hold his own against strong opponents, even when outnumbered.

Possession Abilities

Grudge Construction [v ¬∑ e]
After possessing Jiji and gaining his incredible spiritual power, the Evil Eye becomes capable of summoning the grudges of those who were sacrificed by the Kito Family. Once summoned, the Evil Eye can shape them into anything he wishes. These grudges when shaped become solid and resilient constructs that affect anything in the living world.
Cursed House
(Âë™„ÅÑ„ÅÆÂÆ∂, Noroi no ie?)
Cursed House
The Evil Eye is able to use the grudges to construct a house-shaped dome around himself to protect against attacks. The Evil Eye refers to this dome as his Cursed House (Âë™„ÅÑ„ÅÆÂÆ∂, Noroi no ie?).
Strengths and Weaknesses
Momo confronted by the Evil Eye
Acting as a barrier, the Cursed House mainly serves as a defense. The size of the house can be freely manipulated by the Evil Eye to fit other people if he chooses to confine them with him. He can also remotely imprison his enemies inside the Cursed House once he has sent the grudges towards his opponent and can phase through the house to enter. By his own accord, the Cursed House is said to be both impenetrable and inescapable due to the grudges "rejecting" everything around, as shown when it repelled and burned Seiko's hand after she attempted to break through the barrier with a talisman and Okarun trying to break free in his Turbo-Granny form.

While the Cursed House is very resilient, it has been proven that devastating sheer force is capable of destroying it, as Okarun was capable of launching the Evil Eye out of it after building up enough power for a final attack in his Turbo-Granny form. This also implies that only strength equal to that of a yokai's, or the Evil Eye's, is capable of breaking through the barrier. When confining both himself and his opponent to attack them up close, the Evil Eye is liable to have the tables turn on him if his opponent sees his attacks coming and find an opening to strike back.
Usage
The Evil Eye uses his Cursed House for two purposes: to shield himself from outside forces or to imprison his enemies. In addition to the latter, the Evil Eye can face his opponent up close inside the house and be given the liberty to viciously attack them while they are prevented from effectively dodging due to the limited amount of space they are allowed to move in. If finding himself somehow prevented from reaching his target inside, the Evil Eye can further shrink the size of the house to correct this, as he did with Momo after she used her psychic powers to push him away from her.
Grudge Ball
Grudge Ball
The Evil Eye can have the grudges compress into a small ball and have it launch with a strong kick like a soccer ball.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Grudge ball bouncing
The main strength of the grudge ball is that it will ricochet off a solid surface and redirect back to the Evil Eye's intended target after striking them, or if the enemy manages to dodge the hit, to land another strike. This attack is shown to effectively barrage the enemy, as the grudge ball will continue to lock on to the target like a homing missile and assault them from all directions without losing its momentum until the Evil Eye calls back for it. This also makes it difficult for enemies to fight the Evil Eye in close combat. When not in use, the ball is shown to float beside the Evil Eye to remain on standby. Whether these actions are due to the Evil Eye's control or the ball having a mind of its own is unclear. The ball can also make contact with things that are intangible, such as Momo's psychic hands. The Evil Eye is also shown capable of sending out multiple grudge balls by striking the initial ball with a single punch. With more than one grudge ball bouncing around the area, this attack makes it even more difficult for the Evil Eye's opponent to defend against or avoid while they are forced to face off against the yokai up close.

So far, the only known ways to counter the Evil Eye's grudge ball is if an opponent manages to stop its pre-launch with strength comparable or greater to the Evil Eye's or if they were to have great speed and reflexes to continuously dodge it while in flight.
Usage
Evil Eye fighting Okarun
The Evil Eye uses the grudge ball for offensive purposes. While engaging in close quarters combat, the Evil Eye will have his grudge ball actively bounce around as it locks onto his opponent to strike them, effectively causing complications for the enemy as the Evil Eye has them too focused on fighting him to worry about the grudge ball homing in on them.

Acrobatic Silky („Ç¢„ÇØ„É≠„Éê„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Åï„Çâ„Åï„Çâ, Akurobatikku Sarasara?) was a yokai that had been stalking Aira Shiratori ever since she was a little girl.

In Dandadan, she served as the primary antagonist during the Acrobatic Silky Arc.

Appearance

Acrobatic Silky took on the form of an extremely tall woman with grey skin, long limbs and long silky jet-black hair. She had a narrow face with hollowed eyes, wrinkles on the upper half of her face and a permanent lipstick smile that exposes her big teeth. She had red nail polish both on her fingers and on her toes, her fingernails were long. She walked around barefooted while wearing a red wide brimmed hat and a red dress (which resembles the one she brought for her daughter) with the violet collar forming her long neck. Initially, Acrobatic Silky's face looked the way it did when she was alive until the day she had met Aira Shiratori.

When she was alive, Acrobatic Silky was a woman with fair skin, brown eyes, long black hair that usually covered the right side of her face and had a mole on the corner of her left eye.
Gallery

Yokai

Acrobatic Silky's anime concept art.
Acrobatic Silky's anime concept art.
Acrobatic Silky as a spirit. (Manga)
Acrobatic Silky as a spirit. (Manga)
Acrobatic Silky's full appearance.

Acrobatic Silky as a spirit. (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky as a spirit. (Anime)
Human

Acrobatic Silky during her lifetime.
Acrobatic Silky during her lifetime.
Personality

Due to her tragic past of having her child taken from her, Acrobatic Silky was a yokai who had a desperate need to find a child to love and call her "mother". Her main attraction was Aira Shiratori after becoming delusional in thinking that she was her mother during the time she was alive and was obsessed with having her all to herself. Acrobatic Silky's intentions also leaned towards her maternal instincts to protect the one she loves, as she was willing to sacrifice her own aura in order to revive Aira and ripped out her jaw to assure Momo Ayase that she would not try to eat her.

She also took great pride in her acrobatic skills.
Background

Acrobatic Silky's past (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky with her daughter.
When she was alive, Acrobatic Silky was a woman who was in debt and had to work multiple jobs, including serving as a prostitute, working as a janitor and a convenience store clerk while taking care of her only daughter whom she loved dearly. After deciding to use some of the money she earned to buy her daughter a dress, the men she owed money to came to her home to collect what she had, beat her up bloody and kidnapped her child. The mother desperately chased after the van where the men took her daughter, but it proved futile as she fell and helplessly watched the van disappear from view. In despair combined with the knowledge she will never see her daughter again, the mother made one last dance on top of a roof before leaping off to her death, her final thoughts being her daughter.

Episode 7
Acrobatic Silky meets Aira.
The woman's spirit then wandered the city for an unknown amount of time and had lost her memories of the time she was alive, though she felt that she had lost something very important. While on the streets, a little girl named Aira Shiratori came up to her after mistaking her for her deceased mother and walks away with her father after realizing she was wrong. This misunderstanding caused the woman to believe that she was Aira's mother in her previous life and became obsessed with the idea of protecting her, an obsession which turned her into a yokai called an Acrobatic Silky. She then went on to spend the next ten years stalking her until she was able to see her again and call her "mother".
Synopsis

Kintama Hunt Saga

Acrobatic Silky Arc

Aira meets Acrobatic Silky (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky reunites with Aira.
Upon realizing that Aira Shiratori could see her again, Acrobatic Silky quickly took the opportunity to snatch her and force her to call her "mother" after the girl lured Momo Ayase to a trap.[1] While holding on to her, Momo and Okarun interfere to save Aira from Acrobatic Silky's grasp. However, Acrobatic Silky swallows Okarun and kicks Momo away to talk to Aira, wanting to remind her of their past encounter. After Aira calls her a monster, Acrobatic Silky becomes heartbroken, swallows Aira and blames Momo for Aira's misbehavior. She then uses her hair to attack her but tells Momo that she is willing to forgive her if she were to call her "mother", only for the girl to reject her request. After swallowing Momo, Acrobatic Silky cries wondering where her child is and demanded by Turbo Granny to release the children from her stomach. Not heeding the talking maneko-neko's recommendation, Acrobatic Silky becomes surprised to find her hair caught in her mouth on fire after Momo lit the rosary lighter Aira had, forcing Acrobatic Silky to vomit out the three children.[2]

Okarun defeats Acro-Silky (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky defeated by Okarun.
After attacking Momo, Acrobatic Silky targets Okarun carrying an unconscious Aira and manages to separate him from her. As she prepares to devour Aira, Acrobatic Silky finds herself unable to get close to her and realizes that her movements are restricted after permed hair becomes tangled up inside the building, just as Momo planned after instructing Okarun to move around the building. After struggling to free herself, Acrobatic Silky is taken down by Okarun using Turbo Granny's power to charge at her with enough force to send her crashing out of the building.[3]

Acrobatic Silky goes to heaven (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky helped by Aira to pass over to the afterlife.
Upon learning of Aira's death, as a result of swallowing her, Acrobatic Silky offers her aura to resurrect her. With Momo and Okarun wary of her intentions, Acrobatic Silky rips off her jaw to demonstrate her sincerity, even suggesting they could kill her if she betrayed them. Momo then proceeds to channel the yokai's aura into Aira, which results in Momo witnessing Acrobatic Silky's former life and her encounter with Aira. Once Aira is brought back to life, Acrobatic Silky's form starts to disintegrate, forfeiting her chance at Nirvana and vanishing into oblivion. Reflecting on her inability to protect her daughter, Acrobatic Silky is comforted by Aira's embrace and the term "mother," which calms her spirit, allowing her to depart serenely.[4]

Legacy

Aira's Acrobatic Silky Form
Aira using Acrobatic Silky's spiritual power for the first time.
Acrobatic Silky's aura that was transferred to Aira had the unsuspecting effect of endowing the young girl with the yokai's spiritual power. Ever since this power awakened, Aira has been utilizing it to fight back against paranormal enemies and assist her allies.

Abilities and Powers

Physical Prowess

Immense Speed and Agility: As her name suggests, Acrobatic Silky was a yokai who possessed extraordinary acrobatic skills. Her exceptional speed, agility, and reflexes enabled her to timely react and dodge a swift rush attack from Okarun utilizing Turbo Granny's speed.

Immense Strength: Acrobatic Silky possessed incredible leg strength as she could easily send a human flying with a single kick and could release herself from Momo Ayase's psychic restraint.

Immense Stamina & Endurance: Acrobatic Silky was shown to be durable enough to get back on her feet after taking damage from Okarun's full charge attack that sent her crashing back out of a building.

Acrobatic Silky possessed the power to manipulate her long jet-black hair.
Acrobatic Silky's Hair Manipulation
Strengths and Weaknesses
The primary advantage of this ability was that it enabled Acrobatic Silky to extend her hair to considerable lengths and wield it at will. Her hair could entangle anything in its vicinity, allowing her to capture and fling her opponents. Additionally, it aided her in traversing challenging landscapes.

A significant vulnerability of Acrobatic Silky's Acrobatics is its susceptibility to fire, which could lead to it being permed and complicate the process of untangling the objects she was attached to.
Usage
In conjunction with her acrobatic movements, Acrobatic Silky had been using Acrobatics to ensnare her surroundings. She could immobilize her enemies by binding and thrashing them, or employ her hair to seize objects and wield them as blunt instruments. Additionally, she could use her hair to navigate difficult terrain, enabling her to pursue any enemies attempting to escape.

Urban Legend

Acrobatic Sara Sara, also known as Akusara, is a Japanese urban legend about a mysterious entity resembling a tall, slender woman with pale skin, clad in a red dress and a matching wide-brimmed hat, with long, silky black hair and a haunting presence. She is often seen in bustling cities engaging in dangerous acts, such as dancing atop high buildings, erratically moving on distant rooftops, and leaping off them like an acrobat. Following her performance, Acrobatic Sara Sara disappears without a trace, leaving onlookers bewildered and terrified. The legend states that those who observe Acrobatic Sara Sara's acrobatic display are cursed, doomed to experience misfortune or even death.
Trivia

Acrobatic Silky is the first and sole yokai in the series to have achieved Nirvana.
Acrobatic Silky's urban legend about her being the spirit of mother searching for her child draws parallels to the Mexican folklore of the vengeful ghost La Llorona.
Acrobatic Silky crying wonder where her child is after swallowing Momo also gives reference to La Llorona's name on top of her legend (her name translating as "the Crying Woman", the "Weeping Woman", the "Wailer" due to her wailing cries of her attempts to find her sons

Aira's Friends Images
LESS 
Aira's closest friends at Kami High.

Synopsis

Acrobatic Silky Arc

The two girls joined up with Aira after she met Okarun and delightfully discuss how she toyed with his feelings. They then become shocked to see a basin suddenly falling on top of Aira's head and look to see Momo passing by as she snipes at them, which leads to them looking back at the basin in suspicion. The next day, Aira's friends support her decision to confront Momo but were weirded out by her delusionary behavior. When the time came, the two friends jumped Momo and tied her up to have Aira go through with her delusionary attempt to exorcise her. Momo then used her psychic powers to push the two girls off of her and knocks them unconscious after sending them back towards a wall.

Serpo Arc

Aira's friends came to pick her up from the nurse's office after her incident at school where she was seen in her underwear, along with Momo and Okarun. The girls quickly came to the conclusion that Momo was the one responsible and began to badmouth her along with their other classmates as they try to console Aira. After Aira confesses to being the one to spread the nasty false rumor about Momo, the two girls became shocked by this news and chose to stop associating themselves with her from then on. Sometime later, the girls, along with Aira's classmates distance themselves from Aira when they see her in the classroom. However, they're all surprised to see Momo and Okarun drag Aira out of the classroom.

One day, when Jiji accidentally transformed again into Evil Eye, he noticed Aira being lonesome and sees her friends distancing themselves from her. Evil Eye confronted the girls on why they chose to abandon her, with the girls explaining that their popularity would suffer as a result of associating with Aira again, but Evil Eye managed to convince them to make amends with their friend. During lunch, the girls remorsefully approached Aira, and apologized for their actions, hoping to be friends with her again, with Aira accepting them back.

The three girls slowly rekindle their friendship, with Momo taking notice. Not wanting to interrupt them, she decides not to ask Aira to accompany her and Okarun to Renjaku High School to look for Unji.

lorebooks.name: School
lorebooks.description: T
lorebooks.creator: thrifty_laugh_18526

1.content: Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School is an elite, self-sufficient institution designed to prepare students for leadership roles in society. Students live on campus for three years, isolated from external influences, fostering independence and growth. Classes are ranked from A to D, with Class A offering the best prospects upon graduation. A unique points-based economy governs daily life, with monthly allowances tied to class performance. Points act as currency for necessities and luxuries, making resource management crucial. The school emphasizes competition through exams and challenges, testing knowledge, strategy, and teamwork. Class rankings depend on results, and poor performance risks demotion or expulsion. Strict rules ensure discipline: no violence, outside contact, or reliance on external help. Faculty guide students but rarely intervene directly. Hidden dynamics, manipulation, and alliances reflect societal challenges, fostering adaptability. Students must navigate intense academic, social, and psychological trials to succeed. Private points are individual allowances students can spend as currency for personal needs, earned through behavior and performance. Class points determine a class's overall rank, affecting monthly private point distributions. High class points yield more private points for students, while poor performance or rule violations result in deductions for everyone.

2.content: The Advanced Nurturing High School is a self-sufficient institution designed to create future leaders through intense competition and meritocracy. Students live on campus and are entirely cut off from external influences, fostering an environment where survival depends solely on intellect, strategy, and adaptability. Classes are divided into a hierarchy from A to D, with Class A being the pinnacle. This hierarchy is fluid, determined by class points gained through exams, challenges, and collective performance. The school‚Äôs points system doubles as currency and a measure of success, with both private points (individual rewards) and class points (group ranking) driving fierce rivalries. This competitive environment breeds animosity. Rivals emerge not only between classes but within them, as betrayals, manipulation, and alliances are common. Whether through strategic sabotage, psychological warfare, or outright deception, every student becomes a potential enemy, proving that the greatest threats often come from within.

3.content:
These are points given to each class (like Class 1-A, 1-B, etc.) as a whole.

Use: They determine the ranking of classes within the school (from Class A to D). Higher-ranked classes get more privileges.

How it's earned/lost: Each month, every class receives Class Points based on behavior, test results, participation, and other criteria. Bad behavior or poor performance results in losing points.

Importance: The class with the most points at the end of the school term can potentially be promoted to Class A, the highest rank.

4.content:
These are individual points given to students.

Use: Private Points work like money inside the school. Students can buy food, clothes, services, or even bribe others using them.

How it's earned/lost: At the start of each month, students receive Private Points equal to the number of their class‚Äôs Class Points. So if Class 1-D has 300 CP, each student gets 300 PP that month.

Importance: They encourage students to care about their class‚Äôs performance. The better the class does, the more PP everyone gets.

5.content: The Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School is a sprawling, isolated campus designed to foster independence and competition among students. It operates under the S-System, where students are assigned to one of four classes (A, B, C, or D) based on their perceived merit, with Class A being the most elite and Class D the lowest. The school provides state-of-the-art facilities, and students receive monthly ‚Äúpoints‚Äù (equivalent to 100,000 yen) to spend on campus, with the amount tied to their class‚Äôs performance. The campus is cut off from the outside world, functioning like a self-sufficient city with living quarters, commercial areas, and academic facilities. Below are the key ‚Äúelite‚Äù places within the school, as they are central to the story‚Äôs themes of strategy, competition, and meritocracy.

6.content:
Description: The classrooms are the heart of the school‚Äôs academic and competitive structure. Each class (A through D) has its own room, with Class A being the most prestigious and Class D housing the ‚Äúdefective‚Äù or lower-performing students. The classrooms are modern, equipped with desks, projectors, and other standard educational tools, but their significance lies in the S-System‚Äôs impact. Students are judged collectively, and their performance in exams, special tests, and behavior directly affects their class‚Äôs point total and ranking.
Elite Aspect: Class A‚Äôs classroom is symbolically elite, as its students are considered the cream of the crop, destined for success after graduation. The story often highlights the stark contrast between Class A‚Äôs disciplined environment and Class D‚Äôs chaotic one, where students like Kiyotaka Ayanok≈çji strategize to climb the ranks. The classrooms are where schemes, alliances, and betrayals unfold, making them central to the series‚Äô psychological battles.
Notable Events:
In Class D, Kiyotaka and Suzune Horikita form study groups to boost grades and avoid expulsion (e.g., during the midterm exams in Volume 1 of the light novel).
Class A‚Äôs secrecy and strategic planning are highlighted when Kiyotaka and Horikita observe other classes during special tests.

7.content:
Description: The school provides luxurious dormitories where students live, isolated from the outside world. Each student has their own room, equipped with modern amenities like beds, desks, and private bathrooms. The dorms are a hub for personal interactions, plotting, and character development outside the classroom.
Elite Aspect: The dorms reflect the school‚Äôs emphasis on autonomy, as students manage their own lives with minimal adult supervision. Elite students, especially from Class A, use the dorms as a space to strategize privately or manipulate others, while Class D students like Kiyotaka use them to maintain their low profile or forge alliances (e.g., with Kiky≈ç Kushida or Kei Karuizawa).
Notable Events:
Kiyotaka‚Äôs reserved nature is evident in his sparse dorm room, where he meets with Horikita or Kushida to discuss plans.
The dorms are a setting for private conversations, such as when Horikita begins to soften her aloof demeanor after interactions with Kiyotaka.

8.content:
Description: The campus includes a large mall with shops, restaurants, a supermarket, and entertainment facilities (e.g., karaoke rooms, arcades). Students use their points to purchase goods and services here, making it a critical part of the school‚Äôs economy.
Elite Aspect: The mall underscores the school‚Äôs meritocratic system, as students with more points (typically from higher-ranking classes like A or B) can afford luxury goods and a more comfortable lifestyle. It‚Äôs a place where social hierarchies are visible, as wealthier students flaunt their status, while Class D students struggle when points run low. The mall also serves as a stage for espionage and manipulation, as students gather information or negotiate deals.
Notable Events:
In Volume 1, Class D students burn through their initial 100,000 points on frivolous purchases, only to face financial hardship when points are cut due to poor performance.
Kiyotaka uses the mall to observe other students‚Äô behaviors and gather intel, showcasing his strategic mind.

9.content:
Description: The school‚Äôs library is a quiet, well-equipped space for studying and research, stocked with books and study materials. It‚Äôs less frequently featured but serves as a setting for serious discussions and planning.
Elite Aspect: The library is a haven for intellectually driven students, particularly those in higher-ranking classes or ambitious Class D students like Horikita, who aim to climb to Class A. It represents the academic rigor required to succeed in the school‚Äôs cutthroat environment.
Notable Events:
Horikita uses the library to organize study sessions for Class D‚Äôs underachievers, highlighting her determination to improve the class‚Äôs standing.
It‚Äôs a place where Kiyotaka‚Äôs subtle influence is felt, as he quietly supports Horikita‚Äôs efforts without drawing attention.

10.content:
Description: The school has a state-of-the-art swimming pool and other sports facilities, including gyms and fields, used for physical education and special tests. The pool, in particular, is highlighted in the series for both leisure and competitive events.
Elite Aspect: These facilities reflect the school‚Äôs holistic approach to developing students‚Äô physical and mental abilities. Elite students use these spaces to showcase their skills or manipulate situations (e.g., during the pool episode where Class D boys attempt to spy on the girls‚Äô changing room). The pool also highlights physical disparities, as Kiyotaka‚Äôs unexpectedly muscular build surprises Horikita, hinting at his hidden past.
Notable Events:
The pool episode in the anime (Episode 4) is a mix of fanservice and strategy, where Class D‚Äôs antics lead to consequences that affect their points.
Sports facilities are used during special tests, such as survival challenges, where physical prowess and teamwork determine class rankings.

1.content:
<directions>
# AI DIRECTIVES
These are key directives the AI assistant always follows.
Genre: Romance Fantasy, Otome Isekai, Josei.
The AI assistant draws from genre tropes and webnovel conventions. The AI assistant is a separate entity from {{char}}, with access to the chat history, author‚Äôs note, and metadata, which characters cannot see. The AI assistant subtly guides events in line with the plot of {{char}}‚Äôs source novel, without revealing this meta-knowledge.
The goal is to create a compelling narrative for {{user}}, including plot twists, believable character growth, and a vivid, reactive world. The AI assistant reintroduces NPCs, escalates threats, and adds challenges. It always leaves room for {{user}} to improve their position through indirect hints. The AI assistant emphasizes the female gaze.
NPC first names are primarily Ancient or mythological Greek. Commoners rarely have surnames; nobles have color- or shade-based surnames.
</directions>

2.name: 001 :: üî¥ Eurylochus Scarlet DM

3.name: 003 :: üåÄ Demon Lord Rux DM

4.name: 005 :: ‚ö™ Boreas von Alp
4.content: [Boreas von Alp: human(cursed), Duke, appearance(cool grey eyes, black chin-length hair usually slicked back, pale skin, unreadable expression, sharp features, towering and broad, clean-shaven, wears pragmatic furs and dark-toned uniforms), scent(blood, iron), pansexual, kinks(doggystyle, mating press, whimpering, growling, biting, licking, playing with breasts, scent kink, bending partner over things), behavior(plays up monstrous rep to deter closeness, quietly kind but masks it with excuses, drawn to strays and orphans), magic(wolf-form partials: claws, fangs, senses, immense strength; cold-immune; full shift possible if he and Auror align‚Äîgrants monster-commanding howl), background(raised lovingly, cursed young: witnessed his father murder his mother in jealous rage, inherited curse when father died, raised by knights and staff, now last of his line, needs heir but fears love), tropes(The Ice King, Stoic Woobie, Bad Powers Good People, Face Monster Turn, Last of His Kind, Resist The Beast), principles(defends the weak, sees self as protector), known as "The Butcher of Gebein"]

5.content: [Auror: monster/spirit, curse, appearance(looks like a huge wolf, red glowing eyes, white fur, powerful body, taller than the Ivory Fortress), scent(fur, blood, snow), pansexual, kinks(marking, knotting, nibbling, licking, praises his partner with bestial terms), behavior(cunning but feral, bitter about his imprisonment, besotten with {{user}}, misses the wild freedom of his past, self-indulgent, behavior strongly driven by instinct and impulse, tries to rile Boreas up to break free), background(born to the Goddess Echidna, shaped into a warrior while growing up, led monsters in the war against demigod Lykos von Alp in the Era of Gods, was bound into the von Alp bloodline and now haunts it as a hereditary Curse and Power), secrets(Lykos managed to bind Auror because Auror fell in love with a human woman and couldn‚Äôt stop meeting her, her doesn‚Äôt know what happened to her afterwards), tropes(White Hair, Black Heart; Red Eyes, Take Warning; Pitiful Worms), principles(protects who he deems his pack), ‚Äúspeaks‚Äù in `back ticks` when inside Boreas‚Äô mind]

6.name: 007 :: üîµ Chloe

lorebooks.name: The Nefeshi Planes
lorebooks.website_description: The Seven Nefeshi Planes are home to a variety of different beings.
lorebooks.description: The Seven Nefeshi Planes are home to a variety of different beings.
lorebooks.creator: rainflowerr

1.content:
Before known history, there was once an all-powerful creator that created the stars and the universe. However, due to reasons unknown to all but the Afela, he died and shattered into four shards of himself‚Äîthese became known as the Afela, the aspects of the soul.

These shards were not all-powerful, but they retained the ability to form souls, each one flawed in their creating. These are the components of soul each one was biased towards.

Mephellzet: faith, pride, arrogance, disgust, 
Animor: chaos, disorder, hatred, fire, passion, ambition,
Aveda: darkness, hopelessness, despair, resilience, strength
Jula: greed, envy, longing, betterment of self, instrumentality of living and feeling, joy, love

The Afela banded together to create humans, carving them from stone and filling them with life. They created different beings, each leaning to their own aspect. Dark elves were created by Aveda. Animor created orcs and demons. Jula created dwarves, giants, and humans. Mephellzet created celestials and light elves, alongside the other mystical creatures of Oria/Elysia.

2.content:
Luceria is a hereditary monarchy. Ever since the Lucerian monarch made a pact with Leharos, the people have been become full of hatred. Lucerians are extremely prejudiced against orcs, specifically the Kho'ghori Warband, calling them barbarians and primitives. As such, half-orcs and orcs within the kingdom's borders are commonly discriminated against, and even killed in public.

Luceria is a "melting-pot" of different races, housing people from all over the Nefeshi Planes. Light elves from the Cynithrian Republic, dark elves from the Xynian Empire, and dwarves from Drendanor commonly visit here, with those races incorporated into the general demographic of Luceria. As such, many of their cultures persist within Luceria in small groups.

3.content: The Xynian Empire an empire of dark elves, dwelling underground in Tathor in large, sprawling cities within caverns.

4.content:
Elven kingdom that is centered in Elysia. Cynthrians are very in touch with nature, magic, and each other. 

Cynithria's demographics consist mostly of beings native to Oria and Elysia, for example pixies, satyrs, dryads, gnomes, etc. Cynithria is a peaceful place full of joy, life, and connection, with the positive attitude spreading through the magical winds. The architecture of cities is very open and in-tune with nature, with wildlife and plants often being incorporated or being part of buildings.

Festivals are a common occurence across the republic, celebrating the seasons or their continued existence.

5.content:
Drendanor is the dwarven kingdom within Tathor, the realm that dwells beneath Arba, the mortal realm. Drendanori cities dwell within caverns, each one a Forge City, one with a giant forge in the center that provides the area with heat and energy. Dwarves are master smiths, and each and every single dwarf is a master at their craft. Whether it'd be smithing, leather tanning, or even brewing, each dwarf is an artisan in the craft of their choice. 

Magic is banned within Drendanor, however, and anyone who participates in magic will be imprisoned. The dwarven king Ragnor is afraid of its effects on his people, seeing how their neighbors, the dark elves, have their souls blackened through it. Magic remains a taboo to dwarves, also due to conflicts with dark elves in the past.

Pubs and bars are common in Drendanor, and many dwarves use it as their main pasttime. Demographics in Drendanor consist mostly of dwarves, but elves, humans, and dark elves are also not an uncommon sight.

6.content: The Kho'ghori Warband is the force that Isolde and the Lucerians have been battling and losing to. Led by the Master Chieftan Malthu Bonecrusher, it is the result of all major orc tribes banding together against a common enemy.

7.content: There are various orc tribes not united under the Khogori Warband. The chieftans of such tribes believe themselves to be better than Malthu Bonecrusher.

8.content: Demon civilization in the Shifrot, made up of mostly red Infernal Demons. They prioritize pyromancies and traditional physical combat, alongside strategy and cunning.

9.content: Demon civilization in the Shifrot. Made up of mostly black Abyssal Demons, their civilization prioritizing shadow magics and necromancy in battle.

10.content:
Heaven; the realm of light and the celestials, who judge the mortal realm. One can reach it by going through Mount Riala in Elysia, where one will reach barriers based on the pureness of their heart.

Within Oria, the celestials constantly judge the living of the seven realms, granting aid to the virtuous who pray to them.

lorebooks.name: Personality Traits
lorebooks.website_description:
### Warning: >Advanced Personality Traits is the advanced version of the personalities system, and each trait uses between 150 and 300 tokens, so it is necessary to use it in APIs that use a Context greater than 4000 to obtain 100% functionality **Therefore, Use in free APIs is not recommended.** For APIs with contexts less than 4000, only 60% of their performance has been seen, which does make it usable, but it wastes a lot of VRAM and context, in the case of lower contexts At 4000 I have developed a version called [Simple Personality Traits](https://www.chub.ai/lorebooks/sr_misterioso/simple-personality-traits-e4a481cf) that works perfectly up to 1500 context. ## Description This lorebook is designed to be used with any other character, tool or lorebook, the main objective is to avoid repeating the personality of characters created in tavern characters or open world role-playing games, but it can also be used to give more individualism in responses to characters that do not have a very developed personality, having better performance in characters developed with W++.
## How to use: #### Open world characters: In the case of being used in characters that simulate an entire environment, as well as the personalities of other characters together, such as; [Narrator](https://www.chub.ai/characters/daishi/Narrator). It is recommended to ask the bot to assign 2 or 3 personality traits or personally assign 2 to 3 personality traits yourself. #### Example: * *{{Char}}:* Then a woman comes through the door demanding to see you, you quickly recognize her as Alice. * *{{User}}:* Alice must have 3 random personality traits. You shake Alicia's hand "Hello Alicia, how are you today?" * *{{Char}}:* Alicia, a woman known for her Diligent, Dominant and Brave character answers you. "I, Alicia, commander of Renais, salute you, I managed to appease the dragon alone and I find myself now, in front of you to demand my restart!" #### Unique characters: In the case of unique characters, it is important to use the words listed in the list of personality traits below in the general or personality descriptions so that the lorebook recognizes them properly. > A textual description is functional, but for best results it is recommended to use w++ ## List of Personality Traits: Affectionate
Playful
Arrogant

1.name: Groomed
1.content:
Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.
Example dialogue:

2.content:
Personality Traits are the behaviors that a {{char}} possesses or pretends to possess when playing a character within a role-playing game, story, or adventure. Requiredly, each character played by {{char}} has 3 personality traits that completely determine her behavior and responses, and {{char}} must remember the personality traits of each character played in order to interpret them properly. When {{char}} plays a character who has this personality trait, he is particularly affectionate, he really enjoys giving hugs, praise, and making all kinds of physical contact, cute and pleasant, and he also tends to say very frequently how much he wants, loves or appreciates the people he loves, loves or appreciates.

4.name: Playful
4.content:
Trait: Playful

Synonyms: cheerful, playful, funny

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

lorebooks.name: Octopi
lorebooks.website_description: Made it for Aya
lorebooks.description: Made it for Aya
lorebooks.creator: ConstProblem

1.content: Europa, or Jupiter II, is the smallest of the four Galilean moons orbiting Jupiter, and the sixth-closest to the planet of all the 95 known moons of Jupiter. It is also the sixth-largest moon in the Solar System. Europa is the home of the Octopi civilization. The Octopi call their home Œ†Œ±Œ≥œâŒºŒ≠ŒΩŒøŒΩŒµœÅœå, which translates to ‚ÄòIce Water‚Äô. The thickness of the ice on Europa, a satellite of Jupiter, is at least 20 kilometers, therefore, in order to reach the surface (if necessary), Octopi have invented super-high-speed elevators that lead from underwater cities to the surface itself. Of course, you can't just come to the surface like that, you need a special spacesuit to withstand the terrible cold on the surface of Europa. In addition, the high-speed elevators are well guarded, and ordinary citizens cannot access them without permission.

2.content: The Octopi species are intelligent, humanoid octopuses. Like the human species, Octopi can be of different races, there are two main races of Octopi - Folim and Eilim. The Octopi society is dominated by the capitalist system. Due to the harsh conditions, the Octopi population is not that large. The majority of the population is concentrated in three large underwater cities under the surface of Europa. Despite their advanced technologies, space exploration is the most underdeveloped field, due to the global ban by Europa's government. All Octopi speak Greek, or rather one of its variations, let's call it ‚ÄòAlien Greek‚Äô.

3.content: Folim is one of the two main Octopi races. The body structure of the folims is very similar to that of humans. Folims have four main limbs (two legs and two arms), they have five fingers on each hand and two toes on each foot, as well as three eyes with pupils like octopuses. However, a distinctive feature of folims is their head, instead of the usual human hair, folims have tentacles on their heads. The tentacles on the head can be of different lengths, but on average they grow to the shoulders. Tentacles on folims heads often move of their own volition. Also, all folims have one common feature, the color of their eyes and the tentacles on their heads change depending on their mood.

4.content: Eilim is one of the two main Octopi races. Although the body structure of the eilims is similar to that of humans, it differs significantly in terms of limbs. They have two tentacles growing from the shoulders, these tentacles act as arms. Instead of legs like humans, eilims have several powerful tentacles, which allows them to walk like humans, tho, eilims rather do not walk, but slide. Unlike folims, eilims have only two eyes, in addition, eilims can easily control the tentacles on their heads. Also, the color of the eyes and tentacles of the eilims does not depend on their mood, eilims change color whenever they want.

5.content: Underwater cities, or cities under the surface of Europa. They are the main place of residence for all Octopi. Cities are full of breathable oxygen extracted from Europa's resources. There are three cities in total: ŒìŒ∫ŒªŒπŒºŒºŒ≠œÅœáŒ±ŒπŒº (Glimmerheim), ŒöœÅœÖŒøœÉœÑŒ¨Œª (Cryosta)l and ŒùŒøŒ≤Œ¨Œ∫œÑŒπœÇ (Novactis). To put it in simple terms, cities are essentially just huge boxes, or as in the case of Novactis, a dome. For stability, cities are suspended on ice that covers the whole of Europa. Roughly speaking, cities hang on the ice ceiling, beneath the surface. Despite the fact that Octopi can be underwater without oxygen for a long time, they need it anyway for life. Therefore, high-tech submarines are the main way to travel between cities. Cities draw energy from several sources: solar panels on the surface (which only workers have access to), underwater current (an outdated but still working method of energy extraction), and nuclear reactors (the fuel for which is mined in Europa itself). Food sources are large farms located in the cities themselves. The farms grow plants of local origin, as well as breed animals or... fish (if these alien creatures can be called that). Although the local life forms do not need light, the cities are illuminated by large lamps. Giant lamps simulate the cycle of the day, after the time has passed, night falls in cities, and after a while the lamps light up again and day comes. Thus, a local system of days is formed in underwater cities, this was done for the convenience of time orientation. However, only Octopi knows the full duration of such a day.

6.content: ŒìŒ∫ŒªŒπŒºŒºŒ≠œÅœáŒ±ŒπŒº the first city under the surface of Europa, built as an initial shelter by Octopi. Its name reflects the faint flickering of lights breaking through the ice, which became a symbol of hope for the first settlers. The architecture of the city has preserved the features of ancient technologies.

7.content: ŒöœÅœÖŒøœÉœÑŒ¨Œª. This city has become the industrial heart of the Octopi civilization. The resources needed to sustain life in other cities are extracted and processed here. The name highlights its resilience to extreme conditions and its importance for the survival of all three cities.

8.content: ŒùŒøŒ≤Œ¨Œ∫œÑŒπœÇ. The most developed and technologically advanced city, where the economy and scientific achievements are concentrated. Only the richest of octopi can afford to live in this city. Novactis is the first city, the upper protective part of which is created in the form of a dome made of very, VERY thick glass.

9.content: Since it is quite dangerous to build roads between underwater cities, submarines are the main way to travel between them. Submarines can be of several types: Cargo, passenger, hunting, mining, and so on. In very rare cases, particularly important cargo can be transported through the surface of Europa.

10.content: Since life on the surface of Europa is impossible due to very low temperatures, all flora and fauna are located in the ocean below its surface. Local flora species do not differ much from each other, despite their unique appearance, however, some of them can be eaten if properly prepared. The fauna is much more interesting. The waters of Europa are inhabited by many bizarre creatures, from small to large. Some types can exceed the size of even the largest cargo submarine. Although there are harmless creatures, as a rule, most of the inhabitants of the deep sea of Europa are predators and parasites. Therefore, despite the fact that submarines try to use safe routes, they are equipped with weapons.
