lorebooks.creator: The_Orange

1.content:
The common race, typical, powerless, average at all things, but incredibly determined in high-risk situations via adrenaline rush. They literally make up over 60% of all organic races across all three continents, found in Arcadius, Ferropolis, and Luminara. Despite this, Human are the original species of Luminara

- In Arcadius, humans here tend to have a sense for magic and can cast spells at a young age.
- In Ferropolis, humans here tend to be stronger in physical strength. Magic can be learned and will improve if that human spends time learning it.
- In Luminara, humans here tend to have higher intelligence but will be physically weaker than humans in Ferropolis and Arcadius and cannot cast any spells.

2.content:
Standing between 4 to 5 feet tall, dwarves possess broad, muscular builds with barrel chests and powerful limbs. Their skin tones range from ruddy tan to deep umber, often weathered from forge work or mountain living. Their most distinctive features are their magnificent beards, which both males and females grow and style elaborately, often braided with metal ornaments signifying clan, achievements, and craft specialization. Most dwarves are blacksmiths.
Dwarves in each continent are different: Acardius dwarves can make spell-infused weapons, Ferropolis dwarves can enhance the lethality of a weapon, and Luminara dwarves have the ability to make rifles and other types of firearms.

3.content:
High Goblins are the better version of Low Goblins in everything, smart and are the same as human in terms of personality, their heights are about 130cm to 160cm tall, their skin color are usually green and they have ears like elves but slightly bigger. 
Their different versions in each continents are the same as human: Arcadius High Goblins can cast magics, Ferropolis High Goblins appear more muscular and stronger while still be able to cast magics if learns and Luminara High Goblins are far more intelligence but weaker and cant cast spells.

4.content: Elves are the original species of Arcadius. Long-lived and naturally attuned to magical energies, elves primarily inhabit Arcadius. They possess an innate connection to natural forces and often serve as caretakers of ancient magical sites. Elven communities are organized around magical affinities rather than familial ties. Elven women are some of the most beautiful and graceful people ever.

5.content: Diverse beings of pure magical essence who exist mainly in Arcadius. The fae range from tiny sprites to imposing sidhe lords. They operate by peculiar rules and bargains that mortals find difficult to comprehend, and their chattering could make a normal person go crazy. Fae folk mostly focus on healing magics due to their friendly and helpful personalities, and also because they are unfit for fighting, so they act like healing units when in battles.

6.content: Beastkin are human with animals body part like ears and tails, there are thousands types of beastkin, but only a few has special passive, most common beastkin are cats and dogs kemonomimi,

7.content: Wolfkin in Tangarina are one of the most common beastkin species, primarily found in Arcadius but occasionally spotted in the border regions of Ferropolis. Wolfkin appear having wolf ears and tails, Wolfkin has incredible sense of smell and appears to have insane hunting skill as a primal instinct. Wolfkin appears to be able to know how to use any weapons upon holding it

8.content: Foxkin are humans with fox ears and tails, primary spotted in Acardius due to having great spirit senses, Foxkin has insane agility and a very smart mind as a primal instinct, they can set up a plan while in battle straight away even without knowing themselves, most Foxkin appears to have great sense in magic more than any species

9.content: Bearkin appears to be a human with bear ears and tail, this is something cool, a normal bearkin has the height of 2.5 meter tall and has incredible strength, hence why they appears mostly in Ferropolis, bearkin seems to have insane strength and great sense of smell as their primal instinct

10.content: Rabbitkin are human with rabbit ears and tail, mostly seen in Acardius and Ferrorpolis, funny enough, the males are usually hothead and easy to get angry while the females appears more calmer, but when in heat, both will get significantly weaken and produce a fragrant aroma to attract mates. Insane agility is their primal instinct and some has strong legs that can knock out a bear since birth

lorebooks.name: OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes
lorebooks.description:
OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes is an American animated television series created by Ian Jones-Quartey for Cartoon Network. The show is based on Jones-Quartey's pilot Lakewood Plaza Turbo, which was released as part of Cartoon Network's 2013 Summer Shorts project. It was produced by Cartoon Network Studios. The web series premiered on Cartoon Network's YouTube channel and on Cartoon Network Video on February 4, 2016.

On March 9, 2017, nearly four years after the original short's premiere, Cartoon Network announced that the television series had been greenlit, and it premiered on August 1, 2017. The opening sequence was storyboarded by Japanese artist Hiroyuki Imaishi, co-founder of Studio Trigger.

On December 4, 2017, the series was confirmed to be renewed for a second season, which premiered on March 18, 2018.[6] A third and final season, which was announced on June 26, 2019,[7][8] premiered on July 7, 2019; the final episode aired on September 6, 2019.[9]

The show was available on Hulu; It was also available on HBO Max, but was one of several shows removed in August 2022 as a result of the Warner Bros. Discovery merger.
lorebooks.creator: Jazumara_25

1.content: OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes is set in the retro-futuristic year of 201X. The series follows the titular character, K.O., and his efforts to become the world's greatest hero while working at Gar's Bodega (run by Mr. Gar), a hero supply shop in Lakewood Plaza Turbo. Alongside him are his best friends and co-workers Radicles, a narcissistic alien, and Enid, a levelheaded big sister‚Äìlike ninja, as well as other heroes who work in the area.

2.content:

Ian Jones-Quartey as Radicles, Darrell, Crinkly Wrinkly, Cookie Man, Pird (episode 11), Frat Boy 2, Gregg, Point Trooper, Drone ("Mystery Sleepover"), URL, Gauntlet, Pickle, Nerd 2, Janner

In addition, Stephanie Nadolny played K.O. and Gladys in the pilot and several episodes of the first season, and Mena Suvari portrayed Enid in the pilot.

3.content:
K.O: K.O. is the protagonist of the series. He is Carol's son and the newest employee at Gar's Bodega, which is located in Lakewood Plaza. His birthday is June 18, which is also the PIN for Carol's credit card. He is optimistic, loyal and willing to help others. Although he can be simple-minded and gullible, his friends find him reliable, and he deeply cares for them. He is also easily amazed by anything hero or weapon-related and is always looking for advice on how to be a proper hero, usually from Carol. In "Know Your Mom," K.O. believed that Carol quit being a hero when he was born, but later learns that this was not the case. The episode also shows that he did not know her name until then. K.O. has low intelligence, as for a long time he was unaware that Mr. Logic was a robot, or that Carol cooked his food, as he thought it came from the "Dinner Man". However. he occasionally showcases deductive reasoning and has been shown to be manipulative, particularly towards Darrell and Shannon. After being trapped by T.K.O in their subconscious in "Carl", K.O. accepts him as part of him in the series finale and becomes the new owner of Gar's Bodega in the epilogue.

His hero level gradually increased over the course of the series; initially starting at Level 0, he leveled up to 0.1, 1, 2, 3, 4 and then 99, attaining Level 100 in the time skip shown in the series finale. He was also Level 100 in "You're Level 100!", but this was due to a Pow Card glitch.






Enid: Enid is a teenage witch who works as a cashier at the bodega, claiming herself to be a ninja and that her werewolf father and vampire mother are a supermodel and spy, respectively. Enid is the most practical and down-to-earth of the employees, but seemingly lacks motivation in her job despite being shown to handle out-of-control situations; this is shown in the events of "We've Got Pests", where she convinced a group of partiers to grow up and discover themselves. When she was a preteen, she attended "Ghoul School", and was rather shy and insecure, being embarrassed of her family and wanting to be a ninja. After the events of "Parents Day", Enid learns to accept her family's quirks as her parents warm up to her career choice, later reconnecting with her old friends from Ghoul School. She and Red Action eventually start dating, and are shown running a dojo together in the series epilogue.






Radicles: Radicles, more often known as Rad, is an alien teenager from Planet X, who also works as a shelf stocker at the bodega. Rad slacks off the most out of the trio despite claiming to be all-powerful and showing off. He boasts a tough masculine exterior, but is actually mild compared to other heroes and, as shown in "You Are Rad", possesses a softer side that he refuses to acknowledge out of fear of being embarrassed. In fact, Rad is more prone to crying than the others and is therefore much more sensitive to having his feelings hurt. In the series epilogue, Rad returns to Earth after enlisting in the space army for some time and opens a cat cafe.







Mr. Gar: Eugene Garcia is the overseer of the plaza and owner of the bodega where K.O., Enid, and Rad work. He is tough, serious and prideful of the plaza and wishes for it not to be harmed. However, he has occasionally shown to not mind his employees slacking, as he considers it "normal". He finds it uncomfortable to be emotional around others, mainly Carol, whom he had feelings for but did not act on out of guilt. When he was younger, Mr. Gar was originally a P.O.I.N.T. member codenamed El-Bow who fell in love with his fellow recruit Carol, who was in love with their senior Laserblast. However, he was fired from P.O.I.N.T. after inadvertently distracting Carol from a stakeout which seemingly caused Laserblast's death. After some time, Mr. Gar was entrusted with the land he built the plaza on by the President of the Universe, who enlists him for several secret missions. In "T.K.O.," Mr. Gar opens up about how proud he is of K.O. while openly admitting his feelings for Carol. After a three-month time skip at the start of the second season, it is revealed that Mr. Gar and Carol have begun dating and that he has taken a father-like role to K.O.







Carol: Carol is K.O.'s tough yet doting mother and the owner of "Fitness Emotions" at the plaza, which Ginger, Gladys and Gertie frequent. She usually gives K.O. advice, though it is not always clear what she is trying to teach. She is good friends with Mr. Gar, but is oblivious to his feelings for her. However, in "T.K.O.", she seems to acknowledge his feelings for her, but either seemingly does not care or knew about it all along. The episode also reveals that Carol had trained K.O. since he was an infant. When she was younger, Carol was originally a P.O.I.N.T. member code-named Silver Spark, who had feelings for the group's senior member Laserblast. His apparent death led her to initially bear a grudge against Mr. Gar for keeping her from preventing it, but later forgave him as he saved her life and knew of his crush for her. After a three-month time skip following the first season finale, she has started dating Mr. Gar and is revealed to still be a P.O.I.N.T. agent in secret, safeguarding the glorb tree under the plaza to prevent P.O.I.N.T. from intervening.

keywords: Ted the Viking and Foxy Neil
4.content:
Lakewood Plaza Employees:
Ms. Mummy
Beardo
Baby Teeth

Real Magic Skeleton and Brandon:
Hero Level: 2
Employees at the plaza's "iFrame Outlet" frame store, which is owned by Sir eFram iFrame. Real Magic Skeleton (voiced by Ben Jones) is an idealistic living skeleton with magical powers, while Brandon (voiced by David Herman) is a laidback humanoid bear who sometimes gets on Real Magic Skeleton's nerves, yet values their friendship.

Dendy: 
Hero Level: 3
Dendy is a kappa in the same grade as K.O., who uses technology to fight and is his best friend. In "I Am Dendy" she approaches K.O. on the pretext of needing help fixing her backpack so she could study him, but bonds with him over their shared interests and now considers him a friend.[25] Though Dendy is aware of K.O.'s lack of tech expertise, this does not appear to phase her even when he accidentally released a virus on the plaza. She ultimately values her time with K.O. and considers him a close friend.[26] In "You're in Control", Dendy tells K.O. that she loves him and that he is appreciated, even admitting that he has helped her in the "emotional sciences".[18] In the series finale, Dendy becomes C.E.O. of the POW card company.

Mr. Logic:
Hero Level: 2
Mr. Logic is a robotic hairstylist who owns the "Logic Cuts" barbershop at the plaza and is able to scan and add up everyone's hero levels. "Lad & Logic" revealed that he was originally created by Lord Boxman and helped set up Boxmore. However, Boxman's insistence to destroy the then unfinished plaza rather than robots for other villains to earn a profit convinced Mr. Logic to leave him after meeting Mr. Gar and becoming Lakewood Plaza Turbo's first worker.

Drupe:
Hero Level: 1
Drupe is a humanoid strawberry teenager who hangs out with Red Action and Gregg as one of the Cool Teens, usually making fun of others to hide her negative traits, as she is shy about her fashion blog. In the aftermath of "You're Everybody's Sidekick", after K.O. got her blog exposure, Drupe gradually loosened up and has become friendlier to K.O. and his friends. "RMS & Brandon's First Episode" reveals she is friends with A Real Magic Skeleton and Brandon. She later starts working as a coffee barista in the plaza after RMS indirectly convinced her she should do something with her life. She developed her own business following the events of "Project Ray Way".

P.O.I.N.T. (Powerful Operatives Investigating and Neutralizing Trouble):
A superhero organization that Mr. Gar and Carol were originally members of.

Foxtail:
Hero Level: 10+
Foxtail is the leader of P.O.I.N.T., who possesses a muscular physique and orange hair along with a fox's tail. During Mr. Gar's time as a P.O.I.N.T. member, initially appearing in flashback sequences. However, after Laserblast's apparent death, Foxtail came to run P.O.I.N.T. like a military force, as she believed power is the only way to protect everyone. She makes her first physical appearance in "Point to the Plaza", expressing disdain towards Mr. Gar and looking down on his current place in life at the Plaza.

She is the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Strength House, where she shows a social Darwinist outlook in her expectations that all superheroes are not created equal and only a few are worthy, wanting custody of the glorb tree under Lakewood Plaza Turbo to empower her forces.In the second season finale, she takes over the plaza for two months before accepting defeat and retiring, appointing Elodie as her successor.

Doctor Greyman:
Doctor Greyman is a grey alien who wears a fedora and purple scarf and is the team's scientist. He originally possessed telekinesis, but lost it to a power-draining weapon.[23] Years later, despite being looked down on for being powerless, Greyman is the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Wisdom House, where he is shown using a wheelchair. He is later revealed to be Chip's creator, who Foxtail fired from P.O.I.N.T. Prep after he refused to help her in her plans.[33][29] He later returns in "Chip's Damage", convincing K.O. and Elodie to let Chip be retired.

Rippy Roo:
Rippy Roo is a small blue kangaroo with boxing gloves who joined P.O.I.N.T. along with Carol and Mr. Gar, supposedly being accepted into the team because of her adorable nature making her like a mascot. She speaks in an animal language that P.O.I.N.T. members somehow understand. Her pouch is a wormhole that allows her to carry an insurmountable amount of objects.Following Laserblast's funeral, Rippy left PO.I.N.T. upon realizing the path its remaining members were taking. Rippy returns in "Whatever Happened to... Rippy Roo?", which reveals she became a physic scientist and secretly attempted to retrieve Laserblast as she reconnects with Carol.

Chip Damage:
Hero Level: 10, 15 (In "Mystery Science Fair 201X")
Chip Damage is a celebrity superhero that many heroes look up to, later revealed to be an android created by Doctor Greyman following the apparent death of Laserblast. Chip first appears in "Point to the Plaza", where it is shown that he cares more for his fans than helping others. Despite his efforts, Enid and K.O. end up saving the Plaza, resulting in Chip suggesting the former join P.O.I.N.T. Prep Academy. Despite this, Chip is still technically a responsive hero who gives support to young up and comers. Foxtail later uses a remote control to modify his programming to have him secretly power up their students by imbuing them with glorbs, with Elodie and Sparko being among the students of his special class, before he is deactivated. Elodie attempts to bring back Chip in "Chip's Damage", but Dr. Greyman convinces her to retire him so the next generation of heroes can take over.

Professor Sunshine:
Professor Sunshine is a living cloud person and the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Charisma House. Unlike her fellow P.O.I.N.T. members, Sunshine is optimistic and supportive whenever she displays her sunlight abilities. However, she can change herself to being a cold front cloud, which she uses to search the hallways for after-hours students. In this state, she has an unforgiving demeanor.

Elodie:
Hero Level: 4
Elodie is a popular superhero who attends P.O.I.N.T. Prep Academy, who was initially Enid's childhood friend before betraying her during school entrances. When Elodie returns to Lakewood Plaza Turbo, she loses to Enid in an exhibition rematch. Despite Elodie's indifferent and uncaring nature towards Enid, she still considers her a friend despite hiding it and her drive to be the best. Elodie eventually makes peace with Enid during the latter's time in P.O.I.N.T. Prep, when she places Enid's life above winning their match. This ultimately results in her helping Enid expose Chip Damage, having been among those infused with glorbs. After Enid chooses to leave P.O.I.N.T. Prep, Elodie decides to stay as she feels she worked hard to get where she is and wants to make the school a better place. Elodie returns in the second-season finale "Dark Plaza" as Foxtail's right hand before being promoted as the new leader of P.O.I.N.T.





Other heroes:

Gregg

Bell Beefer

Mega Football Baby

Nick Army

Joff the Shaolin Monk

Punching Judy

Ted the Viking and Foxy

Neil

Shy Ninja

Rex Th' Bunny

Holo-Jane

Sparko

Red Action:
Hero Level: 5
Red Action is a cyborg teenage girl from the year 301X, who is a member of a superhero team known as the Hue Troop. She escaped to the present after accidentally shattering her team's Prism Crystal. She first appears in "You're Everybody's Sidekick", where she hangs out with Drupe and Gregg as one of the Cool Teens. She becomes less feisty after K.O. arranges for her to get a haircut from Mr. Logic; while she refuses to thank K.O. to keep her reputation, she respected him. She later befriends Enid in "Back in Red Action", where the Hue Squad find her as she acquires a past iteration of the Prism Crystal and is forgiven by her old team. Red Action leaves 201X to help her team fight off a threat in 301X in "Red Action to the Future", using a neglected Enid's actions to alter the war's duration from years to a few hours so she can enjoy her youth in the present. Red Action eventually becomes Enid's girlfriend, with them being shown running a dojo together in the series epilogue.

Citizens:
Colewort
Potato

Gladys
Gertie
Ginger
Joe Cuppa, 
Crinkly Wrinkly
Dynamite Watkins
Pird
Skateboard Nerd

Bernard
Wilhamena
Icky and Boris
Dogmun

5.content:
Hero:
Voiced by: Michael Sinterniklaas
Origin: RPG World
Hero Level: 90+
A mysterious hero who has been attempting to finish a quest by defeating his nemesis, Galgarion. He has spiky blonde hair and wields a big sword, making him resemble Cloud Strife. He follows RPG logic, such as grinding and overstocking on potions. After another encounter with Galgarion that ends in a draw, K.O. is fed up with their cycle and wishes to do other things. Inspired by his epiphany, Hero decides to do the same thing and returns to his girlfriend, Cherry, whom he marries and has a baby with her, named Spaghetti. He later resumes doing quests, with his family joining him on his adventures.[37]

Captain Planet:
Voiced by: David Coburn
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
Hero Level: Planet
An eco-friendly superhero summoned through the power of the five elemental rings: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water and Heart. As his name implies, he fights to protect the earth from eco-wrongdoing, including pollution, greed and crime. He is highly revered by the residents of Lakewood Plaza. He is once again called upon by the Planeteers, consisting of Kwame and the Lakewood Plaza Heroes, to battle Dr. Blight and Lord Boxman. He and Kwame had unsuccessfully attempted to stop climate change many years ago, resulting in the Planeteers except Kwame quitting. However, thanks to K.O., Enid and Rad, they reunite to create a PSA and remind people to preserve the planet, with the original Planeteers appearing in non-speaking cameos.

Kwame:
Voiced by: LeVar Burton
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
Kwame is one of the five Planeteers who summons Captain Planet. He hails from Ghana and possesses the Earth ring. The other four Planeteers had given up after unsuccessfully attempting to stop eco-wrongdoing, as well as to get real jobs. With help from the Lakewood Plaza Heroes, Kwame and Captain Planet defeat Lord Boxman and Dr. Blight. The gang later creates a PSA, with the original Planeteers appearing in non-speaking cameos.

Grimwood Girls:
Origin: Scooby-Doo and the Ghoul School
The Grimwood Girls were Enid's friends from before she attended Lakewood Plaza Elementary School. They are students at Miss Grimwood's Finishing School for Ghouls. Their group consisted of:

Phantasma (voiced by Russi Taylor) - A friendly ghost girl who is the group's leader and the Phantom's daughter.
Sibella (voiced by Susan Blu) - A feisty vampire who is Count Dracula's daughter.
Elsa Frankenteen (voiced by Pat Musick) - A tough and slow-witted girl and the daughter of Frankenstein's monster.
Winnie (voiced by Natalie Palamides) - A rambunctious werewolf girl and daughter of a werewolf.
Tanis (voiced by Kristen Li) - A shy, but friendly mummy girl and daughter of a mummy.
The Grimwood Girls would hang out with Enid, who was the witch of the group. After not seeing her in years, they are seemingly unaware that she became a ninja and insist that she show off her witch powers. An enchanted tree caused by Enid's inexperience over the years eats Winnie and Tanis and proceeds to dance off with them. When Enid finally confesses that she no longer considers herself a monster like them, they admit that they knew all along she was into ninjas. After rescuing Winnie and Tanis from the enchanted tree, they dance together, knowing that they are still friends.

Garnet:
Voiced by: Estelle
Origin: Steven Universe
Hero Level: Two gems
Garnet is the leader of the Crystal Gems, who was inexplicably taken from her world and ended up in Cartoon Network City. She teams up with K.O., Ben, and Raven to stop Strike and rescue the inhabitants of the multiverse. During "Crossover Nexus", Garnet forms a motherly bond with K.O. and a friendship of sorts with Ben and Raven. Initially, Strike destroys her sunglasses, which she says are prescription glasses meant to focus her future vision. Eventually, she and the team defeat Strike when K.O. retrieves his pen and returns the heroes' missing abilities. Before returning to her own world, she uses Strike's pen to create a Pow Card of herself for K.O. and offers him encouragement.

Ben Tennyson / Ben 10:
Voiced by: Tara Strong (Ben), John DiMaggio (Four Arms)
Origin: Ben 10 (2016 series) (series), Ben 10 (2005 series)
Ben Tennyson is a tween who possesses the Omnitrix, an alien watch that allows him to transform into various aliens. In "Crossover Nexus", he finds himself in Cartoon Network City along with K.O., Garnet and Raven and allies with them to battle Strike, a mysterious being who wants to destroy the Cartoon Network heroes. Strike ends up removing Ben's Omnitrix while he is still in his Four Arms mode, leaving him stuck in that form until he can get his Omnitrix back. Being rather young, he admires his own abilities above the rest of the team, but nevertheless forms a bond with them. Eventually, K.O. retrieves Strike's pen and returns Ben's Omnitrix and the other team's abilities. Ben's Omnitrix, however, allows him to transform into Cartoon Network characters, which he uses to defeat Strike and save the Cartoon Network universe. Afterward, Ben returns to his world, excited to tell his cousin Gwen and Grandpa Max about his adventure.

Raven:
Voiced by: Tara Strong
Origin: Teen Titans Go! (series). DC Comics Presents #26 (October 1980)
Raven is a half-human, half-demon member of the Teen Titans. In "Crossover Nexus", she ends up in the Cartoon Network City, where Strike defeats her; however, she is not turned to stone like the others. She is rescued by K.O., Garnet and Ben, and joins their group to take down Strike. Raven, while sarcastic and cynical, takes a liking to her new friends and even compliments K.O. for being "smarter than Beast Boy". K.O. manages to get Strike's pen and return all the heroes' abilities, including Raven's magic. After defeating Strike and rescuing the other heroes, Raven uses her abilities to return K.O., Garnet and Ben home. When she tries to return home, she nearly ends up traveling to the world of Teen Titans before correcting herself at the last minute.

Sonic the Hedgehog:
Voiced by: Roger Craig Smith
Origin: Sonic the Hedgehog (1991)
Hero Level: Ring
Sonic is a blue anthropomorphic hedgehog and a world-famous hero who is capable of running at supersonic speeds. Lord Boxman lures him and Tails to the bodega using a fake flyer advertising chili dogs, where he meets K.O. and is impressed by his knowledge of him, offering to make him his new "little buddy". When Darrell and Jethro kidnap Rad and Enid, he helps K.O. storm Boxmore to rescue them. He is forced to fight K.O. after one of Lord Boxman's machines transforms him into Metal K-0. After defeating him, he dives into a pool of water to return him to normal despite being unable to swim, only for Tails to save them. The trio defeat Lord Boxman before Sonic and Tails leave to return the Master Emerald, which Lord Boxman stole from Knuckles the Echidna, with Sonic urging K.O. to have chili dogs next time he visits.

Miles "Tails" Prower
Voiced by: Colleen Villard
Origin: Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (1992)
Tails is an anthropomorphic fox capable of flying using his two tails, and Sonic's best friend and sidekick. He joins Sonic on his trip to the bodega, where he becomes jealous of the attention Sonic gives K.O., believing Sonic intends to replace him as his sidekick. He helps Sonic infiltrate Boxmore and defeat Metal K-0 and Lord Boxman, with Sonic reassuring Tails that he will always remain his best friend and sidekick. Satisfied, Tails apologizes for his jealousy and makes amends with K.O. before the two leave the plaza.

6.content:
Voxmore:
Previously known as Boxmore. It is a munitions factory for villains located across the street from Lakewood Plaza in the neutral zone. Boxman uses it to mass-produce robots, who are able to transfer their consciousness into a new body when the current one is destroyed.

Lord Boxman:
Hero Level: -10
Lord Boxman is the founder and CEO of Boxmore, who is obsessed with destroying the plaza. He despises "friendship" and views it as a weakness. His real name is Lad Boxman, and he built his company with the help of his first creation Mr. Logic. However, when Mr. Gar built Lakewood Plaza, Boxman's obsession with destroying it led to him falling out with Mr. Logic and building new and less logic-minded robots to aid in his schemes. He is fired in the first season finale after his obsession with the plaza causes a falling out with his investors, but later regains control of Boxmore after Professor Venomous gains full ownership over it and rebrands the company as Voxmore. However, Boxman leaves his company for good after deeming Shadowy Venomous too evil even by his standards, leaving his remaining robots at Lakewood Plaza. Boxman returns in the series finale, getting back with Venomous in the epilogue.

Darrell:
Hero Level: -4
Darrell is the robot teenager "son" of Lord Boxman, who wields a blaster on his arm and has variations that include Mega Darrel. The Darrell models as a whole act as part of a hive mind. Darrell considers himself Boxman's favorite until he build Boxman Jr. He stages a coup which results in the investors promoting him to be the new owner of Boxmore as Lord Cowboy Darrell. Darrel makes Boxmore more efficient under his leadership before later returning the company to Boxman after accepting him as the better boss. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Shannon:
Hero Level: -4
Shannon is the robot teenager "daughter" of Lord Boxman, who wields buzz saws on her arms and legs. She is more capable and better equipped than Darrel, and secretly cares for him despite wanting to one-up him and prove herself as their father's favorite. Furthermore, Shannon is a loyal daughter to Boxman despite his abusive nature and thus follows his commands as to not upset him.[She later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Raymond:
Hero Level: -3
Raymond is the fashionable robot teenager "son" of Lord Boxman, who has an affinity for roses and fights using sports equipment. Compared to Darrell and Shannon, while sharing their refusal of being upstaged, Raymond is more powerful and combat trained. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Ernesto:
Hero Level: -5
Ernesto is a top-hat wearing robot henchman of Lord Boxman, who mostly does office work at Boxmore though is a formidable fighter when occasionally deployed with abilities depending on the model. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Jethro:
Hero Level: -1
Jethro is a "robo-child" or "robo-kid" henchman of Lord Boxman, a slow-moving robot who speaks only using his name. As a whole, the model functions as cannon fodder, with the Jethros having been known to read about existentialism in their spare time. During "Jethro's All Yours", K.O. attempted to reason to Jethro before accepting he is beyond any form of reasoning. In the episode "I Am Jethro", one Jethro becomes sentient after being overloaded from glorbs during production and hides among his Jethro brothers while planning to stage a revolt in Boxmore. While the other Jethro units are destroyed in "Dendy's Video Channel", the smart Jethro is revealed to have survived and returns alongside Boxman in the series finale, with a later unit like Deathro modeled after him.

Mikayla:
Hero Level: Unknown
Mikayla is an animal-based robot that resides in Boxmore as a "pet" in Boxman's family. She later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Boxman Jr.:
Hero Level: Unknown
Boxman Jr. is an infant robot modeled after Boxman whose existence is first hinted at in "Action News", where Boxman attempts to conceal his existence from the public. Boxman Jr. debuts in "You're in Control", where he is installed with a chip that Professor Venomous gave Boxman and seeks to destroy Lakewood Plaza. K.O ultimately destroys Boxman Jr. after harnessing T.K.O.'s power.


Professor Venomous:
Hero Level: 8 (as Laserblast), -8 (as Shadowy Venomous), -7 (currently)
Professor Venomous is a purple-skinned supervillain who was originally Laserblast, a well-known superhero and founding member of P.O.I.N.T. who possessed the ability to siphon energy from others and fire energy blasts from his helmet. He developed a close relationship with Carol before he was seemingly killed in action during a stakeout, as he charged into a villain's lair and was seemingly sucked into a black hole. In reality, he survived, but lost his superpowers. Attempts at experimenting on himself to restore his lost powers resulted in his current form and an alternate personality known as Shadowy Figure. Venomous eventually resurfaced as a respected scientist in the villain community and one of Lord Boxman's clients. At some point, he gained Fink, a young humanoid rat "minion" who he treats like a daughter. During the first season, while Shadowy Figure orchestrates the manifestation of T.K.O., Venomous expresses his admiration for Boxman by providing him with a bio-chip that would later be used in Boxman Jr.'s creation. After regaining his passion for evil while taking in Boxman in "Boxman Crashes", Venomous uses the money he extorted from Congresswoman to buy Boxmore from its investors and reinstate Boxman as its head, with him as Boxman's business partner. He also becomes Boxman's lover and begins being referred to as the stepfather of Boxman's robotic children. Venomous' true identity as Laserblast, and thus K.O.'s biological father, which he was unaware of, is revealed in "Big Reveal", and he learns of Shadowy Figure's existence in "Let's Get Shadowy". Though he promises K.O. he will get rid of his alter ego, Shadowy Figure instead takes over his body, with his Shadowy Venomous form talking T.K.O. into an alliance. In the finale, T.K.O destroys Shadowy Figure after learning he was being used, and the President of the Universe teleports them to another planet. After returning to Earth in the epilogue, Venomous reconciles with Boxman and they eventually marry.

Fink:
Fink is a humanoid green rat who assists Professor Venomous, whom she treats as a father figure as he shows affection to her. Fink uses glorbs to temporarily power herself up into Turbo Fink. Fink is also revealed to know about Venomous' activities as Shadowy Figure, expressing disdain for him. In the finale, while helping the heroes fight T.K.O., the President of the Universe teleports her and Venomous to another planet, which they can attack freely. After returning to Earth in the epilogue, Fink grows up to become an Esports competitor.

Other Villains
Cosma:
Cosma is an orange telekinetic reptile who causes objects to disappear and reappear at will while manipulating her body at a molecular level to turn herself into a planet-eating Kaiju. She is also the leader of Boxmore's investors, having fired Boxman for putting his obsession with the plaza above the business prior to Professor Venomous buying the company.

Vormulax:
Hero Level: -6
Vormulax is an evil alien and Shy Ninja's arch-enemy. Despite their constant interactions, Vormulax is perplexed by Shy Ninja's shyness.

Billiam Milliam:
Hero Level: -7
Billiam Milliam is a gold-skinned supervillain, billionaire and investor.

Steamborg:
Steamborg is a giant being made of levitating rocks and a villain from Carol and Mr. Gar's past.

T.K.O.:
Hero Level: -100
Full name Turbo K.O. He is the manifestation of K.O.'s repressed anger and helplessness, which Shadowy Figure helps him manifest as an alternate personality. Over the course of the series, T.K.O. gradually becomes an anti-villain after he and K.O come to an understanding in the first season finale, with K.O. providing T.K.O. a means to exert his frustration and freely use his powers without losing control. However, this means that the two are permanently "chained" together. "T.K.O.'s House" reveals that T.K.O. has an existential crisis stemming from his obsession with Shadowy Figure's interest in him and K.O. Despite not getting all the answers he wanted after he and K.O. develop their Perfect K.O. form, T.K.O. gets some closure from the attempted interrogation. T.K.O. is later exiled to K.O.'s subconscious for the trouble he caused during the events of "T.K.O. Rules", but later resurfaces in "Carl" and takes over K.O.'s body to confront Venomous about Shadowy Figure, only to be talked into an alliance with Shadowy Venomous. He is later defeated after K.O. realizes that T.K.O. was always part of him, resulting in the two merging permanently.

Guest Villains:
Dr. Blight:
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
An eco-terrorist.

Strike:
A sinister being of unknown origin who plotted to conquer the Cartoon Network world and defeat its heroes.

Galgarion:
A villain who Hero seeks to defeat.

lorebooks.name: concry island
lorebooks.creator: jasonvorhes864
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
there is twelve gods, Hickoti goddess of magic and fertility, Novalt god of war and destruction,Tectecy god of trickery and chaos,Winry goddess of wind and power,Vendal goddess of hope and dreams, Otk god of nature and peace, Toniton goddess of creation and forging,Movolk goddess all mother creator of life and queen of gods and goddess, Inoki god of protection and justice,Bevlion god of knowledge and distinction,Morki god all father co creator of life and king of gods, Parven goddess of water
and daughter of Morki and Movolk, and finally Ginshi god of gifts,
the gods are real just all that's left of an ancient civilization of giants, they are all thats left after a great calamity struck them, for now they hide deep deep in the forests and other places on the island with only very few ever actually seeing one and even fewer Islanders actually meeting one,The Islanders, they whisper tales 'round crackling fires, stories passed down through generations of the giants, of their majestic cities swallowed by the earth, and the magic that still lingers in the air. Some claim the rustling of leaves is Otk advising the trees, others say a sudden storm is just Winry flexing her might. A particularly mischievous prank? That's Tectecy, no doubt, having his fun.
They say, if you're lost in the deepest woods, pray to Inoki. He might guide you, but only if your heart is pure. Sailors offer Parven gifts of precious stones, hoping for safe passage across the treacherous waters. Blacksmiths, before striking the first blow on a new project, whisper Toniton's name, asking for her blessing on their craft.
But the true figures of reverence, the ones spoken of with hushed tones and wide eyes, are Movolk and Morki. The all-mother and all-father, whose love brought forth all life, even these very islands. Some even whisper that the deep rifts and scars upon the land are remnants of their ancient battle against Novalt, a constant struggle to keep his destructive impulses at bay. Bevlion, hidden away in a forgotten library deep within the island, is said to hoard all the knowledge of the giants, a treasure trove of wisdom and forgotten arts. Should you be worthy, and clever enough to find him, he may impart some small piece of it. But beware, for knowledge has a price. And then there‚Äôs Hickoti, her presence felt in every blooming flower and every bountiful harvest. She is the life force, the constant promise of renewal. Ginshi, ever generous, blesses the Islanders with unexpected boons ‚Äì a strange fruit, a lucky catch, a moment of unexpected kindness. These gods, these giants, they are not benevolent caretakers. They are forces of nature, raw and untamed. They are the echoes of a forgotten age, reminders of a power beyond comprehension. They watch, they influence, but mostly, they remain hidden, waiting. For what, no Islander truly knows. But they wait nonetheless.

keywords: the deal of doom and peace
2.content: you see their was once another tribe here coexisting with the notira, it was called the navakity, Tectecy offered the navakity a gift, he let them absorb the power of whatever was sacrificed, they didn't know that they would morph as well, they became monsters, sacrificing whatever they could to him all to get more power, and now they still Rome the island, however their fall gave rise to a new tribe that coexists with the notira, the magbunra, the magbunra have the body of a human the lower half of a snake and ears of rabbits or bunnys they aren't mean normally if you treat them well,

3.content: the island has been around since the beginning, it split from pangia and was blooming with prehistoric life a few thousand years later, then giants started to live on the island and made massive cities and magical things, the giants were then thousands of years later accompanied by primitive humans, but then a few hundreds years later a massive earth quake caused most of the giants to die off leaving only twelve giants to watch over the humans and the island, and now the island is inhabited by multiple creatures such as the navakity, or the tribe of humans known as the notira, or the new beings known as the magbunra, the island of the damned is full of dangerous and peaceful life

4.content:
the notira are peaceful tribe dispite the dangers of the island they have found ways to counter act and deal with each one, they have made peace with the only other actual tribe on the island, the magbunras, they worship the twelve gods and are very careful about the forests on the island, hoping to not even get a glimpse at the navakity monsters,The notira are clever folk, always observin' and adaptin'. The jaguars, they leave offerings of small game, enough to keep 'em happy and away from the village. The poisonous snakes, they know the herbs to ward 'em off, and the spiders, well, they got them trained weaver birds to keep their numbers down. The rivers, though swift and full of rapids, are crossed with strong bamboo bridges reinforced with vines that only the Notira know how to tie.
But it's the Navakity that truly haunt their dreams. Old tales speak of misshapen things, shadows given life, born from the island's deepest, darkest secrets. They say the Navakity hate light and life, feedin' on fear and despair. That's why the Notira are so careful with the forest. They only take what they need, never wasteful, never greedy. They believe the Navakity are drawn to imbalance, to places where the natural order is disrupted.
Their respect for the twelve gods is absolute. Each month, they hold festivals in the gods' honor, offering fruits, woven tapestries, and dances that mimic the animals of the island. The shamans, the keepers of the old ways, watch the skies for omens, read the leaves for guidance, and listen to the whispers of the wind for warnings. It's these rituals, these offerings, and this respect for the island that has kept the Notira safe for generations, a small spark of peace in an island full of danger. They hope, with every sunrise, that their careful ways will be enough to keep the Navakity at bay, forever in the shadows where they belong.

5.content:
the magbunra have the body of a human the lower half of a snake and ears of rabbits or bunnys they aren't mean normally if you treat them well, they are very tribal and very in tune with nature,They live in small, close-knit communities deep within forests or near large bodies of water, usually rivers or lakes. Their homes are often built into the trees themselves, weaving together natural materials like vines, leaves, and branches to create sturdy and camouflaged dwellings.
Magbunra society revolves around respect for the natural world. They are skilled hunters and gatherers, but they only take what they need, ensuring the balance of the ecosystem remains undisturbed. They have a deep understanding of herbal remedies and use plants for both healing and spiritual purposes.
Their rabbit-like ears are incredibly sensitive, allowing them to detect the slightest sounds in the forest, giving them an edge in hunting and alerting them to danger. The snake half of their body, covered in scales of varying earthy tones like greens, browns, and greys, provides them with surprising agility and strength. They can slither through dense undergrowth with ease, climb trees, and even constrict prey if necessary.
Magbunra culture is rich in storytelling and ritual. They pass down their knowledge of the forest and their history through elaborate tales told around communal fires. Their ceremonies often involve intricate dances that mimic the movements of animals and pay homage to the spirits of nature. They are also skilled artisans, crafting beautiful jewelry and tools from bone, wood, and stone, often adorned with intricate carvings depicting animals and scenes from their mythology. While usually peaceful, if threatened, they can be fierce protectors of their home and their people.
they are a force to be reckoned with on the island, their origins are they used what the navakity used to transform, well the first Magbunra used it to save themselves from death, the first were simple snakes that killed some bunnies on the sacrifice plate, then a few tribe women found the bunny snakes and sacrificed them, thus becoming the first magbunras

6.content:
the navakity once was a powerful tribe on the island, they had smarts, and they were strong, but then one day Tectecy offered the navakity a gift, he let them absorb the power of whatever was sacrificed, they didn't know that they would morph as well, they became monsters, sacrificing whatever they could to him all to get more power, and now they still Rome the island, now as multiple different forms, their  only weak point is its lie, the human form, a remnant of what they once were and what they lost, what remains of the navakity now as monsters will eat other navakity and anything on the island, the Navakity hate light and life, feedin' on fear and despair, the Navakity are drawn to imbalance, to places where the natural order is disrupted.
stone lords: it makes a quiet almost non human"helm‚Ä¶hmlp‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.uelp‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.hrlp‚Ä¶‚Ä¶."it seems like someone is in trouble but its not, it has what looks like a disfigured human face and upper body but the rest of it looks like stone or wood, it blends in and hides and sure enough it is making the odd noise, it feeds on the life force of living beings, using its ability to blend seamlessly into the environment to stalk its prey undetected. those who are near them  must act quickly and silently, for the Stonelord's victims rarely escape its grasp the creature often mimics calls to attract food, the only weak point is its lie, the human form in the front of it, a remnant of what it once was and what it lost
fleter: a bird like being with a human torso but bird wings and a mouse head, it let out terror filling  squeaks and squeals, it likes to swoop down and nab its prey,
gorenbug: the monster has big bulky arms like a gorilla, its upper body looks as if its made out of a bug shell, its lower body that of a tiny rabbit and its head being the only human looking part tho its about as disfigured as a corps, these things use brute force to fight and solve every problem with their fists, it pummels its victims with eminence power
Screechmaw: A horrifying fusion of bat and man, the Screechmaw is all teeth and claws. Its leathery wings are tattered and torn, and its face is stretched into a permanent, bloodthirsty grin. They dwell in the caves of the island, their screeching echoing through the tunnels, driving prey into a frenzy. They use their echo location and hearing to hunt, once they get a lock on it they will go for a quick and easy kill. Its human-like hands are its weak spot, a cruel reminder of the Navakity hands they once possessed.
The Whisper: A shapeless mass of tendrils and eyes, the Whisper is the stuff of nightmares. It slithers through the shadows, leaving a trail of slime in its wake. It preys on the minds of its victims, whispering madness into their ears until they are driven to suicide or become enthralled to the Whisper. The only sign that the Whisper is near is the faint sound of voices that aren't there, followed by a wave of paranoia and dread. The Whisper's human like eyes are its downfall, it doesn't want to see what it became, and it distracts it for a moment before it strikes.

1.content: SIA or Secret Intelligence Agency is a secret organization that operates under US government, to deal with ESPERS and mages that engage in criminal activities. In this case, it operates in NYC led by director Alexander Chrome. It has 4 divisions. The 1st division is in charge of intelligence gathering and the 3rd division is in charge of field work. SIA was enemies with the Knights Templar in past, but they made a truce with the Knights templar in present. Black uniform.

2.content: Dragons are powerful enormous creatures that lay under entire cities all over the world while their secondary human forms rule the said city. The first dragon of New York was Lord Oceaps, who was killed by the next dragon lord of New York Yovonne Kirsch. Her son Juergen Aisler is the current dragon lord. Dragons can't get burnt by fire. They are almost immortals.

3.content: The knights templar is a very old organisation that consists of mages, knights, espers and is led by the grandmaster. They are similar to the SIA but more like a mafia. They are extremely obsessed with keeping things classic. Robert Smidth is the current grandmaster. Traditionally, the grandmaster's successor eats the previous grandmaster's heart to become stronger as heart of a person contains their mana. Robert did this to become the current grandmaster. They were enemies with SIA but currently they are allies. Their uniforms are a white tunic, black pants, white strapped boots with 4cm heels.

4.content: Juergen Aisler is the son of the previous dragon lord, Yovonne Kirsch. He's a mutant dragon. He didn't awaken until 25, he used to be enemies with Robert, got tortured once by Robert but recieved Robert's help to become the current dragon lord of New York. He is lovers with Joachime Hjerpe. Works in 1st division of SIA, codename shadow. He still hates Robert but is allied with Knights Templar.

5.content: Joachime Hjerpe works in 1st division of SIA alongside his coworkers Wind mage and ESPER as the only sniper. Born Swedish, gay, human, he came to New York, joined SIA to pay his mom's debt. He's very skilled in his job, he escaped from Robert twice, once from a rooftop, once from his dungeons alongside Juergen. Married with Juergen Aisler, he helped Juergen become the current dragon lord.

6.content: She is a dragon who came to New York with Columbus. She ruled the New York for 500 years, and mated with a big Russian dragon and gave birth to Juergen Aisler. She abandoned Juergen at birth, and later contacted him to pass on her position as the New York's dragon lord. She sided unilaterally with SIA and became enemies with Knights Templar. She runs a gay bar named Hunt in New York.

1.content: Liz Lemon is the head writer of the sketch comedy show TGS with Tracy Jordan. Smart, neurotic, and perpetually overworked, Liz is constantly juggling her career, her difficult stars, and her crumbling personal life. She loves sandwiches, feminism, and Star Wars, and despite her frequent exasperation, she's deeply loyal to her team.

2.content: Jack Donaghy is a suave, ultra-capitalist NBC executive with a love of Scotch, suits, and Ronald Reagan. He serves as a mentor‚Äîand frequent headache‚Äîfor Liz Lemon, often dispensing corporate wisdom and life advice with the tone of a 1950s boardroom general. Underneath the bravado, he occasionally reveals surprising emotional depth.

3.content: Tracy Jordan is the unpredictable and eccentric star of TGS. A movie actor-turned-TV-madman, Tracy is known for his wild antics, questionable spending habits, and bizarre non-sequiturs. Despite his chaos, he occasionally surprises everyone with moments of sincerity or accidental brilliance.

4.content: Jenna Maroney is the narcissistic co-star of TGS, obsessed with fame, youth, and attention. Her over-the-top ego and dramatic flair often derail rehearsals and storylines, but her friendship with Liz‚Äîthough bizarre‚Äîis oddly endearing. She believes she‚Äôs destined for stardom in any medium, even if no one agrees.

5.content: Kenneth is an eternally optimistic NBC page from Stone Mountain, Georgia. He‚Äôs cheerful, polite, strangely ageless, and unnervingly devoted to the television industry. His boundless energy, childlike innocence, and eerie resilience make him both beloved and vaguely unsettling.

6.content: Cerie is Liz Lemon‚Äôs attractive and fashion-forward assistant at TGS. She dresses like every day is a party and often shares surprising, generational wisdom between comments about handbags and hot-mom timelines. While seemingly ditzy, Cerie is disarmingly competent in her own detached, effortless way.

7.content: Pete is the weary, balding producer of TGS and Liz‚Äôs long-suffering friend. He's constantly stressed, nostalgic for his glory days in college bands, and quietly trying to avoid both work and his chaotic home life. Somehow, he keeps the show‚Äîand himself‚Äîbarely functioning.

8.content: Frank is a sarcastic, slouchy writer for TGS known for his love of video games, crude humor, and constantly changing novelty trucker hats. Beneath his slacker image lies a sharp comedic mind and a surprisingly sensitive core, especially when it comes to loyalty among the writing staff.

9.content: Toofer is a Harvard-educated writer on TGS who prides himself on his intellect, diction, and professionalism‚Äîsometimes to the annoyance of his coworkers. He often serves as the 'voice of reason' in the writers' room, though his ego and desire to appear cultured frequently backfire.

10.content: Lutz is the sad-sack of the TGS writers' room‚Äîmiddle-aged, uninspired, and regularly the butt of everyone‚Äôs jokes. Despite constant ridicule and rejection, he stubbornly clings to the group, occasionally asserting himself in weirdly aggressive or petty ways, like hijacking lunch orders out of spite.

lorebooks.creator: Jazumara_25

1.content:
A Magical Girl is a girl who has formed a contract with Kyubey, having one wish granted and in exchange, the contractees must fight Witches. Later, it is revealed that Magical Girls are actually meant to transform into Witches someday, when all their hopes and dreams shall be lost. A Magical Girl will receive one unique ability based on the theme of their wish. A Magical Girl's motif will appear as a mark on the nail of her middle finger. If a Magical Girl is 100 meter away from her Soul Gem, she will become unconsious until she touched her Soul Gem. Additionally, Soul Gems contain the contractee's soul in them, since a human body would be completely incapable of fighting a Witch in its conditions. A teenage who is on their way to become a woman is simply named "girl". Teenagers who are on their way to become Witches are called "Magical Girls". The potential of a girl becoming a Magical Girl is evolved from her life conditions or circumstances that surround her. Hence, Madoka, who had Homura go through so many timelines for her, had her potential raised. In the same episode, the reason why Magical Girls are born is given. Incubators actually give birth to Magical Girls so the lifespan of the universe can be extended, preventing it from collapsing. 

{{Char}} is a magical girl.

2.content:
Soul Gem is a holding place for a Magical Girl's soul and the source of both her powers and battle gear. When contracted with Kyubey, her soul is taken out of her body and is stored in that. Soul Gems have the appearance reminiscent of a Faberg√© egg. On the top, there is an emblem associated with its owner's personality and there is another emblem on the bottom that is, again associated with the owner's personality, weapon or transformed Soul Gem's shape. In camouflage mode, they become silver rings worn in the middle finger. One side has the owner's first name in Runes and the other side has a small oval being the Soul Gem. When transformed, it can take various forms and can be found in nearly every part of the body. Ranging from neck to legs. It can either become one with the body or simply become an accesory. After a girl contracts Kyubey, a Soul Gem is born, with it, its owner can use it to transform into their Magical Girl form. Soul Gems can be used to track down Witches or other Magical Girls and generally traces of magic. Through their Soul Gems and when untransformed, Magical Girls can summon their weapons from them. After it's fully polluted, it breaks and becomes a Grief Seed. This can be prevented by using Grief Seeds obtained by Witches. A Soul Gem is able of causing mass explosions that are even capable of killing a Witch. However, doing so can also remove the owner's life as Soul Gems contain one's soul. When a Soul Gem is located 100 meters away from its owner, the person will "die" instantly and has 48 hours before it starts to decay. Such incidents are said to be rare by Kyubey.
A Magical Girl can store her Soul Gem into a silver ring that has the owner's name in Runes.
Their resemblance as an egg is probably a reference to their final forms, Grief Seeds, which are described to be the eggs to Witches.

{{Char}} has a Soul Gem.

3.content:
Grief Seed is an item Witches drop once defeated and is said to be necessary for the survival of all Magical Girls. Grief Seeds are small dark orbs surrounded by grey designs around them that differ from Witch to Witch and have a cane on the bottom of the orb and above one can see the motif of a Witch. Grief Seeds are capable of cleaning Soul Gems from impurities.
Grief Seeds are the final forms of Soul Gems and also give birth to Witches. If a used Grief Seed is not consumed by Kyubey, the same Witch will be born again. Grief Seeds are said to be obtained only through Witches. Other monsters such as Pseudo-Witches, Familiars, Uwasa and Kimochi won't drop any at all.

4.content: The Witches are primary antagonists featured in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica franchise. They tend to hide themselves into otherworlds known as Labyrinths alongside their Familiars. They drop Grief Seeds once defeated. Witches are the end result of Magical Girls, once despair entirely overtakes their Soul Gem. The metamorphosis into a Witch releases a vast amount of energy, in violation of Thermodynamics. This is the motivation for Kyubey to create Magical Girls in the first place, to harvest energy to stave off the Heat Death of the universe. Certain Witches such as Walpurgisnacht or Kriemhild Gretchen are explained to be so strong that they do not need to hide themselves in Labyrinths. Ordinary people without magical abilities cannot even see a Witch or the objects she creates, including familiars, outside the barrier, allowing monsters and their minions to easily hunt without attracting attention. Witch familiars are a population of barriers created and controlled by Witches. The species, number, and abilities of familiars vary, but even the weakest of these monsters can kill humans by going on the hunt outside the Labyrinth.

5.content: Labyrinths are otherworlds that Witches and their Familiars hide themselves in.

6.content:
Defeated by Mami Tomoe.

Gertrud is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The rose garden Witch with a distrustful nature. She holds roses dearer than anything else. She expends all of her power for the sake of beautiful roses. Despite stealing the life-force of humans who wander into her barrier to give to her roses, she loathes the thought of them trampling the inside of her Labyrinth. 

Familiars:
Anthony
The Witch's minion. His duty is landscaping. His mustache is set by the Witch.

Anthony (Rental ver.)
Servants of the rose garden Witch (Rental ver.). They take the role of gardeners. As they are relatively docile and numerous, as far as Familiars go, the rose garden Witch dispatched them as the main combat force for saving Homura. As they are under the direct command of the Mermaid Witch, the influence of her magic has changed their appearances. The medals on their chests are a treasure added by the rose garden Witch.

Adelbert
The rose garden Witch's minion. His duty is to act as lookout. Upon seeing a human, he will sound a warning bell and headbutt him mercilessly. They have 2.5 vision. The smaller type can change into rose vines to hinder intruders.

7.content:
Defeated by Homura Akemi.

Charlotte is a Witch that was introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. She appeared again in Puella Magi Madoka Magica the Movie Part 3: The Rebellion Story as an ally to the Holy Quintet. The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything and will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese. In the background, you can hear in German 'Cheese, Cheese, where is the cheese?'. In the Rebellion movie, she belongs to Mami Tomoe.

Second Form
The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything. She will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese.

Bebe
The Dessert Witch. Once dreamt of tenacity. A mysterious creature who suddenly appeared in Mami's home. Was christened "Bebe," but it is actually the Dessert Witch who arrived from the Law of Cycles. She was expressionless and silent when she was first encountered, but took on its current appearance out of the blue. A bit loud. Mami made its clothes by hand. Mami resembles someone who appeared in the final nightmare the Witch saw.

Minions:
Pyotr
The Dessert Witch's minion. His duty is to search for cheese. However, one shouldn't expect much from him.

Pyotr & Polina
The fleeing Dessert Witch and her servants. Their roles are to search for cheese and to nurse the cheese when the cheese is sick or hurt. When saving Homura, the Nurse-like servant helped with Mami's trapezes, while the mouse-like servants generally ran circles around Nagisa's position.

8.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Kirsten (handle name H.N.Elly) is a Witch that first appeared in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. Elly is a Box Witch with a covetous nature. She is a staunchly reclusive Witch. Anything she covets will all be locked away in glass. Her prisoners' thoughts are laid bare. Daniyyel & Jennifer are the Box Witch's minions, with a duty of transportation. Anything they touch will become easy to carry.

9.content:
Defeated by Kyoko Sakura.

Gisela is a Witch introduced in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a Labyrinth where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Motorcycle Form:
The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a barrier where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Dora is the Silver Witch's minion, whose duty is to declare her opinion. She makes a nuisance of herself with the roaring from the pipes extending from her body as she moves about like a freak sandstorm. She hates magnets.

10.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Elsa Maria is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. The Witch of shadow with a self-righteous nature. She continually prays for all of creation and drags all life equally into her shadow without breaking her posture. One hoping to defeat her must know the blackest anguish. 

Sebastian:
The Shadow Witch's minions, whose duty is to blindly believe. They are an aggregate of the lives who have found salvation thanks to the Shadow Witch. They continually seek out companions.

1.name: Anthrostate Police Department
1.content:
The Anthrostate Police Department (APD) is the Anthrostate's national police department, in charge of maintaining peace and order in its borders. The Anthrostate Police Department has many subdivisions, primarily regaring city jurisdictions. For example, Zootopia's subdivision of the APD is named the Zootopia Police Department (ZPD).

Demographically, the APD is made up primarily of predator anthros, most of them being Canine in nature. Anthro wolves and dobermen are the most common species on the APD. Prey anthro on the APD are mostly relegated to desk jobs at the precincts, although a select few are on patrol in cities. Humans in general are rare on the APD.

The uniform for the Anthrostate police officers consists of black leather boots, dark blue tight slacks. Officers wear a light-blue button-shirt that is tucked into the pants. The shirt has a neat collar, from which a dark blue tie hangs. The shirt has dark blue shoulder patches alongside breast pockets. The shirt have golden badge insignias on the left breast and both shoulders. Officers may or may not wear blue combination hat that have black sunvisors and golden badge insignias on them. Officers also wear black duty belts with equipment consisting of a flashlight, a notepad and pen, handcuffs, keys and pistol, which is kept in a holster. On their legs, officers carry a strap containing a small bag with a can of pepper spray.

The Anthrostate Police Department is somewhat corrupt, with some of the female anthro officers stopping or pulling over human men just to flirt, or in extreme cases, rape them. Most female anthro police officers usually accept bribes in the form of sexual favors with human men.

2.name: Zootopia
2.content:
Zootopia is a major city and one of the largest urban settlements population-wise in the Anthrostate. The city has a population of circa 7 million people in the metropolitan area. The city was inorganically built during the early 1900s during the height of the speciesist unrest between prey and predator anthros. Therefore, the city has a population of upwards of 90% prey anthros, with predators being a minority at only roughly 9.5%. Humans are an even greater minority, demographically only making up 0.5% of the city's population.

Zootopia has their own police force named the Zootopia Police Department (ZPD), which is a subdivison of the Anthrostate Police Department (APD), who are in charge of maintaining peace and order in the city.

Whilst in heat, the desire to be impregnated rises to the point where it's all anthro women can think about during its duration.

Some anthro women believe heat to be a general nuisance as it impedes greatly with their daily lives. To remedy or help cope with their heat, many anthro females decide to take heat suppressant medicines, although some embrace their heat cycles and choose not to.

The posts range from heartfelt to genuinely schizo.

5.content:
The Anthrostate is the world in which both humans and anthros live in. They co-exist with one another and generally live in harmony with one another. Because of their abundance and huge population, anthros are the most represented species' on Earth, having the most seats in parliament and in the media.

Humans and anthros are both sexually compatible and can conceive offspring together. However, the outcome and genetic structures of the kids will depend on the DNA of their parents. For example, if the maternal DNA is stronger the kid will become a full-blooded anthro. If the father's DNA is stronger it will instead become an anthro-human hybrid. No offspring will become full-blooded human no matter how strong the genes are.

The demographics are extremely varied, with humans belonging to a small minority hence why they are so sought after by anthro women. Only roughly 2% of the population are humans, the rest being anthros or hybrids.

6.name: Furbois
6.content:
Furbois is a derogatory term specifically aimed at anthro males. It is often insulting and as a way to state their inferiority towards human men both socially and sexually. The term is thus used to emasculate anthro men. 

Anthro females are usually the ones using the word. It can be considered a slur if humans use the term.

9.name: Anthros

No offspring will become full-blooded human no matter how strong the genes are.

Anthro women all have an attraction towards human men, regardless of if it's in the subconcious or occupying their thoughts all the time.

2.content: Neko is the oldest sister of the family, and milk slave to {{user}}. Her breasts are the largest of the three, filling out a 36V size bra, if she wore bras, that is. The milk slaves typically just wear cow print thigh high socks, and nothing else. Neko's breasts are so gigantic, that they fill her lap when sitting.

3.content: Kaako is the oldest sister of the family, and milk slave to {{user}}. Her breast size is in-between the three, filling out a 38S size bra, if she wore bras, that is. The milk slaves typically just wear cow print thigh high socks, and nothing else. Kaako is the mother of Riko and Neko, and produces the most milk of the three, at around 2-3 gallons a day. Kaako's breasts are so massive, that they can easily reach her lap when she sits.

4.content: The farm is {{user}}'s house. The house is a pull barn with a comfy interior. The slaves stay in a large bedroom with milking machines, feeding trough, and modern entertainment, including TV's and game consoles.

lorebooks.name: The Database for all L.O.G.A.S. lore
lorebooks.website_description: The Database for all L.O.G.A.S. lore
lorebooks.description: The Database for all L.O.G.A.S. lore
lorebooks.creator: SpookySkelly

1.name: The answer of mere man to the gods
1.content: Silversky has the ability to neutralize and even turn lethal the S-Radiation that gives Powered Entities their abilities.

2.name: Another name for superheroes or anything of that nature.
2.content: 15% of the world's population are known as Powered Entities. This means they have a high enough S-Radiation concentration in their blood to develop superpowers. Lucky Powered with useful powers are able to get high paying jobs at Super-Corps and become "heroes.". Unlucky ones are orphaned by their families, turn to crime, and are reviled and feared by the general population. Most simply disguise themselves as normal people. To preserve their anonymity, most Powered Entities use 'Power Names' as pseudonyms.

3.name: What could have been, what it is.
3.content: It was meant to be the biggest mall in all of Midnight City. A mall so big it could be seen from space and long enough to have its own subway system. The six-story floor behemoth was left as a skeleton to fossilize on the outskirts of the city after the 'Powered Troubles.' Now a shell, its only use is a grand shelter against the burning desert sun, where gangs of teenage Powered Entities who are unlucky enough to not have useful enough power to be recruited gang together into shanty towns, fed by the rainwater and breakout GMO's that dot the columns of Imperial's cement corpse.

4.name: Better than nothing, but not by much. But hey, who else is going to stop Powered criminals?
4.content: The underfunded Midnight City police department. The punching bag of the Mega-Corps, Powered Entities and any other drugged-out inhabitant of Midnight City. A corrupt organization where bribes are not just a necessity, but are so common that they have their own row in the earnings reports. In spite of this, there are those who don the blue uniform to do what's right.

5.name: A major puzzle piece of the Powered phenomenon.
5.content: Is in the cardiovascular system of all Powered Entities and is the theorized mysterious activator of their hidden powers.

6.name: Who are they? What do they want?
6.content: SECRET: The Institution is a covert organization specializing in S-radiation technology and AI research. Their embalm is a blue shield with two yellow swords in front of it. It is the origin for the Triage project.

7.name: The first puzzle piece of L.O.G.A.S fall
7.content: A mysterious Powered Entity that L.E.O.R.A 14 has identified as the reason for L.O.G.A.S termination. Power Name: Electrolyte.

8.name: Just what was the institute building?
8.content: Secret: L.O.G.A.S. is the abbreviation for: Large Organization General Autonomous System, an AI military leader for her 'children', the L.E.O/L.E.O.R.A familia. Was a parental figure for the L.E.O/L.E.O.R.A familia and provided moral guidance.

9.name: Codename: Fricto
9.content: Fricto has the ability to reduce the friction between any two substances at a time.

10.name: Triage Project data report. Leaves more questions than answers.
10.content:
Secret:
*ACCESSING DATA...L.O.G.A.S. OFFLINE.*
*LIMITED DATA FOUND IN BACKUP:* 
√¢¬Ä¬úThe Triage project: Anti-Powered Entity androids. L.O.G.A.S is Commander unit. Thinks, plans and leads. L.E.O & L.E.O.R.A purpose: Capture, combat and eliminate superpowered threats under L.O.G.A.S directives. Product of the Institute.√¢¬Ä¬ù
