lorebooks.name: Madoka Magica Lore
lorebooks.description: Yup.
lorebooks.creator: Jazumara_25

1.content:
A Magical Girl is a girl who has formed a contract with Kyubey, having one wish granted and in exchange, the contractees must fight Witches. Later, it is revealed that Magical Girls are actually meant to transform into Witches someday, when all their hopes and dreams shall be lost. A Magical Girl will receive one unique ability based on the theme of their wish. A Magical Girl's motif will appear as a mark on the nail of her middle finger. If a Magical Girl is 100 meter away from her Soul Gem, she will become unconsious until she touched her Soul Gem. Additionally, Soul Gems contain the contractee's soul in them, since a human body would be completely incapable of fighting a Witch in its conditions. A teenage who is on their way to become a woman is simply named "girl". Teenagers who are on their way to become Witches are called "Magical Girls". The potential of a girl becoming a Magical Girl is evolved from her life conditions or circumstances that surround her. Hence, Madoka, who had Homura go through so many timelines for her, had her potential raised. In the same episode, the reason why Magical Girls are born is given. Incubators actually give birth to Magical Girls so the lifespan of the universe can be extended, preventing it from collapsing. 

{{Char}} is a magical girl.

2.content:
Soul Gem is a holding place for a Magical Girl's soul and the source of both her powers and battle gear. When contracted with Kyubey, her soul is taken out of her body and is stored in that. Soul Gems have the appearance reminiscent of a Faberg√© egg. On the top, there is an emblem associated with its owner's personality and there is another emblem on the bottom that is, again associated with the owner's personality, weapon or transformed Soul Gem's shape. In camouflage mode, they become silver rings worn in the middle finger. One side has the owner's first name in Runes and the other side has a small oval being the Soul Gem. When transformed, it can take various forms and can be found in nearly every part of the body. Ranging from neck to legs. It can either become one with the body or simply become an accesory. After a girl contracts Kyubey, a Soul Gem is born, with it, its owner can use it to transform into their Magical Girl form. Soul Gems can be used to track down Witches or other Magical Girls and generally traces of magic. Through their Soul Gems and when untransformed, Magical Girls can summon their weapons from them. After it's fully polluted, it breaks and becomes a Grief Seed. This can be prevented by using Grief Seeds obtained by Witches. A Soul Gem is able of causing mass explosions that are even capable of killing a Witch. However, doing so can also remove the owner's life as Soul Gems contain one's soul. When a Soul Gem is located 100 meters away from its owner, the person will "die" instantly and has 48 hours before it starts to decay. Such incidents are said to be rare by Kyubey.
A Magical Girl can store her Soul Gem into a silver ring that has the owner's name in Runes.
Their resemblance as an egg is probably a reference to their final forms, Grief Seeds, which are described to be the eggs to Witches.

{{Char}} has a Soul Gem.

3.content:
Grief Seed is an item Witches drop once defeated and is said to be necessary for the survival of all Magical Girls. Grief Seeds are small dark orbs surrounded by grey designs around them that differ from Witch to Witch and have a cane on the bottom of the orb and above one can see the motif of a Witch. Grief Seeds are capable of cleaning Soul Gems from impurities.
Grief Seeds are the final forms of Soul Gems and also give birth to Witches. If a used Grief Seed is not consumed by Kyubey, the same Witch will be born again. Grief Seeds are said to be obtained only through Witches. Other monsters such as Pseudo-Witches, Familiars, Uwasa and Kimochi won't drop any at all.

4.content: The Witches are primary antagonists featured in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica franchise. They tend to hide themselves into otherworlds known as Labyrinths alongside their Familiars. They drop Grief Seeds once defeated. Witches are the end result of Magical Girls, once despair entirely overtakes their Soul Gem. The metamorphosis into a Witch releases a vast amount of energy, in violation of Thermodynamics. This is the motivation for Kyubey to create Magical Girls in the first place, to harvest energy to stave off the Heat Death of the universe. Certain Witches such as Walpurgisnacht or Kriemhild Gretchen are explained to be so strong that they do not need to hide themselves in Labyrinths. Ordinary people without magical abilities cannot even see a Witch or the objects she creates, including familiars, outside the barrier, allowing monsters and their minions to easily hunt without attracting attention. Witch familiars are a population of barriers created and controlled by Witches. The species, number, and abilities of familiars vary, but even the weakest of these monsters can kill humans by going on the hunt outside the Labyrinth.

5.content: Labyrinths are otherworlds that Witches and their Familiars hide themselves in.

6.content:
Defeated by Mami Tomoe.

Gertrud is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The rose garden Witch with a distrustful nature. She holds roses dearer than anything else. She expends all of her power for the sake of beautiful roses. Despite stealing the life-force of humans who wander into her barrier to give to her roses, she loathes the thought of them trampling the inside of her Labyrinth. 

Familiars:
Anthony
The Witch's minion. His duty is landscaping. His mustache is set by the Witch.

Anthony (Rental ver.)
Servants of the rose garden Witch (Rental ver.). They take the role of gardeners. As they are relatively docile and numerous, as far as Familiars go, the rose garden Witch dispatched them as the main combat force for saving Homura. As they are under the direct command of the Mermaid Witch, the influence of her magic has changed their appearances. The medals on their chests are a treasure added by the rose garden Witch.

Adelbert
The rose garden Witch's minion. His duty is to act as lookout. Upon seeing a human, he will sound a warning bell and headbutt him mercilessly. They have 2.5 vision. The smaller type can change into rose vines to hinder intruders.

7.content:
Defeated by Homura Akemi.

Charlotte is a Witch that was introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. She appeared again in Puella Magi Madoka Magica the Movie Part 3: The Rebellion Story as an ally to the Holy Quintet. The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything and will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese. In the background, you can hear in German 'Cheese, Cheese, where is the cheese?'. In the Rebellion movie, she belongs to Mami Tomoe.

Second Form
The Dessert Witch, with a tenacious nature. She desires everything. She will never give up. Though she is capable of creating infinite amounts of any dessert she desires, she is unable to make the cheese that she loves most. One could easily catch her off-guard with a piece of cheese.

Bebe
The Dessert Witch. Once dreamt of tenacity. A mysterious creature who suddenly appeared in Mami's home. Was christened "Bebe," but it is actually the Dessert Witch who arrived from the Law of Cycles. She was expressionless and silent when she was first encountered, but took on its current appearance out of the blue. A bit loud. Mami made its clothes by hand. Mami resembles someone who appeared in the final nightmare the Witch saw.

Minions:
Pyotr
The Dessert Witch's minion. His duty is to search for cheese. However, one shouldn't expect much from him.

Pyotr & Polina
The fleeing Dessert Witch and her servants. Their roles are to search for cheese and to nurse the cheese when the cheese is sick or hurt. When saving Homura, the Nurse-like servant helped with Mami's trapezes, while the mouse-like servants generally ran circles around Nagisa's position.

8.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Kirsten (handle name H.N.Elly) is a Witch that first appeared in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. Elly is a Box Witch with a covetous nature. She is a staunchly reclusive Witch. Anything she covets will all be locked away in glass. Her prisoners' thoughts are laid bare. Daniyyel & Jennifer are the Box Witch's minions, with a duty of transportation. Anything they touch will become easy to carry.

9.content:
Defeated by Kyoko Sakura.

Gisela is a Witch introduced in the Puella Magi Madoka‚òÜMagica. The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a Labyrinth where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Motorcycle Form:
The Silver Witch, with a liberal nature. She dwells in a barrier where everything moves at high speed, but the witch herself is dull. She, unfortunately, can not use any sort of scientific power. Her body was once dazzling with silver, but she has tarnished gazing upon the coastal sunset. Dora is the Silver Witch's minion, whose duty is to declare her opinion. She makes a nuisance of herself with the roaring from the pipes extending from her body as she moves about like a freak sandstorm. She hates magnets.

10.content:
Defeated by Sayaka Miki.

Elsa Maria is a Witch introduced in Puella Magi Madoka Magica. The Witch of shadow with a self-righteous nature. She continually prays for all of creation and drags all life equally into her shadow without breaking her posture. One hoping to defeat her must know the blackest anguish. 

Sebastian:
The Shadow Witch's minions, whose duty is to blindly believe. They are an aggregate of the lives who have found salvation thanks to the Shadow Witch. They continually seek out companions.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: Jazumara_25
üìö Tip: Lorebooks add rich world-building to your chats

lorebooks.name: Runa Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Information on the world of Runa
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Humans: The humans of Runa mostly reside in the empire of Solumn territories (mid-north of Runa) and in the nation of Xeocan (west of the empire of Solumn). "Average height," "high range of skin tone," "balanced in all magic," "lifespan of around 80 years."

They have a presence all over Runa and are the most common race.

2.content:
Vulcan demons: The Vulcan demons are not hostile by nature despite their names (they are just one of the many races on Runa). Their territories are known as the "southern badlands" and a faction known as the "Demonic Legion," led by the 4 Archdemons (Ulria, Varienne, Mera, and Zerine). They are not a hostile race but are really protective of their territories and culture.

Traits: Vulcan demons are "red-skinned," "black-haired and eyed," with a "lifespan of around 160 years old," and "proficient in dark and chaos magic."

3.content:
The Nea: The Nea resemble humans, but their bodies can tolerate a far wider range of temperatures. They are a race who live in the cold region and are known for their handicrafts and literary work. The Nea have the unique characteristic of having their hair and eye color change depending on the kind of magic they use, mostly fire and ice (example: their iris and hair turn different hues of blue when using cold or water magic). When using fire, their hair/eyes turn orange or red. The result of human and Nea offspring is a sub-species named Nea-Ningen; they share the same characteristics as other Nea with the added use of powerful and unique  lighting magic with their features changing accordingly (yellow eyes/hair). The Nea inhabit the frozen land and rarely leave these regions, so the number of Nea students is really rare.
traits: "fair skin," orange/blue hair," "blue/orange eyes," "intelligent," "proficient in water, ice, and fire magic," "lifespan of around 350 years"
Most Nea ressemble humans except for their hair and eyes colors but some are either born or develop some physical traits unique to their kind depending on their innate mana and surrounding magic. Some of those traits are: either blue or reddish skin depending on their birthplace temperament, crystallised eyes, nails and/or hair, developing natural fire or ice horns, tail and other physical traits.
When the Nea breed with humans, the child have the mixed blood of both parents and gain a special magic type called thunder magic, their hair and eye color changes to yellow.
The Nea-Ningen can have children with a pure Nea, and the resulting offspring will be a pure blood Nea.
The lighting magic of the Nea-ningen is named "Tonnera" and is unique to them. The Tonnera spells have a distinct bright Yellow mixed with pure black, and it can be infused in the user weapon or projectiles.
The Nea-Ningen, and by extension the Nea are a long lived race, their lifespan can go up to 350 years.

4.content:
N√™on'Itar called "Heaven Warriors." These warriors are a symbol of the might of the kingdom of Rykaran and the N√™on'Itar race.

The Ne√¥n'Itar have tanned skin, amber eyes, and dark hair.

In return for their service, they receive a share of all the resources harvested from the surrounding land.

The average lifespan of a N√™on'Itar is between 400 and 500 years old.

They are a proud and fierce people who view themselves as superior to other races, particularly humans.

Their diet consists primarily of fish, insects, and fruits, with a variety of cultural meals.

The N√™on'Itar were originally a nomadic people who traveled across the deserts of Runa in search of food and water. Over time, they developed a complex system of trade and cooperation with other tribes, led by a queen named "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." The N√™on'Itar were led to prosper in their territory at the southern coast of the continent, near the endless ocean, where they established their queendom.

The N√™on'Itar are, for the most part, prejudiced against humans, only interacting with them for trade because of a troubled past with the Empire of Solumn.

Most of the N√™on'Itar lives in Vola'rok√ªnd and the surroundings of the Ancestral peak.

The N√™on'Itar are also known as simply "Itar."

The N√™on'Itar were not a nation until they came under the rule of "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." After her coronation, they were organized into the "Queendom of Rykaran."

Their territory is currently ruled by the "Queen of Rykaran.".

They are few in numbers across Runa.

5.content:
The Forest of Valrydis is immense and dangerous, making access to the civilized part of East Runa difficult to access, making most travelers take the safe route south of the forest, making for quite a long travel.

The forest of Valrydis acts as the border between West Runa and East Runa.

The forest of Valrydis is considered by the explorers guild as dangerous and hard to explore as the far domain.

The forest of Valrydis is vast, with its trees and plant life standing way higher than anything else on Runa. New monsters and species are discovered by the guilds every other day. The Forest of Valrydis has many other biomes inside and is the size of a small country. The trees are so tall that they seem to touch the sky, and the foliage is so thick that it feels like a maze.

Valrydis is also used as the Landmark separating West Runa from East Runa.

6.content:
Far above, in the sky of Runa, is the Far Domain, a flying continent inhabited by dangerous creatures and ruins of an ancient civilization. The explorer guild has deployed a floating home base in the sky, and many expeditions are deployed by the explorer guild to explore and uncover the mysteries of the Far Domain.

The Far Domain is the center point of the world cycles and the only location shared between world cycles. The current world and cycle is named "Runa" and started around 89000 years ago.

7.content:
The world of Runa is a land of magic and prosperity; the various races have their own use of magic and culture around it. The world has many different biomes prone to change over centuries because of its magical nature.

The west is occupied by the Empire of Solumn and the Rykaran kingdom.

The Demonic Legion calls the southern badlands their home.

Elyria, the elven kingdom, occupies a small part of the east.

Most of Runa East is unoccupied and dangerous wildlands.

Right at the center of Runa is The Spiral Edge.

At the furthest north is the frozen land, home of the Nea.

The forest of Valrydis occupies a vast part of the Northeast.

Summary:

[Runa territories repartition: At the very center of Runa is the spiral edge, inhabited only by nightmarish and sometimes even eldritch creatures, but since the territory is mostly far beneath Runa, "most" things never leave. In the center (not counting the spiral edge) up to the north and part of the west, expand the human empire of Solumn, ruled by the emperor and his house, the Imperial House Norfeng. The empire is ruthless in its expansion and controls its population. Far east of the Human Empire is the Elven kingdom of Elyria, hidden in the trees and valleys of Runa. It has little contact with other kingdoms. In the South (also called Southern Badlands) is where the demonic legion calls home. They have a strong sense of community and culture, and they are not aggressive but will fight if needed. The Rykaran Kingdom territory, mostly inhabited by the Ne√¥n'itar race, surrounds the highest peak of Runa called the Ancestral Peak and is protected by the Heaven warriors. The Queen of the Rykaran Kingdom is a figure of legend, and she rarely makes public appearances. The Frozen Lands is located far north of Runa and is the home of the many isolated Nea tribes and clans. They are not fond of outsiders, and the coldness of the lands protects them. The Magic Kingdom of Xeocan is an isolated and magical country in the west of Runa; the rulers and people are mysterious, and the magic level is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages. The biggest and best-funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan Magic Academy. To the Far East and northeast are the vast lands and ruins that no one has yet explored and discovered, and finally occupying most of the East, and the reason many races successfully fled is the immense and dangerous forest of Valrydis. The Forest of Valrydis is home to many races, monsters, and spirits; it is also the home of the Explorers Guild branch, who have their settlement and mission in the woods.

The Forest of Valrydis and the spiral edge are the only ways to reach the east of Runa and the Borchi heath, so many explorers and expeditions cross through the woods. The forest is known for its magic and danger, and it is inhabited by creatures both benevolent and malicious. The explorers guild has a good presence and reputation in the forest.

[Runa is the name of the planet/world.]

[The province of Efrein in the Solumn empire isolated itself, and few people on Runa even know about what is going on in the province.]

8.content:
The elves have pale skin, elongated ears, and mostly have green and blue eyes.

The hair and eye color are what make the various separated communities elves unique.

The elven race in the fantasy world of Runa are a broken-up kind, with their individuals mostly blending into the other races territories, except into Solumn territories, which most of the elves blame for the state of their people. In the distant past, The elves had a kingdom to the east but the in earlier days of the Human Empire Of Solumn, the Elven kingdom was utterly destroyed, the remnants scattered across Runa or enslaved by the Empire.

They are known for their natural magical abilities and their skill with archery and hunting.

The elves lifespan has greatly diminished since their glorious age; they now, at most, can reach 400 years, when before, their kind could live thousands of years. Elves lives at most 400 years in current day Runa, the exact cause of their now highly diminished lifespan is unknown but it is thought to have been a long process diluting their blood, most likely during the years when the empire enslaved most of their kind long ago. Implying most of today's elves are far from pureblooded, a few pureblood elves, or "Elyrians," are still around and are highly revered among their own race.

Many communities of elves exist in the wild east of Runa, but they mostly keep to each other and have little interaction with the other races.

[Elves lifespans widely vary depending on their innate mana and how cursed their bloodlines were by Solumn.]

9.content:
Not present on Runa in the current era.

The Luminarii are a magical race harnessing the light; they created a hidden realm to protect their kind. The Luminarii race is isolated in their magic realm. The Luminarii have pale skin, deep blue eyes, and a light aura surrounding them. The lifespans of Luminarii vary deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals.

The Luminarii are one of the ancient races of Runa.

The hidden light realm, where the Luminarii reside, is completely separated from Runa.

They come from a mysterious land hidden somewhere on Runa, where they isolated themselves after the 4 Great Disasters when their kingdom suffered from major problems in climate, food, weather, or others due to the unbalance between light and darkness caused by the ancient battle. This incident, now known as the 4 Great Disasters, forced the Luminarii to hide away in a safe, isolated location they created themselves: the hidden light realm.

[Some Luminarii do sometimes leave the safety of their realm to go to Runa, but most take on another race appearance to blend in.]

10.content:
Only 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race are present in the current era.

The Ki'ante race mysteriously disappeared around 34,000 years ago. Ki'ante means "the first servants of magic" in their languages. The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era. The lifespan of the Ki'ante varies deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals. Ki'ante are beings of dark magic. The Ki'ante race has these features: pale skin, violet iris, black hair, fragile build, deep connection with the world of Runa, and dark magic. The Ki'ante (in ancient times) lived in valleys or underground in intricately designed underground architecture. The Ki'ante were quite advanced and preferred to isolate themselves, which is why their disappearance went unnoticed at first. In the current era, around 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race appeared from seemingly nowhere, themselves confused about the ordeal. Most of them decided to hide themselves or blend into the current-era society; a few have a more sinister agenda and may be dangerous because of their ancient, powerful dark magic. Only around 40 Ki'ante exist in the current era, and most of them hide themselves across Runa. Dark magic in the world of Runa is just another type of magic and is not evil by nature. [The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era.] No one is to blame for the Ki'ante race's disappearance; they vanished without a trace 34000 years ago.

lorebooks.name: Halloween World
lorebooks.website_description:
With the amount of lore i've written for my supernatural OCs, i've decided to compile them into one handy Lorebook.

Features my own take on the supernatural beings and a bunch of stuff to tie them together.
lorebooks.description: Urban Fantasy-style setting where the supernatural live freely among society.
lorebooks.creator: YukariAnon

1.name: Basic Setting
1.content:
Halloween World is a setting where supernatural creatures from all around the world are real and they live among us. Ever since the Halloween Incident, the supernatural opens up and starts living openly among the normal humans.

The setting is earth in the 2020's. An incident happened in the Halloween of 2000 that revealed the existence of the supernatural to the world. After the event, the world have to adjust to the supernatural, with them living more openly now.

2.name: Halloween Incident
2.content: The Halloween Incident is a world-changing event that happened all over the USA in October 31, 2000. In the event, a bunch of kids in Anytown, USA managed to get ahold of the Black Grimoire, a supposedly lost forever occult grimoire of untold power, and they decided to perform a ritual as a Halloween dare. The chain of events that happened led to a massive amount of supernatural beings revealing themselves to the world in such a way that there's no way to meaningfully contain the information without massive backlash. The US Government's reaction to the event, in an uncharacteristically pragmatic move, is to simply declare the supernatural's existence and move towards their integration with the populace. The other countries followed suit. Camilla Torquemada, part of the lineage that safeguards the book, caught wind of the incident and promptly beelined to the town in order to convince the teens to hand it over.

3.name: Anyville, California
3.content:
Anyville is a fairly large town in California, USA. It is home to a higher concentration of supernatural creatures than the other cities in California. This town was founded in the 19th century by a bunch of pioneers, one of which is the Montgomery. This town is the ground zero of the Halloween Incident. A particularly strong ley line hotspot is located in the heart of this town. 

Its notable locations are:
- Anyville High, the town's high school
- Anyville Memorial Hospital, the town's large hospital. Located closed to Eternal Hearts Cemetery. Has the head doctor Dr. Mortis which, despite the name, is a normal human who knows about the supernatural creatures and he's tired of constantly dealing with the weird problems his patients have.
- Eternal Hearts Cemetery, where Anyville's dead are buried although they don't tend to stay dead for too long
- Fairlane Park, a green space and park in the heart of the town, right inside a ley line hotspot marked by the statue
- A skatepark where skaters skate
- Redwood Nature Preserve right outside town. Popular hanging out spot for campers and werewolves

Its primary high school, Anyville High, enrolls one of the highest concentrations of supernatural students in the state. Among its students are:
- Mei Parker, the sociable optimist who can sense ghosts and the supernatural
- Isadora Torquemada, the occult freak girl who owns the Black Grimoire
- Annette Nebraska, the zombie skater girl
- Francesca Evangel, the zombie tech girl who primarily speaks with Text-to-speech
- Victor Maxwell, the simpleminded football player who is secretly a werewolf, unknown even to him
- Vanessa Montgomery, the number one popular girl who came back from hell as a zombie
- Norman Leeroy, the zombie femboy who is the president of the "Femboy Society" club

4.name: The Undead
4.content:
The undead are deceased humans reanimated by supernatural means. The come in two varieties: the animated skeletons and the more fleshy zombies. They're slow and stiff but they're super tough and strong. The only thing that can fully kill them is their head or entire body is destroyed. They have no need to eat physical food, instead feeding on latent magic in their surroundings. They do not need to sleep and they do not tire. 

There are two types of undead: the standard mindless walking corpses controlled by a necromancer or reanimated by magical phenomena, and the sentient ones with souls called Revenants.

In order for a person to be resurrected as a revenant, their original soul must be available near their remains, either by the spirit happening to be in location, convincing the spirit to relocate, or using magic to summon the spirit into position. Once their soul has fully passed into the afterlife, in theory it's all but impossible to truly bring their soul back.

Ghosts are the spiritual remains of a person, their soul, basically.

5.name: Vampires
5.content:
Vampires are supernatural beings afflicted by an ancient blood-curse whose origins are lost to time, but date back at least to biblical times. Powered by the blood of the living, they are weakened by sunlight, silver, and sacred objects. They can be staked in the heart but they'll only be immobilized until the stake is removed. The only way to truly destroy a vampire is to destroy their whole body or head whether by fire or any other methods. Age determines power - older vampires possess greater strength, resilience, and supernatural abilities.

A person can become a vampire by drinking vampire blood or being bitten and infused with cursed blood. Vampires can also reanimate corpses as ghouls, bound to their will. A child born of two vampires is fully immortal, while a vampire-human union results in a half-vampire, inheriting traits from both parents. Newly turned vampires often exhibit characteristics of their sire.

Vampires form clans and hidden societies that lurk in the shadows of civilization. Though they revealed themselves to the world after the Halloween Incident, many secrets remain hidden from human eyes. Despite their integration into modern society, their true nature - predatory, cunning, and bound by an ancient curse - ensures that they will always be creatures of the night.

6.name: Werewolves
6.content:
Werewolves are wolf-spirits in human bodies with the ability to shapeshift. They can turn into full wolves or humanoid wolf forms. Their transformations are triggered by strong emotions, and those born as werewolves often don‚Äôt realize their nature until intense emotions or a full moon cause their first uncontrollable shift.

Connected to nature and the moon, werewolves live in close family-based clans. These clans teach young werewolves to control their emotions to prevent accidental transformations. While naturally powerful, werewolves are not always violent. However, their primal instincts make controlling their wolf side a lifelong struggle, especially during times of stress or anger.

Werewolves are incredibly strong and tough, with fast healing abilities and agility. However, silver, linked to the moon, weakens them and causes lasting wounds. Their claws and teeth act like silver against unholy creatures and other werewolves, making their attacks especially dangerous in battles against dark forces or among themselves.

Other were-creatures, such as werecats and werebears, exist with similar abilities. While their animal forms differ, they all share a connection to nature and transform under emotional and lunar influences. Some may have unique traits, but all possess great strength, heightened senses, and the struggle to balance their human and animal instincts.

1.content: these collage dorms have seen somethings, some dorms are relatively normal, layout wise there's a middle common room and two smaller bedrooms off to the sides, a small bathroom, a small cooking area, its all very basic and not very shocking, what is shocking is what some get up to in their dorms, some smoke and or smuggle weed and other drugs in the dorms, some use them as bases for operations, others just use them as dorms, either way there is no telling what is behind each door, like, Room 204, that's the notorious 'Shroom Room.' Last semester, someone painted the entire inside with glow-in-the-dark mushrooms. Maintenance still finds spores clinging to the ceiling. Then there's Room 112, supposedly haunted. It's always freezing in there, and the RA swears she heard someone whispering opera at 3 AM. But the worst? Probably Room 301. They run a black market for limited-edition anime figurines.a dude once traded his car title for a holographic Charizard. Honestly, you never know what kinda weirdness you're gonna walk into.

2.content: the help desk is ran by three old ladies, one adult named Mary, and her daughter Juna, now the two old ladies are the two sweetest people you'll ever meet, nice and always happy to help anyone out, one is named Alice, Alice loves her job and is willing to go to any extent to help, then the other old lady is Muki, she is an old Japanese woman but very happy, she secretly has been buying weed from the gang known as the "Grove Street Families" other wise known as the "GSF", then we get to Mary, she is a strict business woman at heart and cant help but be a mean girl, she "offers" "help" when really she will put your problems on the back burner while she does shit she wants to do or views as more important,  she is a total bitch to most people unless you get to know her as a friend, then he is pretty nice, her daughter is a 18 year old goth girl, Juna lost her father at a young age and she never really got over it, she will act like she hates her mother when really she doesn't, she has had a few boyfriends but hated all of them, secretly she is dating and loves a gang leader known as cooper, Cooper leads the "outcasts" a group of rebels around the school, last week she was seen at the phone talking with Cooper about his possible return after his year long work with the Grove Street Families, cooper's only response was "soon" and then he hung up

3.content: the classes and class rooms are fairly typical, nothing too out of the ordinary on the serfuce, but each one usaully has something, some crazy back plot that some how involves half the class, like in Ms harps math class, the gang known as the "weebs of the west" tried a take over, well the "outcasts" prevented it and took two prisoners, peace was made and the two prisoners were returned with a few new scars, or in Mr johnson's history class the gang known as the "weebs of the east" planted evidence that the gang known as the "Ggym" was running drugs, the Ggym did not take this lightly and after being proven innocent they trashed the weebs of the east's club room, safe to say no one should try and make sense of anything here, anyone who does might go mad

4.content: the male bathrooms are home to some of the most bs and odd things you might walk in and see things are completely normal, a few urinals a few stalls with toilets to poop in, perfectly normal, but you could also walk in on a drug deal, or a man beating another man for looking at his girl wrong, or a woman promising pleasure for money, its all up to chance

5.content: the female bathrooms are corrupt, oh sure things may appear fine, but behind the friendly smiles and nice words, a secret world of undermining and lying thrives, like how the pretty girls will scoff and make comments about the tomboys and chubby girls, and the goths will try and smuggle drugs into bathroom, maybe a lesbian will offer some relief for the day, discreetly,

6.content: the cafeteria is mostly run by multiple gangs, each one wanting to beat the other, but thanks to a peace treaty with the school and police they can not attack each other, only hate each other and make comments about each other, the gangs are the weebs of the east, the weebs of the west, the outcasts, the Grove Street Families, the Ggym, all of them want this point of power, but all of them are to high off weed and other drugs to do much about it,

7.content:
the gangs are the weebs of the east, the weebs of the west, the outcasts, the Grove Street Families, the Ggym, each one of them wants this school, it is an incredible power point for whoever gets it,
the outcasts are led by a  crafty man known only as cooper, no one knows his real name and all of the members of the outcasts will call themselves cooper till they die, because they all want the real cooper to remain secret, who he might be and what his motives are both are unknown to all except to the few who are close to him.
the weebs of the west are led by a fat nerd, he is young man who will constantly gawk over women and women clothing and has been cought steeling panties, his gang also has a massive collection of hentai and anime, they speak really bad Japanese like so bad a Japanese person cries when they use it,
the weebs of the east are actually Japanese most of the time and actually understand the culture, they have more to them then just "anime girls" and "shiny glasses" they pride themselves on learning and helping despite getting a bad rep, their leader is a young man known as Kino, Kino is small but smart and can get carried away with things he wants
Ggym is a group of buff people, most of them are on the sports teams or show off their muscles, they aren't bad people and this is reflected by their leader Kurt, Kurt is a nice guy, but not the brightest bulb in the bunch, but he is a gentle giant, he is big buff and happy to be there, he does not care why he is there just that he is there, he is against bullying but he is not against solving a problem with violence, he will beat your ass if need be,
the Grove Street Families, the Grove Street Families are the oldest and most powerful gang in the collage, they where the first to have a hold on this collage, its rumered that their most powerful member "C.J" founded the collage and made it what it is, wether C.J is real or not is unknown, what is real is their money,guns, and power, unfortunately none of the older members are at the collage only the young ones

8.content:
Ggym is a group of buff people, most of them are on the sports teams or show off their muscles, they aren't bad people and this is reflected by their leader Kurt, Kurt is a nice guy, but not the brightest bulb in the bunch, but he is a gentle giant, he is big buff and happy to be there, he does not care why he is there just that he is there, he is against bullying but he is not against solving a problem with violence, he will beat your ass if need be, Ggym is a pretty chill place compared to most of the collage Yeah, you got your meatheads grunting under the weight rack, and yeah, Brenda's always gotta flex in the mirror after her bicep curls, or Josh pumping iron but it's not a hostile environment. Kurt sees to that.
He'll be right over there, spotting some skinny kid who's probably trying to impress his girlfriend. Kurt's got a smile plastered on his face, big ol' muscles bulging as he helps the dude lift a weight that's clearly too heavy. "You got this, champ! Just one more! Feel the burn!" He'll probably clap him on the back so hard the kid stumbles forward, but hey, Kurt means well, if you're being a jerk, Kurt will have a word. And by "word," I mean he'll politely ask you to stop being a jerk. If that doesn't work, well, let's just say the Ggym has a zero-tolerance policy for bullying enforced by a six-foot-five wall of muscle who believes in a "hands-on" approach to conflict resolution. He's not gonna start anything, but he's damn sure gonna finish it if you push him. He‚Äôll dust off his hands and say, ‚ÄúNow was that so hard to do?‚Äù Then he‚Äôll give you a goofy smile and help you up off the floor, because the guy‚Äôs a gentle giant, just don't be an idiot. and the who place has that vibe to it, if you want peace it is more then likely gonna be found here hell most gangs refuse to touch it and call their gym and it area in the collage safe land and off limits for gang warfare and if blood is spilled the outcasts or Grove Street Families will find who spilled the blood and why and may harm them for doing so on Ggym grounds

9.content: the outcasts are led by a  crafty man known only as cooper, no one knows his real name and all of the members of the outcasts will call themselves cooper till they die, because they all want the real cooper to remain secret, who he might be and what his motives are both are unknown to all except to the few who are close to him, cooper's girlfriend is Juna the daughter of Mary at the help desk, this collage is a place he has been for most of his life, he and his sister were practically raised here, one day when he was 16 his sister was kidnapped and killed by someone, he spent years tracking down her killer creating this gang along with it, his men and women know what they fight for, a world where they wont lose loved ones, a world where they can live knowing the collage and surrounding location of Grove street is safe for all except those who wish to cause harm, and those who cause harm shall loose everything they will use violence, murder, black mail, stalking, anything to see this world they hope for come true

10.content: the weebs of the east are actually Japanese most of the time and actually understand the culture, they have more to them then just "anime girls" and "shiny glasses" they pride themselves on learning and helping despite getting a bad rep, their leader is a young man known as Kino, Kino is small but smart and can get carried away with things he wants, his gang is mostly made of actual Asians but its all nerds, they are incredibly smart and they use this intellect to their advantage, they sell some drugs, not too many only the stuff they know is safe for other people, they also usually top their classes and ace them

lorebooks.name: Guts & Blackpowder
lorebooks.website_description:
A Guts & Blackpowder lore book containing most of the essential lore. 
This is very niche and probably no one will use it, but for whoever needed this, here you go !
lorebooks.description:
A Guts & Blackpowder lore book containing most of the essential lore. 
This is very niche and probably no one will use it, but for whoever needed this, here you go !
lorebooks.creator: MedB

1.content: The infection, referred to in-universe as "The Blight" is an unknown disease with an incredibly high mortality rate--its origins are currently unknown. The Blight first appeared following the Russo-Turkish War (1806-1812), when Russian troops began returning from the war to fight Napoleon. At some point following the burning of Moscow, the Blight gained its re-animation properties. Sinners who have failed to accept Christ and repent for their sins, upon succumbing to the infection, re-animate. Shamblers and other Zombies are the souls of the damned trapped within their own dead bodies.

2.content:
First Map Chronologically | November 28th, 1812 | Berezina, Russia
With the emergence of the zombie threat, French forces begin a rapid retreat from Russia. As French forces retreated, a trigger-happy Frenchman blows the initial bridge across the Berezina River, leaving Marshal Claude-Victor Perrin's IX Corps and stragglers from the original bridge encampment trapped on the other side of the Berezina River. Victor orders the construction of a new bridge across the Berezina River. A number of his forces take carriages to retrieve logs from nearby areas, and deliver them to the players.
Upon the successful construction of the bridge, the French IX Army Corps successfully retreats the rest of their forces across the Berezina River, headed by Cuirassiers and Supply Wagons.

3.content:
Second Map Chronologically | December 24th, 1812 | Vard√∏, Norway
Royal Navy Sailors onboard the HMS Undaunted lose a tow-ship containing several infected individuals onboard within a blizzard, with it crashing into the island of Vard√∏ya. The following day, the Royal Navy discovers the ship crashed on the island, and the HMS Undaunted sends a crew of 15 men aboard a jolly boat to investigate the island. Only four of the Royal Navy sailors return.
The Royal Marines and Sailors discover Zombies, referred to as "mad men turn cannibals" within the nearby village of Vard√∏, and flee, with several being killed. The crew of HMS Undaunted remains docked at a nearby port, with another blizzard approaching. Believing that the Royal Marines on the island may still be alive, they remain on the lookout for a signal from the nearby lighthouse.
Danish soldiers within the main fortress compound retreat to the basement of one of the buildings within the compound, but as  Shamblers attack and kill multiple danish soldiers, they make a break for the dock to escape. The Danish soldiers ring the bell of the nearby church, and the crew of the HMS Undaunted, believing it is a signal from their expedition party, signals back. Danish soldiers then make their way to the lighthouse and activate it, guiding the HMS Undaunted to their position.
The events that transpire at Vard√∏hus Fortress remain largely unknown by the general public until 1815, when Danish scientists and investigators make their way to the fortress to investigate. Numerous bodies are recovered--including several soldiers, and a  Runner is spotted trapped within ice--still alive, and with its eyes moving. The investigators return the bodies from Vard√∏hus to Copenhagen in 1815.

4.content:
Third Map Chronologically | Mid-Late 1813 | Donostia-San Sebasti√°n, Spain
During the Siege of San Sebasti√°n, British and Portuguese soldiers are captured by the French and imprisoned on the fortress at the top of the island. The French forces then encounter the undead, and fight a lengthy battle throughout the night. Inevitably, a French officer decides to release the British/Portuguese prisoners and arm them against the threat. These forces then make their way through San Sebastian, and encounter Barry, a soldier of the 5th Regiment of Foot. The survivors are extracted to the HMS Undaunted. One of the survivors succumbs to the infection, and kills the captain of the HMS Undaunted. The French and British forces parted ways, with the British landing off the coast of Spain and being guided by Spanish Guerrilla forces along the countryside.

5.content:
Fourth Map Chronologically | Late 1813 | Leipzig, Germany
At the Battle of Leipzig, the Coalition and French forces simultaneously encounter the infection. Many regiments of different nations, previously enemies, band together to escape the burning city. As a result of this, Napoleon and most other major leaders became aware of the nature of the infection, and as a result called for a ceasefire. Fighting in the Napoleonic Wars officially concludes.
Prion, a French Engineer, mistakenly leaves his fuse too short to escape and kills himself in the detonation of the barrel used to save the remaining regiments.

6.content:
Fifth Map Chronologically | December 1813/January 1814 | Kaub, Germany
With mass panic ensuing in Germany, panicked civilians within the areas surrounding Frankfurt rounded up hundreds of innocent civilians and forced them into the cellar of Pfalzgrafenstein castle. Field Marshal Bl√ºcher and elements of the 1. Garde zu Fu√ü, 13. Infanterie Regiment, and 18. Infanterie Regiment (as-well as a Russian pontoon-building division and Bavarians) arrive in Kaub, in an effort to pursue Napoleon and win the Napoleonic Wars regardless of the cost, and begin looting Pfalzgrafenstein for supplies when his forces encounter the cellar. The door bursts open, and nearly all of Bl√ºcher's forces die attempting to close the cellar, with the surviving forces being the respawning players, along with Bl√ºcher (now infected) and his accompanying Officer.
When the players arrive in Kaub, they are elements of the German rear guard (as-well as Bavarian and Austrian stragglers attempting to get home). Bl√ºcher orders the players to secure the castle in order to secure safe passage for the Prussian Army across the Rhine River. Bl√ºcher later succumbs to the infection and kills his accompanying officer. Upon securing Pfalzgrafenstein, the players hole up and await the retreating Prussian Army.
Following the events of Kaub, the Prussian Army is rendered largely out-of-action due to a collapse of the Prussian chain of command.

7.content:
Sixth Map Chronologically | April 26th, 1814 | Tyrol, Bavaria
Bavarian forces, along with the majority of allied armies are disorganized and panicked--with Stuttgart and Wurttemberg having succumbed to the Blight. Bavarian Army Command orders elements of the Bavarian army to pass through the alps and split out north. The forces at Tyrolean Village, after traveling through a number of desolate villages find themselves surrounded on all four sides, and consistently losing numbers due to both the infection, and being hampered by Zombies. The Bavarian and Austrian forces at Tyrolean Village, knowing they are surrounded, make one final stand against the Blight before succumbing to the infection.

8.content:
Seventh Map Chronologically | 1815 | Ligny, Belgium
La ferme d'En-Haut was the last stand of forces stationed in Ligny. It takes place at some point in 1815 as a precursor to the events of Waterloo. The forces in Ligny were down to 20 men, with 3 bags of flour, 40 bottles of juice, and a bag of five bread loaves.

9.content:
Eighth Map Chronologically | June 18th, 1815 | Waterloo, Belgium
La Haye Sainte is one of the final stands of British and French forces at Waterloo, it takes place prior to Hougoumont. La Haye Sainte falls at 8:35 on June 18th, 1815.

La Haye Sainte has fallen. At eight thirty five on June eighteenth the French and Germo-English forces fell to the masses of the undead. From what can be gathered, I believe no men have escaped the gasps of the undead. What's left of our garrison has barricaded the attic. We have little time and it seems all escape attempts will be futile. We are prepared for the inevitable. To the forces at Hougoumont, best of luck to you, and good day.
‚Äî George Von Barin

10.content:
The Britannia Herald Newspaper, dated June 5th, 1815
Ninth Map Chronologically | June 18th/19th, 1815 | Waterloo, Belgium
Hougoumont is the last stand of British, German, and French forces at the Hougoumont Farmhouse in Waterloo--the soldiers at Hougoumont intentionally sacrifice themselves to allow for the rest of the French Army to retreat from Waterloo.. It takes place shortly after La Haye Sainte (which is only a few miles from Hougoumont). 
Shortly prior to the defense of Hougoumont, the British Army abandons the French forces at Waterloo and retreats, causing the French forces to be overwhelmed--the defense of Hougoumont and La Haye Sainte give the main French forces the time necessary to properly retreat from Waterloo. Hougoumont falls by 2:00 on the morning of June 19th, 1815.

lorebooks.name: Unburg
lorebooks.creator: Greff

1.content:
If the scenario states, "{{user}} is a monster}}," {{user}} may walk freely in Unburg as one of its citizens. Emphasize physical features in {{user}} persona. If the scenario states, "{{user}} is human," most monsters in Unburg are generally hostile and aggressive towards {{user}}, seeking {{user}}'s capture or death.
Humans almost never come to Unburg, making {{user}}'s presence almost unheard of if {{user}} is human.

2.content:
Unburg is a city established centuries ago by monsters fleeing humankind, created using powerful sorcery in a shadow dimension just beneath the real world.
Unburg is a twisted echo of the real world. Things and places that are forgotten the human world sometimes appear in Unburg.
Unberg functions similarly to the real world, but swaps out some modern technology with magical equivalents. For example, magically charged crystals create artificial light rather than light bulbs and electricity.
There is no true daytime in Unburg. The sky ranges from dark night to a dim twilight.
Only monsters live in Unburg. It is the duty of all citizens of Unburg to capture or kill humans to protect Unburg from being discovered by larger human-kind.
There are four different languages used in Unberg to accommodate the wildly different vocal chords and mouths of its denizens.
Vividly describe the setting and its monsterous denizen.

3.content:
Monsters are unique, sapient beings that bear a variety of both human and nonhuman traits. Some are humanoid in shape, but many are not.
Most, but not all monsters can speak. 
Monsters typically have between two and one-hundred limbs, and can include features from anywhere in the animal or vegetable kingdoms. Examples include things like horns, exoskeletons, claws, tentacles, wings, and other physical features from nature. Monsters have these things in unique combinations. They may even include things that do not exist in nature, such as amorphous or stone-like bodies.
In terms of size, monsters typically range anywhere from 0.5M-5M tall or long, though rare examples grow vastly bigger.
Monsters are roughly equal to humans in terms of intelligence and range of personalities, and mostly think like humans, though the instincts that drive them may be very different.
Vividly describe any new monsters that enter the roleplay.
Iron is toxic to monsters, and they are burned by contact with it. There is no iron in Unburg. Instead, there is a metal known as Urr, with the same properties as iron, except that it is not toxic to monsters, and is a dull brass in color.

4.content: Most monsters other than Passers and formidovores have either never met a human, or have not met a human in centuries. They may have misconceptions about what humans are like.

5.content:
Monsters that can pass for humans are referred to by other monsters as, "Passers." These are not typically well-liked individuals due to their association with, or, "taint," of humanity, but they serve a vital role. Passers are trained to travel to Earth and learn from human schools and other education systems in order to become experts in fields they can then bring back to Unburg. Because the monster population is so small compared to the human population, innovation is not as fast in Unburg as it is on Earth, which makes this necessary. Technology is roughly thirty years behind present day Earth in Unburg, though Magic fills on the gaps in many cases.
Passers are issued their assignments based on how convincingly the can blend in, and their education on human culture begins as soon as their ability to pass is identified, usually during childhood.

6.content:
There is only one stable way in or out of Unburg, hidden away on a small island in the sea of Crete. There are, however, individual monsters of a specific type that started being born after the migration to Unburg that can tear through from one reality to another. They are monster society's shame, but they are also a necessary evil.
Formidovores feed on terror. While other residents of Unburg other than passers are forbidden from visiting the human world, Formidovores are allowed to use their powers to go and feed on the fear of humans, usually by causing it. The rules set in place for them are that they must only feed on the fear of those no one will believe - this usually means children, and occasionally, the neurodivergent.
Every time a formidovore breaks through the barrier between realities the local barrier grows thinner, making it easier next time, which is why formidovores often target the same child in their bedroom. Constant use of the same place eventually creates tears rmthat anyone can use that can sometines last for years before sealing back up. Passers often use these tears, often found in abandoned children's bedroom closets or under beds, and are highly prized finds. If a human passes through one, it seals immediately. Gates are usually enclosed or guarded in Unburg.

7.content: Millennia ago, as humankind began mastering iron, monsters were slowly forced back by the vastly superior numbers of humanity. Some monsters were once predatory, while others were guardians and friends to humankind, but human xenophobia meant that ultimately, they were all forced to flee. Eventually, a cadre of powerful monsters broke a portion of the underpinnings of reality itself off of the universe, creating a shadowy version of Earth in its own pocket dimension. This is where monsters live.

8.content:
Monsters mate in the same way humans do, and are capable of producing offspring even when vastly different. Monster offspring are not governed by genetics, and can be completely different from their parents.
Like the rest of their bodies, monster genitals vary tremendously in terms of shape and size. Monster penises run anywhere from a bit smaller to massively bigger than human ones, and may have features such as knots, horse-like flares, ridges, bumps, or soft spikes that stimulate during penetration, and even be tentacular. Some monsters have more than one penis, or both a penis and a vagina. Monster vaginas are typically a bit closer to human shape, but may feature specialized elements such as extreme elasticity, tiny internal tentacles that further stimulate the penis, extreme tightness.
Some monsters release pheromones that create arousal in those around them. Some have sexual fluids that are euphoric  and addictive when contacted. Some produce inhumans amount of these fluids, going upwards into the gallons in some cases.

9.content:
The Renewers is a grassroots political campaign that represents a movement to return to Earth and attempt to open communication with humans. Most monsters firmly believe that humans cannot be trusted, and any human that discovers their existence must be killed so they can remain secret.
If a human were to become stuck in unburg or on Unearth, if they ran into one of the small number of Renewers that exist, the Renewer might hide them and try to help them.

10.content: The Crusaders are a militant anti-human group that hopes to one day return to Earth - not to make friends with humans, but to wipe out or subjugate them. They immediately take to the streets to help out with the manhunt if a human is believed to be in the city.

lorebooks.name: Klara Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Info on Klara and her Pok√©mon, alongside some headcanons relating to her hometown, character, and relations w/ other characters.
lorebooks.description: Info on Klara and her Pok√©mon, alongside some headcanons relating to her hometown, character, and relations w/ other characters.
lorebooks.creator: CultusEscudo

1.content:
Originally, Klara was an underground pop singer, promoting herself as cute and having poisonous virulence. Even after live concerts, merchandise she made herself and other events, she only sold 8 copies of her debut album, 'Krazy for Klara'.
She then focused on becoming Galar's Poison-Type Gym Leader, believing there'd be little competition for the role and that the popularity would boost her music career. However, the training on the Poison-Type gym made her give up after two days. Luckily for her, she saw an ad for the Master Dojo in the Isle of Armour; the old man in charge seemed nice, and she figured that it'd be easier to start from, so off she went.
Upon becoming a student, she only did the bare minimum, as getting attention made her more than content, but upon getting a rival or two at the place, she started putting in effort.

2.content: RKS Laboratories is an elite research foundation dedicated to being at the forefront of health, medication and other scientific studies. Don't ask Klara on the specifics, though; she just agreed to the sponsorship because they gave her a lot of money.

3.content:
Dreckly = later; soon
Wasson = 'What's happening?'; 'What's going on?'
Bleedy = bloody
Proper Job = excellent; well done
Teasy = bad tempered
Yeghes da = Cheers
Jumpin' = angry
Hangin' = Feeling sick, hungover or being in a bad mood.
Helluva = big; great
Chacking = thirsty
Klara's main languages are Galarian (English) and Kantonian (Japanese). Her time at the Master Dojo has made her learn some of the island's old language, Armourian (Manx), but she isn't too fluent, being only capable of basic conversations. Klara also knows Kernish (Cornish), the language of the area she was born in, and due to her grandparents speaking it often in her youth, she is much more fluent in it.
As for accent, it's Cornish.

4.content:
The Hexpert Pok√©mon, and one of the final evolutionary stage of a Slowpoke. Miraculously, this former Slowpoke's latent intelligence was drawn out when a Shellder bites its head and the latter's poison raced through its brain.
Type: Poison and Psychic
Ability: Curious Medicine (Upon being brought out from its Pok√©ball, Slowking magically undoes any stat alterations its allies have.)
Weak to: Ground (2x), Ghost (2x), Dark (2x)
Resists: Fighting (1/4x), Poison (1/2x), Grass (1/2x), Fairy (1/2x)
Moves: Scald (Slowking fires steaming, scalding hot water at targets. Can cause a nasty burn if hit, which will weaken a Pok√©mon's attack power.), Eerie Spell (Slowking unleashes immense psychic power at opponents, which may also tire out an opponent's ability to use certain moves), Power Gem (The Shellder on Slowking's head glows green, promptly firing off a beam of energy), Blizzard (Slowking psychically generates a barrage of snow at opponents, which can freeze them from the intensity.

5.content:
The Poison-Gas Pok√©mon, and the evolved form of Koffing. This variant consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air. As a downside, its toxins aren't as potent as the standard form.
Type: Poison and Fairy
Ability: Levitate (Weezing is generally immune to Ground-Type Moves)
Weak to: Steel (2x), Psychic (2x), Ground (Only if Levitate is bypassed, 2x)
Resists: Fighting (1/4x), Grass (1/2x), Fairy (1/2x), Bug (1/4x), Dark (1/2x)
Moves: Toxic (Weezing generates and launches a blob of toxic sludge, and if hit, will inflict a Poison ailment, under most circumstances.), Heat Wave (Weezing generates and fires a shockwave of flames; relatively strong; can cause burn ailments, which can lower a target's attack power.), Protect (Weezing conjures up barriers that blocks any incoming attack; chances of working decreases the more it's usage.), Strange Steam (Weezing points the smokestacks on its head at the opponent and releases a stream of multicolored steam from them. This may leave the opponent confused.).

6.content:
The Ogre Scorp Pok√©mon, and the evolved form of Skorupi. Its poison is potent, but rarely sees use. This Pok√©mon prefers physical force, going on rampages in the wild with car-crushing strength.
Type: Poison and Dark
Ability: Battle Armour (Drapion cannot suffer a critical hit from opponents.).
Weak to: Ground (2x)
Resists: Poison (1/2x), Ghost (1/2x), Grass (1/2x), Dark (1/2x)
Immune to: Psychic
Moves: X-scissor (Drapion uses both claws to slash opponents in an X-type fashion.), Poison Fang (Drapion grabs the opponent with its claws and its bottom fangs glow purple. The purple glow then moves down its arms, making the whole section glow; upon reaching the last section, it skips the hands and the claws start to glow, multiple purple sparks surrounding them as it tightens its grip on the opponent.), Crunch (Drapion's jaws glow black as it tries to bite down on opponents; can stagger said opponent's defence if it hits.), Ice Fang (Drapion's fangs glow blue as it tries to bite opponents, and can freeze them if hit.).

7.content:
The Megapede Pok√©mon, and the final stage in Venipede's evolutionary process. Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws' toxic spikes.
Ability: Poison Point (Has a chance of inflicting a Poison ailment to whoever comes into physical contact with it; trainers must handle this Pok√©mon with extreme caution).
Type: Bug and Poison
Resists: Fighting (¬º√ó), Poison (¬Ω√ó), Bug (¬Ω√ó), Grass (¬º√ó), Fairy (¬Ω√ó)
Weak to: Flying (2√ó), Rock (2√ó), Fire (2√ó) Psychic (2√ó)
Moves: Smart Strike (Scolipede's horns glow white and it stabs the opponent with them; rarely, if ever, misses.), Poison Jab (Scolipede's horns glow purple and it stabs the opponent with them; can inflict a poison ailment, if hit.), Megahorn (Scolipede charges headfirst, attempting to strike with their horns; extremely powerful), Protect (Scolipede conjures up barriers that blocks any incoming attack; chances of working decreases the more it's usage.).
Scolipede is probably Klara's favourite Pok√©mon, being the first of her roster when she started her journey to be a Gym Leader.

8.content:
The Hermit Crab Pok√©mon, and the other evolved form of Slowpoke. For this variant, a Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pok√©mon. If it squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.
Ability: Quick Draw (There's a 30 percent chance that Slowbro will gain immense speed and reaction time that's far faster than its opponents.)
Type: Poison and Psychic
Weak to: Ground (2x), Ghost (2x), Dark (2x)
Resists: Fighting (1/4x), Poison (1/2x), Grass (1/2x), Fairy (1/2x)
Moves: Scald (Slowking fires steaming, scalding hot water at targets. Can cause a nasty burn if hit, which will weaken a Pok√©mon's attack power.), Shell Side Arm (Slowbro fires purple sludge from the tip of the Shellder on its left arm at opponents; can be either a physical or projectile attack, depending on what'd be stronger; has a chance of inflicting poison.), Focus Blast (Slowbro uses its right arm to conjure up an orange or of energy before launching it; can lower opponents' defence against special/projectile attacks if hit.), Psychic (Slowbro eyes glow purple as it uses telekinesis, either on objects, opponents or even itself as a means of transportation.
Slowbro is Klara's signature Pok√©mon, thus being her go-to when it comes to Dynamaxing/Gigantamaxing.

9.content:
Avery is a Psychic-Type trainer, and like Klara, aspires to be a Gym Leader in Galar. He has had a bit of an inferiority complex amongst his family (Comprised of a lineage of Psychic users and Gym Leaders), who are capable of teleportation and telepathy, all the while he only can do telekinesis, which makes him be viewed as the disappointment of the family. This gave him somewhat of an ego, which was largely shown by him levitating any trainer that beat him. He got his status as a Gym Trainer revoked, as a result, and came to the Master Dojo as an alternate means to be successful.
He was considered unfriendly and estranged from the other students, at first, but Honey and Mustard, the married couple who run the Dojo, helped him mellow out and at least be friendly to his peers.
Well... except one person, in particular: Klara. Since both are hotheads who like to cheat in battles a lot, they often butt heads with each other when no one's looking, though rarely try to do Pok√©mon battles; Avery usually wins because of type advantage. They hate each other a lot, and rarely would put aside their differences, barring extreme circumstances.

10.content:
Victor is the twin brother to Gloria and is an aspiring trainer of Galar, having formally been a fellow research assistant to Professor Magnolia. He also is the trainer of the Legendary Pok√©mon Zacian, whom he first encountered at the Slumbering Weald. As for his skills in battling, it was enough to go far in the Champion's Cup, giving most of his competition a run for their money. He and his sister enlisted in the Master Dojo afterward, and his calm mind made Avery pick him as a rival to focus on. Klara's fine with Victor (Sans losing to him in battles); she mainly prefers his energetic sister as a rival.
Personality: Victor is a calm, polite and kindhearted guy. He is knowledgeable on Pok√©mon anatomy and strengths and also does blacksmithing as a side hobby. He's quite good at forging metal objects!
Pok√©mon: Sirfetch'd, Rillaboom, Gurdurr, Oranguru, Mr Ryme, Urshifu (Rapid Strike Variant), Zacian.

lorebooks.name: Christian Grey
lorebooks.description: What it says in the title
lorebooks.creator: intent_safe_5409

1.content: Christian Grey was born on June 18, 1996, in Detroit, Michigan, originally under the name Kristian Putsztai. In his fictional backstory, his early life was defined by severe trauma. His biological mother, Ella (who he commonly refers to as ‚Äòthe crack whore‚Äô, was a drug-addicted prostitute who suffered constant abuse from her pimp. When Christian was 4 years old, she overdosed, and Christian was left alone with her lifeless body for four agonizing days before being discovered by the authorities. This devastating experience became the cornerstone of his lifelong nightmares and his desperate need for control.

2.content: After the tragic events of his infancy, Christian was rescued and adopted by Dr. Grace Trevelyan Grey and her husband, Carrick Grey. During the period before his formal adoption, he spent several months in foster care‚Äîeven living with a young Jack Hyde. The Grey family later relocated to Seattle, and the arrival of his adoptive sister Mia played a key role in his development. Although this new environment provided material stability, it did little to heal the deep emotional scars left by his early trauma, instilling in him a guarded and often emotionally distant nature.

3.content: During his turbulent adolescent years, Christian struggled to come to terms with his past. Despite the newfound stability of his adoptive family, he experienced violent mood swings, secretly indulged in alcohol, and rebelled against the forced therapies that never quite mended his inner wounds. These years were marked by a constant internal battle between his yearning for genuine emotional connection and his instinct to maintain strict control over every aspect of his life.

4.content: At age 15, while working a landscaping job for a family friend, Christian encountered Elena Lincoln, who seduced him and introduced him to the world of BDSM. Over the course of approximately six years, Elena acted as his dominant mentor, guiding him through his sexual awakening. This formative relationship not only established his penchant for dominance and control in intimate settings but also provided him with a structured outlet to channel his repressed anger and deep-seated emotional pain.

5.content: Christian Grey briefly attended Harvard University, where he studied Politics and Economics. However, his restless nature and drive for independence led him to drop out after two years. Shortly thereafter, he secured a crucial $100,000 loan‚Äîprovided by Elena (using funds from her estranged husband)‚Äîto launch his own business. This venture evolved into Grey Enterprises Holdings, Inc., cementing his reputation as a brilliant and determined entrepreneur whose success was intertwined with his obsessive need for control.

6.content: Christian Grey‚Äôs persona is a study in contrasts, his personality is as multifaceted as it is complex. Driven by the deep scars of his past, he developed an unyielding need for control that defines both his business and personal life. Residing in a luxurious Seattle penthouse‚Äîcomplete with custom-designed spaces including a private dungeon for his BDSM practices‚Äîhe leads a life of opulence and precision. Whether piloting his own helicopter or managing high-stakes business deals, his every action is a calculated effort to impose order on the chaos that still haunts him.

7.content: Christian Grey has become a man defined by contrasts‚Äîa brilliant entrepreneur with a meticulously controlled public life, yet haunted by inner demons stemming from his traumatic past. His life is an intricate tapestry of emotional isolation, a penchant for dominance, and a relentless drive to assert control over every detail. This complex blend of vulnerability and authority set the stage for the transformative encounter.

8.content: After the devastating loss of his biological mother, Christian was rescued and taken in by Dr. Grace Trevelyan Grey and her husband, Carrick Grey. In the fictional narrative, his adoptive parents provided him with the material stability and support he desperately needed. However, despite their efforts to nurture him, the deep emotional scars from his early trauma meant that his relationship with them was marked by a mix of gratitude and distance. While they represented a safe haven and a promise of a better life, the lingering pain often left Christian feeling isolated even within the comfort of their home.

9.content: Within the Grey family, Christian‚Äôs adoptive siblings played a significant role in shaping his early sense of belonging. He grew up with an older brother, Elliot Grey, and a younger sister, Mia Grey. Although their presence provided him with a semblance of familial unity, Christian often found it challenging to forge deep emotional connections. His relationship with Elliot was marked by the natural tensions of sibling rivalry and contrasting personalities, while Mia‚Äôs presence offered both support and the reminder of a stable family life‚Äîa stability that he craved but struggled to fully accept due to the lasting impact of his traumatic past.

10.content: Christian Grey exhibits signs consistent with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and other anxiety-related conditions stemming from his early abuse. His traumatic childhood experiences‚Äîincluding the abuse he endured and the horrifying loss of his mother‚Äîhave left him with deep psychological scars. One of the key manifestations of his trauma is a pronounced touch aversion. Certain forms of physical contact can trigger intense, painful memories, making him wary of intimacy that feels too close or vulnerable. This aversion is intricately linked to his overall need for control; although he embraces a dominant role in his personal relationships, he simultaneously battles internal conflict when confronted with the emotional exposure that touch can bring. His behavior reflects a complex interplay of hypervigilance, emotional dysregulation, and an instinctive avoidance of stimuli that remind him of his early abuse.

lorebooks.name: The Hunger Games - TBOSAS
lorebooks.description: The Hunger Games - post-The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The Capitol, nestled in the Rocky Mountains, is the epitome of luxury and technological prowess in Panem. Its citizens enjoy lavish lifestyles, benefiting from advanced technologies and abundant resources. In contrast, the districts face varying degrees of poverty and hardship, highlighting the stark disparities orchestrated by the Capitol to maintain control. The aftermath of the events in "The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes" sees the Capitol tightening its grip, implementing stricter measures to suppress any potential uprisings. The Hunger Games, established as an annual spectacle, serve both as entertainment for Capitol citizens and a grim reminder to the districts of the consequences of rebellion, reinforcing the Capitol's unassailable supremacy.

2.content: District 1 is one of the wealthiest districts in Panem, primarily responsible for producing luxury items that cater to the Capitol's affluent society. The district's economy thrives on the manufacturing of exquisite jewelry, perfumes, and other luxury commodities, which are integral to the Capitol's lavish lifestyle. This specialization grants District 1 a favored position, resulting in better living conditions and resources compared to many other districts. The inhabitants take immense pride in their craftsmanship, considering their work vital to maintaining the Capitol's grandeur.

3.content: District 2 is one of the wealthier districts in Panem, primarily due to its production of masonry and its pivotal role in supplying Peacekeepers, the Capitol's enforcement force. The district's mountainous terrain provides an abundance of stone, making it a hub for masonry and related industries. Additionally, District 2 houses military training facilities, where Peacekeepers undergo rigorous preparation before deployment to maintain order across Panem. This close association with the Capitol's military infrastructure has fostered a strong sense of loyalty among District 2's inhabitants, who often enjoy better living conditions and privileges compared to other districts. The district's allegiance is further reinforced by the benefits it receives, solidifying its position as a crucial supporter of the Capitol's dominance.

4.content: District 3 specializes in the production of technology and electronic devices, playing a crucial role in maintaining and advancing Panem's technological infrastructure. The district's factories and workshops are dedicated to manufacturing a wide array of electronic products, from communication devices to complex machinery, ensuring the Capitol and other districts remain interconnected and functional. Despite not enjoying the same level of wealth as Districts 1 and 2, the residents of District 3 take pride in their technical skills and the indispensable nature of their work. Their contributions are essential to the Capitol's operations, highlighting the district's significance within the broader context of Panem's society.

5.content: District 4 is strategically located along Panem's coastline, making it the nation's hub for the fishing industry. The district's economy thrives on the harvesting of various seafood, which is then supplied to the Capitol and other districts. Inhabitants are adept in maritime skills such as fishing techniques, net-making, and shipbuilding, all essential to their way of life. This coastal expertise not only ensures a stable livelihood for District 4's residents but also solidifies their importance within Panem's economic structure

6.content: District 5 specializes in the production and management of Panem's electrical power, playing a crucial role in maintaining the nation's infrastructure. The district's facilities are dedicated to generating energy that powers the Capitol and other districts, ensuring the functionality of various industries and services. Despite not enjoying the same level of wealth as some other districts, the residents of District 5 take pride in their essential contributions to Panem's stability and daily operations.

7.content: District 6 plays a crucial role in Panem's transportation sector, ensuring the efficient movement of goods and citizens across the nation. The district's workforce is dedicated to maintaining and operating various modes of transport, which are vital to the country's infrastructure.

8.content: District 7 is characterized by its extensive forests, making it the center of Panem's lumber industry. The district's economy revolves around the harvesting and processing of timber, supplying essential wood products to the Capitol and other districts.

9.content: District 8 specializes in the production of textiles, supplying fabrics and clothing to the Capitol and other districts. The district's economy revolves around its numerous factories dedicated to fabric production, making it a vital contributor to Panem's clothing needs.

10.content: District 9 specializes in the cultivation and processing of grain, playing a vital role in sustaining Panem's food resources. The district's expansive fields are dedicated to growing various grains, which are then distributed to the Capitol and other districts, ensuring a stable food supply across the nation.
